Passionately Character-Building & Innovative School in the Middle East Sunmarke provides an ambitious and inspiring values-based education nurturing the hearts and minds of young boys and girls so that they can flourish and achieve their dreams. Simply put, we transform young lives. Powered by our unique, leading-edge Signature Programmes, we are an incredibly innovative school reshaping and inspiring tomorrow‚Äôs generation. We are amongst the top 5 schools in Dubai, as seen by our outstanding IB and A-Level results, top university placements, and notable student achievements in the arts, sports, and extracurriculars. We are a recognised global leader in Positive Education ‚Äì a paradigm shift in education worldwide ‚Äì where it‚Äôs increasingly acknowledged that truly outstanding teaching and learning is only attained by developing ‚Äúacademic and personal excellence‚Äù as well as ‚Äúwell-being and character‚Äù. We are one of the few schools in the UAE to offer both the IB and A-Level curriculum pathways, as well as the BTECs. Backed by Fortes Education‚Äôs rich history of over 40 years in academia, Sunmarke is rated ‚ÄúOutstanding‚Äù by the British School Overseas Inspection Authority and ‚ÄúVery Good‚Äù by KHDA. Learn more Positive Education Internationally recognised for its holistic approach, the school blends wellbeing, character development, and Positive Psychology, nurturing resilient, empathetic, confident learners who thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. positive impact on society Integrity We believe in upholding the highest standards of ethical conduct in thought, word and deed Respect We recognise our differences as well as our commonalities and believe in treating one another with courtesy and respect Excellence We strive to be the best we can be and in giving our 100% British Values As a British Schools Overseas (BSO) accredited school, Sunmarke School is committed to upholding the values and standards of a world-class British education. This includes a strong focus on the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of our students, as well as the promotion of respect, tolerance, and responsibility. These principles align seamlessly with the values of the UAE, where respect for diversity and cultural understanding form the foundation of daily life. Together, these shared values shape our school community into one that is inclusive, aspirational, and globally minded. Rule of Law ‚Äì School policies, codes of conduct, and classroom expectations help pupils understand fairness, responsibility, and the importance of living within agreed rules, reflecting the laws of the UAE. Individual Liberty ‚Äì We encourage independence and student choice in learning, while ensuring safety and guidance so pupils understand the balance between rights and responsibilities. Mutual Respect ‚Äì Our Positive Education ethos, house system, and community partnerships promote kindness and respect in daily interactions across the school. Tolerance of Different Faiths and Beliefs ‚Äì We celebrate the UAE‚Äôs cultural and religious diversity, providing opportunities to learn about and respect different traditions while remaining rooted in our own values. Student Voice & Representation ‚Äì Pupils are given a voice through Student Council, Sports Leaders, and other leadership opportunities, ensuring they understand the importance of fairness, collaboration, and shared decision-making. Why Educate Your Child at Sunmarke? A Rigorous & Ambitious Education We offer rigorous, ambitious and holistic education emphasising academic excellence and participation in diverse extracurricular activities enabling children to achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success in a stimulating and supportive environment. Outstanding Senior Leaders & Teachers All our inspiring senior leaders, teachers and staff are trained in Positive Education and best practices in education, and are provided continuous professional development and training to keep abreast of the latest developments in pedagogy. Over Four Decades of History Built on the foundation of Fortes Education‚Äôs four decades of excellence in education, Sunmarke‚Äôs dynamic management team bring their rich experience and knowledge to deliver the best value-based education for students.

Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Principal‚Äôs Message About > Principal‚Äôs Message Principal‚Äôs Message Mr. Nicholas Rickford Welcome to Sunmarke School ‚Äì Where Amazing Happens It is with great pleasure that I welcome you to Sunmarke School, a place where tailored academic pathways, innovative Signature Programmes and a holistic approach to Positive Education converge to provide an outstanding educational experience for your child. At Sunmarke, we understand that every student is unique, with their own strengths, interests and aspirations. That is why we have developed a wide range of academic pathways that allow us to cater to the individual needs of every student. We are one of the very few schools to offer students the choice of A Level, IB Diploma, IB Career-related Programme and BTEC. By providing such enviable options and personalising learning experiences, we empower students to explore their passions and reach their full potential in a supportive and dynamic environment. One of our key areas of focus is Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics. Our STEAM and Design Thinking curriculum fosters creativity, critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Through hands-on projects, collaborative learning and exposure to real-world applications, Sunmarke students engage with virtual reality, learn how to code and develop the essential skills of tech literacy and digital fluency. As we prepare students for the future, we recognise the vital role that artificial intelligence (AI) plays in our society. We embrace AI, incorporating it into our curriculum and enabling learners to consider the limitless possibilities and ethical considerations associated with this transformative technology. Through our innovative AI programmes, students gain practical experience, develop computational thinking skills and become equipped to navigate the AI-driven world of tomorrow. Our other Signature Programmes provide further opportunities for Sunmarke students to explore their interests and talents in specialised areas. From Performing Arts, Media and Communication to the Global Language Academy and Environment and Sustainability (which includes the incredible Forest School), our signature offerings inspire students to delve deep into their passions, develop expertise and build a strong sense of compassion and social responsibility. At Sunmarke, we are extremely proud to offer a world-class, comprehensive Positive Education programme. We believe that academic success is intricately linked to emotional wellbeing, character development and the cultivation of positive relationships. Our PosEd framework fosters resilience, empathy and a growth mindset. Through mindfulness practices, character education and social-emotional learning, we enable all our students to thrive academically, emotionally and socially. I invite you to explore our website to learn more about our academic strengths, unrivalled Signature Programmes and Positive Education approach. We look forward to partnering with you in nurturing your child‚Äôs intellectual curiosity, fostering their passions and equipping them for the future. In joining Sunmarke, your family will become part of a forward-thinking, vibrant and welcoming community ‚ÄúWhere Amazing Happens‚Äù. Warm regards, Nicholas Rickford Principal

title: Sunmarke | Positive Education International School in Dubai
content: Sunmarke | Positive Education International School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login A Positive Education School About > A Positive Education School A Positive Education School A Philosophy Where Character Strengths Underpin Academic Excellence Truly outstanding education is not just about academic and personal achievements but also about the development of character, values, and wellbeing. This is the essence of Positive Education (PosEd). A scientifically-proven concept, PosEd is causing a paradigm shift in global education where parents, schools and governments realise the need to increase a child‚Äôs ‚Äòwellbeing‚Äô to raise his/her levels of ‚Äòachievement‚Äô. PosEd brings together the science of Positive Psychology combined with the best teaching practices to enable individuals, schools, and communities to flourish, be resilient, creative, successful and happy. Sunmarke ‚Äì A Character-Building School Multiple studies on the effects of PosEd testify that improved levels of a child‚Äôs wellbeing are associated with higher levels of academic engagement, social skills, optimism, behaviour, and fewer mental health-related issues. Positive Education ‚Äì Sunmarke‚Äôs DNA Positive Education (PosEd) is not an additional subject at Sunmarke but it‚Äôs woven into the fabric of the international school‚Äôs culture and is reflected in all its activities and teaching mechanisms. Sunmarke‚Äôs teachers undergo an intense training programme before entering the classroom where they learn, live, teach and embed Positive Education. This is what our teachers say about the Positive Education training they receive at Sunmarke: ‚ÄúWhere amazing happens. A motto that at first glance just appears to be some words to attract parents to send their children to Sunmarke school, almost like a gimmick. Over the past 3 days for me amazing did happen. The positive education training took me on a journey of self-discovery, showing me that changing my mindset can bring positive outcomes. I realized I have the power to make a difference in people‚Äôs lives. This training was the best I‚Äôve ever received from a school, as they genuinely cared about us, ensuring we could apply what we learned in teaching and at home. It was an incredible experience, especially since I used to dislike training due to its lack of usefulness. This was entirely different ‚Äì truly helpful, purposeful, and enlightening. It taught me to believe in the potential of education to inspire change.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe breadth of knowledge, evidence-based theories, outstanding coordination and delivery, and just everything about this week was outstanding! I was blown away in every way possible and feel so supported, valued, and appreciated.‚Äù The ‚ÄòFlourish‚Äô Model The 6 Key Skills Practised and Taught by Sunmarke Teachers for Students to Incorporate in Their Lives SUNMARKE'S WELLBEING & COUNSELLING TEAM Our PosEd and wellbeing approach fosters deep trust in our school community, creating a safe, welcoming and nurturing environment. We embed various initiatives into the daily routines, curriculum and extracurricular activities to establish a personal, social and academic support system each child needs to flourish. Class and Form Tutors, Heads of Year, and Subject teachers support students every day through direct teaching, mentoring, workshops and assemblies. The Counselling Department provides compassionate care for children who may require professional support and or simply a sympathetic listening ear. Students and parents both have access to a School Counsellor. A ‚ÄòWellbeing Champion‚Äô represents the school leadership in our Parent Association and ‚ÄòFriends of Sunmarke School‚Äô (FOSS) group while the popular monthly ‚ÄòWellness Wednesday‚Äô event raises awareness among parents about crucial topics like strength-based parenting, raising children in the digital age and health and nutrition. SUNMARKE'S SAFEGUARDING & CHILD PROTECTION TEAM Sunmarke has a designated Safeguarding and Child Protection Team with Child Protection Officers at every Key Stage in primary and secondary school. Click here for more information on our Safeguarding & Child Protection Team Safeguarding & Child Protection Policy We are also a certified school with the National Online Safety programme benchmarked to the best school safety standards in the UK. Please find more information about NOS here: https://nationalonlinesafety.com/

Be it academics, sports or creative arts, our children excel in competitions with primary and secondary schools in the region. The World‚Äôs Best Debater Title Sunmarke student, Carlota Figueroa Ortiz, won the World‚Äôs Best Individual Debate title competing against 4,100 scholars from around the world. It was an astounding achievement for our talented scholar who displayed all qualities of a future leader. The Nikon Choice Award Winner Sixth Form student Ayusha Roy, received the Nikon Choice Award in the ‚ÄòLegacy of Zayed‚Äô Photography Competition 2018 for her work celebrating the timeless legacy of H.H. Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan and the impact he had on the UAE and its values. ‚ÄòOutstanding Pearson Learner Award‚Äô awarded to Sunmarke stars Sixth Formers, Abigail and Moiz received A* grades in Geography, Science and Statistics. Edexcel Pearson announced these students‚Äô qualification for the ‚ÄòOutstanding Pearson Learner Award 2017‚Äô in their subjects awarding them with the highest marks in the Middle East. School Awards & Recognitions Honours And Accolades For An Outstanding Institution Sunmarke School carries forward the legacy of excellence in education, established by Fortes Education. It is an honour and privilege for us to be recognised by distinguished platforms as we continue our incredible journey as one of the best international schools in Dubai. Each of these awards is a testament to the quality and dedication of our staff and students. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Schools Compared Sunmarke School has achieved remarkable recognition and distinction as a finalist in multiple prestigious categories at the Schools Compared Top School Awards. We take immense pride in being acknowledged as the ‚ÄòMost Innovative School in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô, the ‚ÄòBest Blended International Baccalaureate Curriculum School in the UAE 2023-24‚Äô, and the esteemed ‚ÄòBest Primary School Teacher of the Year 2023-24‚Äô. Furthermore, Sunmarke School‚Äôs exceptional performance has led to our selection as a shortlisted contender in various categories for the year 2023-24. These include the titles of ‚ÄòBest Blended International Baccalaureate School in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô, ‚ÄòBest British School in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô, ‚ÄòBest School for Post-16 Education in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô, ‚ÄòBest School for Technical Stream Vocational Education in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô, and ‚ÄòMost Innovative School in the United Arab Emirates‚Äô. Notably, Sunmarke School‚Äôs accomplishments extend beyond recent years. We have previously been recognised as a finalist for the ‚ÄòBest New School Award‚Äô 2018-19, the esteemed ‚ÄòPost 16 Award‚Äô 2018-19, and the prestigious ‚ÄòBest Technical Education Award‚Äô 2018-19 at the Schoolscompared Top School Awards. The International School Awards Sunmarke was a finalist in The International School Awards 2019 in the ‚ÄòInitiative to Support Inclusion‚Äô category for our peer-coaching sports programme, Sports Heroes Academy. Mother, Baby & Child We also won three Mother, Baby & Child Awards for ‚ÄòBest New School‚Äô, ‚ÄòBrand of the Year‚Äô and also the Silver for ‚ÄòSecondary School of the Year‚Äô 2018.

On our wellbeing page you will find articles, guided practices and information on varied subjects that will help you on your own wellness journey. FOR OUR STUDENTS School, studies, friendships, and relationships can be exciting, enjoyable, overwhelming, and stressful. It is incredibly important to take care of yourself physically through mindful eating, exercising, and getting enough sleep, as well as mentally from a social and emotional perspective. These mindful colouring sheets can be used as calming activities with you and your family DISCOVER MORE Try these breathing and brain break activities DISCOVER MORE FOR OUR PARENTS We understand that sometimes it takes a community to get it right. To ensure that our students have a comprehensive support system, we have compiled some helpful links and resources that will guide you in assisting your children with the various challenges they encounter, as well as the crucial practice of self-care. This resource aids children in expressing and recognising their emotions DISCOVER MORE This resource provides top tips when supporting children with anxiety DISCOVER MORE FOR OUR STAFF As educators and caretakers, the responsibility of health is not limited to others, it is as important to pay attention to your own physical, social and emotional wellbeing. Here are 6 exercises to try that will increase your positive emotions and wellbeing DISCOVER MORE Experience the power of gratitude. Download your own Gratitude Journal DISCOVER MORE Try this simple technique that takes just a few minutes, it can help an agitated student regain the state of mind needed for learning DISCOVER MORE Contacting The Wellbeing Team The Wellbeing Team at Sunmarke School are always here to assist you. Reach out to them by ‚Äò Contacting School Department ‚Äô and select your child‚Äôs name. The designated Wellbeing Department (EYFS/ Primary/ Secondary) for your child will then appear in the drop down menu, please type your message and submit. A member of the Wellbeing team will be in touch with you to see how they can best support you and your family.

content: Inclusion - Sunmarke School Dubai | National Curriculum of England Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department About > The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Making Learning Accessible To All Inclusivity is enshrined in Sunmarke‚Äôs ethos where we welcome a diverse range of learners from EYFS to Secondary. The Achievement Centre takes the lead in providing an inclusive education to students in close collaboration with parents, teachers and external specialists. ‚Äú Jayne West Head Of Inclusion Laila is a Global Ambassador representing sports for People of Determination worldwide. She was an outstanding member of the Secondary Life Skills Class, where she gained the qualifications to be accepted into Dubai College of Leisure and Tourism further education course. We are all very proud of her as she continues to inspire our students to believe in the dream!!! To facilitate the successful participation and progress of all learners, a range of additional provisions, subject to staffing and availability, are offered at no extra cost. They include, but are not limited to: Interventions for literacy Interventions for mathematics Speaking and listening Social skills Motor skills Directed studies Extra-curricular activities specific to students with SEND (Special Educational Needs & Disabilities) Commitment to Inclusion Our school is also an accredited centre for the BTEC Introductory Awards offering a wide range of both academic and vocational units including Business Administration, Media, Health and Fitness, Leisure and Hospitality. It has a highly successful SEND department which has been commended in our most recent DSIB (Dubai School Inspection Bureau) inspection. We have developed a reliable network of external providers, who parents can contract to provide specialist assessment and therapy services at Sunmarke. These include, but are not limited to: Comprehensive developmental and diagnostic assessment Psycho-educational assessment Behavioural assessment and intervention Occupational Therapy and Sensory Integration assessment and intervention Speech and Language Therapy assessment and intervention Personalised support from a 1:1 Learning Support Assistant Fortes English Language Programme The Fortes English Language Programme is an intensive programme of cross curricular, full immersion pedagogy, with a focus on academic English, alongside every day language and culture. Students learn language alongside new skills and all within a broad range of subjects and activities such as Art, Drama, PE and Sport, Music in addition to the usual core subjects. Students experience accelerated language acquisition and achieve a deeper understanding of subject-specific English across the curriculum. For more information about inclusion at Sunmarke, please download our Inclusion Policies and Inclusion Procedures below: Inclusion Policy Inclusion & Students of Determination Procedures Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and Optional Protocol Federal Law No. (29) of 2006 Concerning the Rights of People of Determination Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework 2017 Implementing the Education Policy Framework Dubai Inclusive Education Policy Framework 2017 (Arabic) Implementing the Education Policy Framework (Arabic) Advocating for inclusive education ‚Äì A GUIDE FOR PARENTS Law No. (2) of 2014 Concerning Protection of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in the Emirate of Dubai

title: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke
content: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai‚Äôs Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke‚Äôs campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS‚Äô unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child‚Äôs healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children‚Äôs imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‚Äòlearn through play‚Äô and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We‚Äôre committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‚ÄòTransition Days‚Äô children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child‚Äôs development and preparation for life in the modern world, it‚Äôs also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they‚Äôll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS‚Äô unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award ‚Äì Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. This accolade was presented by Her Excellency Shaikha Lubna Bint Khalid Al Qasimi, a prominent Emirati politician and a respected member of the Sharjah royal family. This recognition celebrates Mrs. Mankani‚Äôs extraordinary contributions to the education sector and her unwavering commitment to academic excellence and innovation. To read more about the Being She Awards in association with Gulf News and this inspiring event, please view the feature article here. Mother, Baby & Child Awards 2021-22 ‚Äì Gold Winners We are proud to announce that Jumeirah International Nurseries won the MBC Nursery of the Year 2021-22 Award . We thank all the JINS families who have showered us with so much love, our JINS team for their outstanding commitment, and most of all our amazing children for making each moment spent with them so special. The Bayut Awards We were nominated as the Best Nursery Chain in Dubai at the prestigious Bayut Awards 2021. These awards pay tribute to the vision of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President of UAE and Ruler of Dubai, towards making Dubai the happiest city in the world. The Readers Choice Award Jumeirah International Nurseries were proud winners of the Best Nursery 2018 Award by the Russian Emirates, Family and Kids Magazine. Edarabia ‚Äì Parents Choice Jumeirah International Nurseries received the ‚ÄòParents Choice‚Äô 2017 Award by Edarabia.com. DEWA Conservation Awards The Jumeirah International Nurseries Team won the DEWA Conservation Awards 2017 in the Nursery Category. Our staff and teachers are humbled with this accolade, and empowered to strive even harder to teach our children the importance of energy and water conservation. Enquire at Jumeirah International Nurseries

title: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke
content: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai‚Äôs Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke‚Äôs campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS‚Äô unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child‚Äôs healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children‚Äôs imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‚Äòlearn through play‚Äô and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We‚Äôre committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‚ÄòTransition Days‚Äô children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child‚Äôs development and preparation for life in the modern world, it‚Äôs also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they‚Äôll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS‚Äô unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award ‚Äì Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. This accolade was presented by Her Excellency Shaikha Lubna Bint Khalid Al Qasimi, a prominent Emirati politician and a respected member of the Sharjah royal family. This recognition celebrates Mrs. Mankani‚Äôs extraordinary contributions to the education sector and her unwavering commitment to academic excellence and innovation. Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Early Years Curriculum Learning > EYFS > Early Years Curriculum Early Years Curriculum Setting The Foundation For A Fulfilling Educational Journey Sunmarke‚Äôs Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) offers a broad and balanced curriculum for our youngest students aged 3 to 5 years, once again proving its credentials as one of the best British curriculum schools in Dubai. Children acquire new skills through 7 areas of learning and development. In the initial stages, three Prime Areas are in focus: Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language Development. Growing up, the Prime Areas help develop skills in 4 Specific Areas: Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Laying the Foundations for Lifelong Learning in FS1 and FS2 At Sunmarke, our Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS), comprising FS1 (Nursery) and FS2 (Reception) , offers a broad, balanced, and enriching curriculum for children aged 3 to 5. Rooted in the British curriculum and recognised as one of Dubai‚Äôs leading EYFS providers, our programme nurtures each child‚Äôs unique strengths and interests through play-based, inquiry-led learning. A Curriculum Designed Around the Whole Child The EYFS curriculum at FS1 and FS2 is structured around seven key areas of learning and development: Prime Areas (Early Focus): Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language These areas are particularly emphasised in FS1 , helping our youngest learners develop the essential foundations of confidence, relationships, movement, and communication. Specific Areas (Building on the Foundations): Literacy Mathematics Understanding the World Expressive Arts and Design As children progress into FS2 , these specific areas become more prominent, supporting emerging literacy and numeracy skills, creative expression, and a growing awareness of the world. Characteristics of Effective Learning Across FS1 and FS2, we recognise that children learn in different ways. The EYFS framework promotes three key learning characteristics: Playing and Exploring: Investigating and experiencing, ‚Äòhaving a go‚Äô Active Learning: Concentrating, persevering, and celebrating achievement Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing ideas, making connections, and problem-solving These traits guide how learning is planned and delivered across both FS1 and FS2, ensuring that each child‚Äôs development is supported in a way that reflects their interests, needs, and learning styles. Learning Through Play and Projects At Sunmarke, we view play as a powerful vehicle for learning in both FS1 and FS2. Our curriculum is intentionally designed to offer rich, purposeful play experiences that allow children to explore, imagine, and make sense of the world in a way that is meaningful to them. In FS1 , children are encouraged to investigate through hands-on exploration, sensory play, and open-ended experiences that develop early communication, social, and physical skills. As they transition into FS2 , children engage in more structured yet still playful learning that builds early literacy and numeracy skills while continuing to promote creativity and curiosity. Our project-based learning approach further enhances engagement. Each term, both FS1 and FS2 children explore exciting, inquiry-led themes such as ‚ÄúI Believe I Can Fly,‚Äù ‚ÄúSomewhere Out There,‚Äù and ‚ÄúUp, Up and Away.‚Äù These projects spark imagination and are shaped by the children‚Äôs own interests and questions, creating a deep sense of ownership and wonder. Whether FS1 children are building a fairy tale castle or FS2 pupils are investigating the planets, our environments are carefully curated to provide challenge, joy, and discovery. Through child-initiated and adult-guided activities, children develop critical thinking, collaboration, and communication‚Äîthe building blocks of future learning. A Holistic and Nurturing Approach At Sunmarke, we believe that every child in FS1 and FS2 is a unique individual. Our holistic approach to early education goes beyond academics to nurture each child‚Äôs emotional, social, physical, and intellectual development. We incorporate globally respected early years methodologies including elements of the Reggio Emilia philosophy , Montessori principles , and the Curiosity Approach . This eclectic framework values child-led exploration, independence, and a strong connection to the learning environment‚Äîcreating rich opportunities for discovery and expression. Our learning spaces are thoughtfully designed to be calm, beautiful, and engaging, reflecting the importance of the environment as the ‚Äòthird teacher‚Äô. Teachers and support staff observe closely, respond sensitively, and plan responsively to extend learning in authentic, meaningful ways. Strong partnerships with parents, a passionate team of educators, and a shared belief in the limitless potential of every child create a warm, supportive community. In FS1 and FS2, children feel safe, seen, and inspired‚Äîlaying a confident foundation for their journey through school and life. Characteristics of Effective Learning The characteristics of Effective Learning describe how children learn and respond to teaching in the Foundation Stage, a factor determined by their individual learning characteristic. Three traits of effective teaching and learning identified by the EYFS are: Playing and Exploring: Finding out, discovering, willing to ‚Äòhave a go‚Äô and playing with what they know Active Learning: Being involved and concentrating, trying and persevering, taking pleasure from achievements Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing their own ideas, making links and selecting their own ways to complete tasks 7 Curriculum Areas To enhance the learning experience and make it impactful, Sunmarke has selected 7 curriculum areas taught through unique projects and interests, most of which are child-initiated activities that incorporate elements of imagination, investigation and ‚Äòout of the box‚Äô ideas, concepts and solutions. The EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play which enhances critical thinking abilities, fuels risk-taking and creative skills. Examples of topics are ‚ÄòI believe I can fly‚Äô, ‚ÄòSomewhere out there‚Äô and ‚ÄòUp up and away.‚Äô The initiative EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play. Our teaching philosophy is designed to treat all children as unique individuals in their own right. Our holistic approach towards education ensures that parents/carers, class teachers, specialist teachers and learning assistants work very effectively together to support our firm belief that ‚Äòevery child is unique‚Äô. Our maxim is that happy and well-motivated children are good learners. The Foundation Stage is a safe, secure and friendly environment for our youngest children to gain confidence and independence, as they prepare for the next stage of schooling. It is a foundation for future learning. Characteristics of Effective Learning (CoEL) are a revived element in the current Early Years Foundation Stage Curriculum (EYFS). CoEL advocates that while planning and guiding children‚Äôs activities, practitioners must reflect on the different ways that students learn, and these lessons must be reflected in their practice.

Blending a range of outstanding Early Years practices from the best international schools, we commit to a child-initiated learning approach and a sophisticated play-based curriculum that enables students to fulfil their unique potential. Sunmarke‚Äôs Amazing Philosophy and Journey A- Autonomy: Children are central to everything we do; all projects stem directly from their interests. M ‚Äì Mindset: In line with Sunmarke‚Äôs ‚ÄòPositive Education‚Äô ethos, we teach children to have a ‚ÄòGrowth Mindset‚Äô, encouraging endless possibilities. A- Academics: We provide a broad, balanced yet innovative British curriculum based on the Early Years Foundation Stage, building the bedrock for the future. Z -Zest: Happiness is a key agenda at Sunmarke School; we truly believe that if a child is happy and enthusiastic, they learn better. I ‚Äì Individuality: Our personalised curriculum ensures every child‚Äôs individuality is recognised. Strong teacher/pupil relationships allows tutors to identify and cater to a child‚Äôs interests, strengths and challenges. N ‚Äì Nurture: We nurture every child to enable them to grow and reach their fullest potential. G ‚Äì Grow: Every child that enters EYFS has a special and incredible journey that helps them grow and develop into happy, healthy teens. Learning Through Play Imaginative and creative play is how children learn about the world. During imaginative play, they manipulate materials, express themselves verbally and non-verbally, plan, act, interact, react and try different roles. Learning is most effective when children participate in creative play with dolls, vehicles, blocks, rocks, cardboard, or boxes. Employing creative thinking while manipulating play dough, creating recipes by mixing dirt and water, working with art materials, splashing in puddles, or pretending to fly can further child development. Imagination fosters cognitive and social development by allowing children to contemplate different resolutions, thus boosting their self-confidence. Our Early Years Foundation Stage has been rated as ‚Äò Outstanding ‚Äô in the latest KHDA‚Äôs DSIB inspection report (2023-24) with ‚Äò Outstanding Personal Development & Learning Skills and Outstanding Curriculum and Curriculum Adaptation‚Äô.

of Innovative and Compelling Learning Opportunities Sunmarke‚Äôs Primary phase nurtures a child‚Äôs development in all aspects, with teachers committed to knowing your child as an individual and making them feel valued and respected. The British curriculum subjects are taught in a creative and engaging manner alongside the mandated UAE subjects, with students immersed in a STEAM curriculum that enables them to make purposeful connections between all areas of their learning. Thinking Skills Extensive facilities that befit great international schools, an engaging learning environment, future-focused programmes, rewards for achievements and individual attention help students build confidence. In Key Stage 1 (KS1), we nurture a growth mindset and introduce students to more formal learning. They achieve greater self-reliance, effective study habits and learn to work and collaborate with others. In Key Stage 2 (KS2), we foster confident and competent learners as well as good communicators. Students develop self-discipline and independence as well as respect, humility and compassion for others. Leadership Sunmarke places great importance in cultivating student leadership. From Year 1, children start to take responsibility for their own learning, become Lead Learners and develop resilience. Sunmarke students are trained to be leaders in every area of school life: Our Primary Head Boy and Girl are active participants in whole-school initiatives that influence policy Our House Captains instill a sense of pride and ambition in their fellow students Student Council representatives gauge pupil opinion and campaign for change Wellbeing Champions work to ensure students are safe and happy Our Eco-Warriors work tirelessly to ensure a cleaner, more sustainable future for us all Digital Learning Sunmarke sees technology as a useful tool to support learning. We believe in incorporating technology purposefully to enhance our students‚Äô autonomy, independence and learning experience. Towards this, our Primary students use iPads or tablets, interactive screens and a variety of AI apps. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Instilling social responsibilities in our students is important to Sunmarke. We want our children to grow into aware, responsible global citizens who develop empathy, cultural awareness, tolerance and a greater understanding of environment and sustainability concepts. This goes hand-in-hand with the character strengths that are an intrinsic part of our Positive Education approach. Here are a few examples of our past and continuing social initiatives to achieve these objectives: Our Eco-Warriors liaise with local environmental groups and charities to promote environmental awareness among their peers Every year group learns about sustainable living through growing and harvesting their own hydroponics STEAM projects are tailored to develop children‚Äôs understanding of social responsibility and designed to tackle real life social, environmental and economic issues Students take part in residential trips and charitable ventures such as The Shoebox Appeal and Emirates Red Crescent Ramadan food collections Students plan and execute entrepreneurial activities to raise money for worthwhile causes

Curriculum A Curriculum Underpinned by our Positive Education Ethos Philosophy At Sunmarke, we firmly believe in equipping our students with the skills they‚Äôll need in the ever-changing landscape of 21st Century thinking and work. We do this by empowering our students through an innovative and character-building education that inspires them to thrive and achieve with purpose. Our curriculum design serves to reflect this. Whilst maintaining academic rigour through the British National Curriculum, our holistic Positive Education ethos and ambitious commitment to innovative technology ensures our children achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success. Additionally, opportunities for Forest School lessons and outdoor learning are provided to all Primary students. Therefore, the drivers for our curriculum are based on two principles: all learning is purposeful with real-life application and context; and students can make connections across interdisciplinary skills. STEAM With the opening of our dedicated STEAM Centre, SPACE-X, and the addition of specialist resident design technology and computing teachers, we have redesigned our curriculum to take us from our thematic roots to design thinking, using the Stanford d.school approach below. Whilst English and maths remain explicitly on the timetable, children work on STEAM theme projects across science, design technology, engineering, the arts, maths and humanities, with the option to also make purposeful links to our UAE moral, social and cultural studies and Values in Action objectives . Living in the UAE, it is vital we also make purposeful links to our local surroundings, Islamic culture and Arabic language. This hands-on approach to problem-solving enables each STEAM theme to culminate in a proposed project which requires the students to design/make/create something which draws upon the knowledge and skills which they have learnt over the course of the project . During each STEAM project , each class will spend two weeks in SPACE-X, where the support of our specialists will enable children‚Äôs designs to come to life. Primary Core Subjects Primary Foundation Subjects English History Mathematics Geography STEAM (including science) Modern Foreign languages (MFL): French/Mandarin Arabic Art & Design Islamic Computing Values in Action/moral, social and cultural studies Music Physical Education (including swimming) In addition to the subjects above, Sunmarke offers a diverse range of sports, co-curricular and enrichment activities to supplement the academic programme.

Performing Arts A Creative Hub to Shape Students' Artistic and Aesthetic Sensibilities Our classes in music, art, computing, languages, PE and others are carefully planned to match each year group‚Äôs STEAM projects wherever possible. They also embrace our Positive Education ethos and make meaningful links with moral, social and cultural studies objectives. Students are taught to appreciate art and design from different periods, created by famous composers, engineers, linguists and sporting heroes. This enhances their knowledge of form, texture, pitch, tone, coding and robotics, pronunciation and composition, and timing and precision. These skills are further built upon in ECAs, including our Performing Arts elective that prepares students for the annual musical performance. Stimulating displays in classrooms and corridors result in widespread appreciation of their achievements and efforts throughout the year. Music There is something for everyone in Sunmarke‚Äôs music department. Our specialist music teachers ignite every child‚Äôs passion for music, be they a grade 7 pianist or an enthusiast in different musical genres. Students are encouraged to perform as much as possible: in assemblies, concerts, school productions ‚Äì our school is their stage! See the highlight pictures below from our previous musical, which brought High School Musical to life with our talented Primary students. Stay tuned for this year‚Äôs spectacular production of Roald Dahl‚Äôs Matilda the Musical ! Performances There are many opportunities for students to shine on stage at Sunmarke Primary, with a vibrant calendar of performances that celebrate creativity, confidence and collaboration. Each year, our students captivate audiences through a wide range of events: Winter Performances: Our Year 1 and 2 students take to the stage to share a heart-warming mix of songs, poems and dances, reflecting their learning journeys from Term 1. Snowmarke: A much-anticipated concert-style showcase, Snowmarke features selected students from Years 3 to 6 performing music, dance and drama with exceptional flair. Summer Showcases: Year 3 4 and 5 students take audiences on a musical journey inspired by their curriculum, with original performances that highlight their creativity and enthusiasm. Primary Musical: A highlight of the year, our annual musical sees Year 5 and 6 students audition, rehearse and perform in a full-scale production. Recent shows have included Beauty & The Beast , Peter Pan (and upcoming Matilda Jr) , demonstrating the incredible talent and commitment of our young performers.

Students will take part in a range of creative activities which support in fine motor development and handwriting skills. Mathletics Club An amazing opportunity for students to develop a lifelong love of maths through: Confidence with maths facts fluency Enjoyment of solving maths problems Tackling maths puzzles/games Fun with maths song and play Yoga & Mindfulness At Sunmarke, well-being and positivity are at the heart of everything we do. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn about the history and symbolism behind Arabic art and craft traditions, while developing your own creativity and imagination. Our club is a welcoming and inclusive community where you can express yourself, make new friends, and discover the joy of creating something beautiful with your own hands. Join us today and let your creativity soar! Emirati Culture club Are you fascinated by Emirati culture? Do you want to learn more about the traditions and customs of the United Arab Emirates? Look no further than our Emirati culture club! Our club is open to all students who are interested in exploring the unique and diverse culture of the UAE. Through engaging activities, discussions and events, we delve into various aspects of Emirati culture, including art, music, cuisine and more. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to connect with other students who share your interests, and learn from knowledgeable guest speakers and experts in the field. Whether you are a UAE national or an international student, our Emirati culture club is the perfect place for you to learn about and appreciate the rich cultural heritage of the UAE.

title: Secondary Schools - Best Secondary School in Dubai Near You
content: Secondary Schools - Best Secondary School in Dubai Near You Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Secondary > Our Approach Secondary School in Dubai Our Approach Our Secondary school is alive with activity from dawn until dusk ‚Äì as students pursue their ambitions in the classroom and beyond. Seamless Transition Sunmarke Secondary School ensures that students have a smooth transition from Primary to Secondary school to succeed in the next phase of their academic journey. To make the experience less daunting, our staff works closely with families. Our transition programme from Primary to Secondary school ensures that they start Year 7 full of excitement and with minimal nervousness. This section contains important and up-to-date information about our transition programme. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Ms Young (Deputy Head ‚Äì Student Opportunity) or Mr Matthews (Head of Year 7). Transitioning Into Secondary We strive to do our utmost to ensure that the transition from Year 6 to Year 7 is as smooth and welcoming as possible. Days for Your Diary Upcoming activities: Secondary pastoral leaders visit Year 6 children in their classrooms to hold informal Q&A sessions. Parent Coffee Mornings are held in Term Two and Three to learn more about the Secondary School and how to support your children with the transition process. This is an opportunity to meet key members of staff such as the Secondary Leadership Team. During the summer term, children will have the opportunity to experience Secondary Taster lessons. This will give them the chance to meet some of our secondary school staff and experience this part of the school building. More information and timings for the above events will be available soon via VLE. Approach To Learning In Secondary Our approach encourages students to build the skills and learning habits to become independent thinkers ‚Äì preparing them for life way beyond Year 13. Thinking Skills At Sunmarke through our ‚ÄòPositive Education‚Äô inclusive approach, students are enabled to flourish in a safe, happy and nurturing learning environment. They are stretched and challenged to ask and develop their own questions to harness their potential to the maximum. Opportunities are provided through numerous activities undertaken in the classroom, on the sports field, on stage, through educational visits abroad, organising charity events, or representing the school as outstanding ambassadors. Leadership There are numerous opportunities for leadership from informal roles within the classroom to formal roles outside of the classroom e.g. Prefects, School and Community Ambassadors. Students can aspire to leadership roles within and outside their year groups. These roles are designed to promote excellence while enabling student leaders to play a role in the development of the school and community. The Student Hub within the Secondary School is a dedicated space for secondary students to meet with their Student Leadership Team. At Sunmarke we believe in student voice and the sharing of ideas. The Hub provides a platform for every student to be heard and to interact with their Student Leaders. Digital Learning Sunmarke students are adept at using technology through class assignment and quizzes, home learning, submission and assessments, online collaboration and communication between students and teachers, tracking progress and behaviour and access to school resources, library books and information. We promote and sustain a culture that encourages the integration of digital technologies into all areas of the curriculum. Students engage and collaborate with their peers using a variety of digital environments and tools. Cyber-safety is an integral part of how the school community works with everyone being aware of their digital responsibilities, modelling ethical and appropriate use of digital resources. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) here . Social Responsibility Our principled, creative and innovative learning environment encourages students to have a responsibility ‚Äòfor‚Äô and ‚Äòtowards‚Äô the community. They learn to be solution-focused, discuss controversial topics, share their opinions on what they learn, ask questions and engage in dialogue. Environment and Sustainability Sustainability is a key agenda at Sunmarke School. We believe that we have a shared responsibility as citizens of the world to choose sustainable practices and we empower our students to do the same. Below are just some of the ways we incorporate the environment and sustainability within our subjects. Media ‚Äì Sunmarke‚Äôs Media students focus on projects related to sustainable transportation, the effects of pollution and draw upon the beauty of nature and landscapes when building their portfolios. Economics ‚Äì Our Business and Economics courses cover topics such as economic growth vs development, effects of trade and globalisation, the impact of deforestation etc. Students are encouraged to research policies to solve urgent environmental issues. The Sciences ‚Äì A Level and IB Biology ‚Äì Both courses include the study of ecosystems, ecology and biodiversity. Secondary students also look into the sustainability of using earth‚Äôs resources and assess the impact of extracting, using and recycling. Global Outlook Our excellent, holistic education and team of dedicated teachers place values like honesty, responsibility, tolerance and respect for the rights of others irrespective of nationality, gender, culture or religion at the foundation of learning. This provides students the skills and knowledge to meet the challenges of the future. Our high-quality education and multi-pathway model with bespoke career paths guide them to find the most appropriate route to study their favourite subjects at the university of their choice.
