title: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai
content: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities Activities > Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities After School Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke offers a deep variety of paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) via best-of-class, external third party providers. ECAs are run individually and in groups in sports, music, coding, and other subjects during the school year after school hours and as camps during holidays. Features of our Extracurricular Activities (ECAs): Qualified Instructors Structured, varied programmes onsite or off-site throughout the year Secure and safe environment Chess Our chess course provides a comprehensive and engaging learning experience for both beginners and intermediate players. Following a structured curriculum, students will build a strong foundation in the fundamentals of chess, including the rules, piece movements, and essential strategies. They will progress to exploring tactical combinations, positional play, and endgame techniques designed to strengthen overall gameplay. The course places strong emphasis on developing critical thinking, pattern recognition, and decision-making skills. Students will also learn how to create a personalized opening repertoire, prepare effectively for tournaments, and understand the psychological dimensions of the game. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Fashion Designing Students will be introduced to the exciting world of fashion and will develop a strong foundation in fashion design, preparing them to potentially pursue a career in the field. They will learn essential skills such as pattern cutting, draping, sewing, and various textile techniques, along with gaining an understanding of fashion history to inspire and inform their creative process. By the end of the term, students will design and create their own wearable piece that they can proudly showcase and wear. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Multi-Activity Students will be introduced to the exciting world of multi-activity, gaining a strong foundation that could inspire them to pursue a future career. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 3000 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Stories, Animation, and Game Designing Learners will carefully design and choreograph their own creations using a visual scripting language‚Äîbringing characters to life, switching scenes, and even adding voiceovers. Join us on the adventure of a lifetime as you discover how to build epic games with the world‚Äôs leading programming language for children. This is the must-know coding language of the decade! Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Photography Students will be introduced to digital photography and the seven principles of photography. They will learn how to operate a DSLR in Manual Mode by understanding the three elements of the exposure triangle‚Äîshutter speed, ISO, and aperture‚Äîtheir functions, and how to achieve proper exposure in a photograph. Students will also explore different genres of photography, including motion, product, portrait, and stop-motion photography, while developing the skills to effectively balance the exposure triangle. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 AI and Robotics AI and Robotics are all around us, and we interact with machine learning systems every day‚Äîwhether through spam filters, recommendation engines, language translation services, chatbots and digital assistants, search engines, or fraud detection tools. Soon, it will be common for machine learning systems to drive our cars and assist doctors in diagnosing and treating illnesses. Examples such as Tesla‚Äôs self-driving technology or Apple‚Äôs Siri highlight how artificial intelligence is already part of our daily lives. In this course, students are introduced to coding in an engaging way through a hands-on Robotics kit. This allows them to visualize the output of their code and gain a deeper understanding of key concepts. Each Robotics model presents a problem-solving challenge that enhances not only your child‚Äôs coding skills but also their logical thinking and reasoning abilities. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Football Our Football Academy welcomes children of all skill levels ‚Äì from beginners taking their first steps on the pitch to advanced players striving for excellence. The programme focuses on developing technical skills, tactical understanding, teamwork and leadership, and physical conditioning. Led by UEFA-licensed coaches, our sessions provide a supportive and engaging environment where every child can grow, have fun, and reach their full potential. Provider: Eagles Sports Academy For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Basketball Morovic Bauer Basketball Academy (MBBA) is dedicated to establishing an exemplary basketball institution in Dubai, renowned for its league success and exceptional player development. With an unwavering commitment to excellence, MBBA strives to elevate the standard of youth basketball across the UAE, nurturing talent and instilling a passion for the game. Our mission is to develop players who can compete at the highest levels, both locally and internationally. Through world-class coaching, structured training programmes, and a focus on holistic growth, we are crafting an unparalleled basketball experience that builds a strong reputation and drives continuous success. Provider: Morovic Bauer Basketball Training (MBBA) For more information, please contact: Email: anthony.bauer.mbba@gmail.com Mobile: +971 58 513 2623 Tennis Playverse Tennis Academy offers expert tennis coaching for Early Years, Primary, and Secondary students in Dubai, nurturing a love for the sport from a young age while building strong foundations for lifelong success. Our youth tennis programmes focus on developing technical precision, tactical awareness, physical fitness, and mental resilience through age-appropriate training sessions. Each programme is designed to match the student‚Äôs skill level ‚Äî from beginners learning the fundamentals to advanced players refining their competitive edge. Provider: Playverse Tennis Academy For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Karate Our Martial Arts Academy is dedicated to empowering individuals through discipline, focus, and fitness, offering a range of classes including Karate, Taekwondo, Kickboxing, and Yoga for both kids and adults. At the heart of our academy lies Karate, a practice that goes beyond physical strength to build character, confidence, and mental resilience. Under the guidance of certified instructors, students learn traditional techniques, self-defense skills, and the philosophy of respect and perseverance that defines true martial artists. Our Karate program is designed for all ages and skill levels, from beginners taking their first steps to advanced learners refining their craft. Through structured training, goal setting, and continuous progression, we help students develop not only their physical abilities but also their sense of discipline, self-control, and inner balance. Provider: Train Me For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Swimming Hamilton Aquatics is fueled by a deep passion for swimming and a commitment to excellence in every aspect of aquatic education. They aim to elevate performance for swimmers of all levels ‚Äî from beginners learning to navigate the water confidently to competitive athletes striving for peak performance. Safety is at the core of everything we do. Their programmes are designed to uphold the highest standards of water safety, ensuring a secure and supportive environment for all participants. Provider: Hamilton Aquatics For more information, please contact: Email: benjamin.gibbs@hamiltonaquatics.ae Mobile: +971 4 450 8832 Dance Step In Time is dedicated to offering the highest quality dance education for children in a nurturing and inspiring environment. Their team of passionate instructors brings extensive experience, creativity, and expertise to every class, ensuring that each child receives personalized attention and guidance tailored to their unique abilities and interests. At Step In Time, they believe that dance is not just about technique ‚Äî it‚Äôs about expression, confidence, and growth. That‚Äôs why they are committed to fostering a warm, inclusive, and supportive atmosphere where every child feels valued, empowered, and encouraged to explore their potential. Provider: Step in Time For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@stepintime.ae Mobile: +971 52 550 6706 Mobile app Development Think n Innovative is at the forefront of harnessing the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to transform everyday life. AI is no longer a futuristic concept. Our mission is to leverage AI to create smarter, more intuitive solutions that improve lives, drive innovation, and empower businesses and individuals to achieve their full potential. With Think n Innovative, the possibilities of AI are limitless ‚Äî shaping a future where technology seamlessly supports and enhances human capability. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Game designing At Think n Innovative, Game Designing Courses for Kids ignite creativity and introduce young learners to the exciting world of coding and animation. Through engaging, hands-on sessions, children learn to create interactive stories and games while developing essential problem-solving skills. They explore concepts such as event handling, movement blocks, and animation, bringing their characters to life with costumes, dialogue, and text-to-speech features. Kids gain an understanding of variables, loops, randomization, and Cartesian coordinates, enabling them to control sprite positions and craft dynamic gameplay. Their courses also teach children how to design stages with multiple sprites and backgrounds, adjust movement speeds, and incorporate add-ons to enhance their projects. Advanced activities, such as creating a Solar System animation using broadcast messages, blend storytelling with STEM learning. By the end of the course, children not only build technical skills but also cultivate creativity, logical thinking, and a passion for innovation in a fun and supportive environment. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Language Class (Russian, Chinese) Russian Early Learning Program at Headway Institute is the perfect choice for native or bilingual Russian-speaking children. Designed to provide a strong foundation for kindergarten, the program covers all essential areas of early education, including Language and Literature, Drawing, and Arts and Crafts, ensuring children develop both academically and creatively in a nurturing environment. In addition to Russian, they also offer opportunities for children to be exposed to Chinese language learning, fostering multilingual skills from an early age. This combination of cultural and linguistic learning helps young learners build confidence, communication skills, and a love for learning, preparing them for future academic success and global opportunities. Provider: Headway Institute For more information, please contact: Email: polina@headin.pro Facilities for Rent Facilities Sports/Activities Football Pitch Football, Mini Football, Training Sessions, Tournaments Multi-Purpose Hall 1 & 2 Basketball, Badminton, Volleyball, Netball, Fitness Activities Tennis Court Tennis, Mini Tennis, Coaching Sessions, Fitness Drills For bookings or more information, please contact our facilities provider, Eagles Sports Academy: Email: info@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Sunmarke offers a deep variety of paid After School Activities (ASAs) via best-of-class, external third party providers. ASAs are run individually and in groups in sports, music, coding, and other subjects during the school year after school hours and as camps during holidays. ASAs are separate from the school‚Äôs curriculum and Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) which Sunmarke runs during school hours in the academic year. T.nt Dance Studio is a branch of Hand by hand institute, originated from the T.nt street dance club of Nanjing University of Information Science and Technology, was founded on May 11, 2002, so far has gone through 20 years, T.nt dance Studio Dubai as the first overseas branch of the club, was established in May 2022. T.nt Dance Studio Dubai was founded with the original meaning of ‚Äútrouble no trouble‚Äù which means ‚Äúanything is possible‚Äù. Unity, enterprising, open-minded, not afraid of difficulties, and dancing for love, which is the dance soul that every member has always believed in. The studio‚Äôs representative works ‚ÄúGrain in Ear‚Äù and ‚ÄúFlying Sky‚Äù participated in Dubai‚Äôs ‚ÄúHappy Chinese New Year‚Äù parade in 2023, which was held at Expo city Dubai and became one of the largest overseas Chinese New Year celebrations. Participated in the UAE Chinese Spring Festival Gala at Dubai Opera 2024,‚Äú huang zi sun‚Äùcoop dance and ‚ÄúXiang wang xing‚Äù cjazz dance.The studio emphasizes ‚Äúintegration‚Äù, integrating Chinese elements into the world, so that more people can feel the charm of pop dance. At present, T.nt Dance Studio‚Äôs courses include children‚Äôs/adults‚Äô hip-hop hip-hop dance, Kpop/Cpop modern pop dance, Jazz Funk/ ancient jazz ,breaking,popping,and other dance styles, according to different age groups and basic levels, so that students can feel the charm of hip-hop culture in professional learning, release vitality and confidence! T. nt Dance Studio regularly holds large-scale dance competitions and performances every year, providing students with the best learning, display and exchange platform, and promoting the dissemination and development of culture and art. title: Work With Us - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai
content: Work With Us - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Work With Us Contact Us > Work With Us Life at Sunmarke Sunmarke - Where Growth is a Way of Life Life at Sunmarke is an exciting journey in an organisation that believes in transforming children‚Äôs lives. Our teachers strongly believe in our education philosophy and play the role of nurturing adults who help spark imagination, build self-esteem in a child and help them discover their potential. At Sunmarke, you will join a large family of some of the best teaching talent in the region, handpicked for their inspirational teaching. You will be given the support, dedicated time, and world-class coaching and professional development to allow you to develop your skills and expertise to the highest levels, and keep abreast of the latest developments in teaching. As we grow our schools, you will be given multiple opportunities to take on more senior roles and further your career. You‚Äôll love our warm and collaborative work environment, where transparency, camaraderie, and professional and personal growth are a way of life. Come, join us and make a difference in your life and people‚Äôs lives. View Our Current Vacancies It has come to our attention that fake job offers are been circulated on behalf of Sunmarke School by certain individuals/entities claiming they are representatives or subsidiaries or under contract with us. Sunmarke School does not: Request payment of any kind from prospective candidates for employment or any sort of fees in return for a job at Sunmarke School However, sometimes the recruitment process is done through professional recruiting agencies. In such cases, offers are always made directly by Sunmarke School and not by any third parties Sunmarke School will not be responsible for anyone acting on an employment offer not directly made by Sunmarke School. Our hiring & selection process involves interviews and assessments before any offer is made to a candidate. Sunmarke School‚Äôs Human Resources / Senior Leadership Team corresponds from email addresses with the domain ‚Äú@fortesholdings.com‚Äù & / or ‚Äú@forteseducation.com‚Äù. However, there is also a possibility of scammers to display the sent email domain address as ‚Äú@fortesholdings.com‚Äù & / or ‚Äú@forteseducation.com‚Äù fraudulently. Nevertheless, receiving emails will be possible only with the legitimate ‚Äú@fortesholdings.com‚Äù & / or ‚Äú@forteseducation.com‚Äù domain. In case any generic email ID ending with any other domain other than legitimate ‚Äú@fortesholdings.com‚Äù & / or ‚Äú@forteseducation.com‚Äù while receiving a job offer or interview call is being used, please be alert on the likelihood of this being a fake job offer. The Sunmarke School Human Resources team does not request or require personal documents like bank account details or credit card information as part of the recruitment process. Anyone making an employment offer in return for money or another type of gain is not authorised by Sunmarke School and is not offering an approved job. If you are in doubt or unsure about the source of the job offer, please visit the Career section on the Fortes Education / Fortes Investment / Sunmarke School website to verify the job offer or the application.If you believe you have been a victim of a recruitment fraud, you are requested to approach the law enforcement departments immediately.

title: Why Career Readiness is Important for Students Today
content: Why Career Readiness is Important for Students Today Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today In today‚Äôs fast-evolving world, preparing students for the future goes far beyond academic excellence. As industries transform, new careers emerge, and global competition rises, students need more than subject knowledge, they need the mindset, skills, and adaptability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment. This is where Career Readiness becomes essential. What Is Career Readiness? Career Readiness refers to the knowledge, skills, behaviours, and experiences students need to succeed in the workplace. It encompasses much more than choosing a career pathway, it‚Äôs about developing essential competencies that empower young people to make informed decisions, adapt to challenges, and pursue meaningful, successful careers. At its core, Career Readiness includes: Critical thinking and problem-solving Communication and collaboration Leadership and initiative Digital literacy and innovation Professionalism, work ethic, and adaptability Self-awareness and goal-setting Real-world exposure and experience When these skills are nurtured, students feel confident navigating their academic journeys and future career choices. Why Does Career Readiness Matter Today? A Rapidly Changing Job Market The careers students will step into tomorrow may not even exist today. Automation, AI, and technological advancements are reshaping industries at record speed. Career Readiness equips students to adapt, learn continuously, and remain competitive in this dynamic landscape. Bridging the Skills Gap Employers increasingly look for candidates who bring more than qualifications, they seek individuals with strong soft skills, creativity, emotional intelligence, and the ability to collaborate and think critically. Career Readiness programmes bridge this gap by equipping students with these highly sought-after competencies. Helping Students Make Informed Decisions With hundreds of pathways available, from university and vocational programmes to entrepreneurship, students can easily feel overwhelmed. Career Readiness provides clarity through career exploration, mentorship, and guidance, helping students understand their strengths and passions so they can choose the right path confidently. Building Confidence and Independence Through internships, workshops, leadership opportunities, and real-world projects, students gain hands-on experience that builds independence, resilience, and self-belief, qualities that stay with them for life. Fostering Future-Ready Leaders In an increasingly interconnected world, students must be global citizens who think beyond borders. Career Readiness nurtures leadership, empathy, communication, and cross-cultural understanding, skills essential for success in both further studies and the workplace. Career Readiness at Sunmarke At Sunmarke School, Career Readiness is woven into the fabric of our educational philosophy. Through our Careers Development Programme , students receive personalised guidance, access to industry experts, mentorship opportunities, university counselling, and immersive experiences that prepare them for future success. Whether through workshops, internships, Signature Programmes, or global exposure, we equip our students with everything they need to pursue their aspirations with confidence and clarity. Career Readiness is no longer optional, it is vital. By empowering students with the right skills, guidance, and experiences, we ensure they are not only prepared for the future but ready to shape it. At Sunmarke, we remain committed to developing future-ready learners who excel academically, grow personally, and lead with purpose in an ever-changing world. 0 Shares Prev Recent Blogs 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

title: How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai
content: How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices In a world facing growing environmental challenges, schools have a vital role to play in shaping the next generation‚Äôs understanding of sustainability. As centres of learning and community, they can model the values and habits needed to care for our planet. At Sunmarke School, sustainability is not a stand-alone project; it‚Äôs embedded in our culture and daily life. Through our Environment and Sustainability Signature Programme, students across all year groups engage in practical, hands-on initiatives that promote environmental awareness, responsibility, and leadership. Education Beyond the Classroom At Sunmarke, sustainability is learned by doing. Students don‚Äôt just study environmental issues in the classroom; they take meaningful action to make a difference. Our Eco Warriors and Eco Committee play a central role in leading sustainability initiatives across the school. These include recycling through Recapp, ensuring plastic, cans, and paper are properly collected and reused, and the Hydroponics Project, which teaches students about sustainable food production. Sunlight Fridays encourage energy conservation by asking everyone to switch off classroom lights, while the Book Swap and newly launched Uniform Swap promote a culture of reuse, helping students exchange items that no longer fit or are no longer needed. Our Forest School sessions give younger learners the opportunity to connect directly with nature through outdoor exploration and environmental learning. These experiences help them develop respect for natural habitats, understand biodiversity, and see first-hand the importance of caring for living things. Through these initiatives, students gain a practical understanding of how small, consistent actions can contribute to a more sustainable world. Creating Greener Spaces and Sustainable Habits Sustainability at Sunmarke extends beyond individual projects to the way the school itself operates. Classrooms and corridors have dedicated recycling systems, which students monitor and maintain as part of their leadership roles. Green corners, composting projects, and the use of repurposed materials in Design Technology lessons show how sustainable thinking can be integrated into daily learning. In collaboration with our catering partners, Mastercook, students have also explored ways to make school dining more sustainable, from reducing food waste to improving recycling practices within the canteen. These efforts demonstrate that environmental responsibility can be built into every aspect of school life, encouraging students to think critically about the impact of their choices. Building a Community of Changemakers Sustainability thrives when it is supported by an engaged community. At Sunmarke, students, staff, and partners work together to create lasting impact. Our students represent the school in the Alliance for Sustainable Schools, take part in national and regional eco initiatives, and lead projects such as the BIC Pen Recycling Challenge, the Design a Reusable Cup Competition, and the Upcycle Challenge. Through these experiences, they learn that protecting the environment is not just an individual responsibility but a shared commitment. This collaborative approach strengthens our school‚Äôs community and shows that collective action is essential for meaningful change. Preparing Students for a Sustainable Future By making sustainability part of everyday school life, Sunmarke is preparing students to lead with purpose and innovation. Whether they are growing herbs in hydroponic stations, designing with recycled materials, or presenting environmental ideas to school leadership, students are developing the confidence, creativity, and compassion needed to shape a sustainable future. The Environment and Sustainability Signature Programme ensures that they leave Sunmarke not only with academic excellence but also with the mindset and values to become responsible global citizens. At Sunmarke, sustainability is more than a lesson; it‚Äôs a mindset. Together, our students are learning that small actions, when multiplied across a community, can create meaningful change for the planet. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

title: The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai
content: The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators In the past decade, artificial intelligence (AI) has transformed industries worldwide, and the media sector is no exception. From automated journalism to AI-generated visuals and music, technology is reshaping the way content is created, shared, and consumed. For young creators today, this digital revolution opens up unprecedented opportunities to experiment, innovate, and make their voices heard. AI tools now allow creators to produce high-quality content with speed and precision. For instance, AI-powered video editing software can analyse hours of footage and suggest the best cuts, while AI music generators can compose original tracks in minutes. This not only reduces the technical barriers to entry but also encourages experimentation, allowing young creators to focus more on storytelling and creative expression. At Sunmarke, our Media Studies programme equips students with the skills to navigate these emerging tools, combining traditional media techniques with digital innovation. Students explore everything from video production and journalism to content strategy and social media management, preparing them to thrive in a rapidly evolving landscape. One of the most exciting aspects of AI in media is its potential to democratise content creation. In the past, producing high-quality films, podcasts, or digital campaigns often required significant resources and expertise. Today, AI tools can level the playing field, enabling students and young creators to produce professional-grade work with minimal cost. Sunmarke‚Äôs Media Studies curriculum emphasises hands-on projects where students can experiment with AI-assisted storytelling, from producing short films to creating multimedia campaigns for school events. This practical approach fosters creativity while teaching students how to leverage technology responsibly. Moreover, AI is changing the way audiences engage with content. Algorithms analyse user behaviour, suggesting personalised videos, articles, and music, which challenges creators to understand and adapt to audience preferences. Sunmarke‚Äôs Media Studies programme encourages students to study these trends critically, integrating lessons on media ethics, audience analysis, and digital literacy. By understanding both the creative and analytical sides of media, students can craft content that resonates while remaining mindful of the societal impact of AI-driven platforms. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke At Sunmarke School, we believe that education should go beyond textbooks and classrooms ‚Äî it should empower students to transform their passions into purposeful, real-world ventures. Through our Entrepreneurship and Enterprise curriculum , students are not only inspired to dream big but are equipped with the mindset, skills, and confidence to turn those dreams into reality. Nurturing the Next Generation of Entrepreneurs Our approach to enterprise education begins early. From primary years, students are introduced to the basics of creativity, innovation, and problem-solving through engaging, hands-on projects. As they move into secondary school and sixth form, these foundational experiences evolve into structured entrepreneurial challenges, student-led businesses, and enterprise showcases that mirror real-world business environments. Learning Through Real Experience Enterprise at Sunmarke is more than a subject; it‚Äôs an experience. Students take ownership of projects that align with their personal interests ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs fashion, technology, sustainability, or social innovation. From ideation to pitching to a panel of industry mentors, they go through every stage of launching a venture. For example, students have developed eco-friendly product lines, organized fundraising events for global causes, and even created digital startups with real customers. These initiatives are supported by our dedicated mentors and industry partnerships, allowing students to experience the challenges and rewards of entrepreneurship firsthand. Innovation Through Signature Programmes Enterprise education is seamlessly woven across our Signature Programmes , including STEAM & Design Thinking , Positive Education , and the Sunmarke Mini MBA . Students are encouraged to apply the principles of design thinking ‚Äî empathizing, ideating, prototyping, and testing ‚Äî to bring meaningful solutions to community and global issues. Our Positive Education Ethos ensures that students develop the emotional intelligence and growth mindset necessary to navigate uncertainty and lead with purpose. Pathways to Professional Success The skills developed through these enterprise projects extend far beyond school. Sunmarke graduates enter university and professional life with an entrepreneurial edge ‚Äî equipped with communication, leadership, and critical thinking skills that employers and global institutions value. Whether they choose to become startup founders, social entrepreneurs, or leaders within established organisations, our students leave Sunmarke with the confidence and experience to make an impact ‚Äî not just in their careers, but in the world around them. Empowering Passion, Inspiring Purpose At Sunmarke, we celebrate every student‚Äôs journey ‚Äî from their first creative idea to their first successful project. Our goal is simple: to nurture changemakers who can transform their passions into professions and shape a brighter, more innovative future. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Well-being in the Digital World: Balancing Screen Time, Sleep & Study for Teen Learners In today‚Äôs fast-paced digital age, our students live in a world where technology is seamlessly integrated into learning and life. From online research and digital classrooms to social media and gaming, screens have become an essential part of a teenager‚Äôs day. While technology has opened up incredible learning opportunities, it‚Äôs equally important to nurture healthy digital habits that promote balance, well-being, and academic success. At Sunmarke School, well-being is not just a subject, it‚Äôs a way of life. Through our Positive Education Ethos , we focus on developing students‚Äô character strengths, emotional intelligence, and mindfulness to help them thrive in a digitally connected world. Understanding Digital Balance Sunmarke‚Äôs teaching approach integrates technology meaningfully into the curriculum. Students engage in blended learning environments using tools such as iPads, Google Classroom, and interactive digital platforms to enhance collaboration and creativity. However, we also teach the importance of moderation. Through our Well-being and Life Skills lessons , students learn to manage screen time consciously, understanding when technology adds value to their learning and when it‚Äôs time to switch off. Teachers regularly encourage ‚Äútech breaks‚Äù during lessons, giving students moments to refocus, move around, or engage in hands-on, real-world learning activities. This ensures that digital engagement supports, rather than overwhelms, their overall growth. The Power of Restful Sleep Sleep plays a vital role in memory, focus, and emotional well-being, especially for teenagers juggling academics, extracurriculars, and social connections. Yet, increased screen exposure, particularly before bedtime, can disrupt healthy sleep patterns. Sunmarke‚Äôs Positive Education and Well-being Framework helps students understand the science behind sleep and its connection to performance. Through activities such as mindfulness sessions, guided reflections, and digital detox challenges, students learn practical strategies to create healthy nighttime routines, such as reducing screen use an hour before bed, reading, or journalling instead. By embedding these lessons across the curriculum and in our Positive Education sessions , we empower students to make conscious choices that enhance both academic outcomes and mental health. Finding Focus: Study with Intention With the abundance of online resources available, students today have endless access to knowledge. But without proper boundaries, these same tools can lead to distractions and reduced productivity. At Sunmarke, we guide students to use technology as a tool for deep learning rather than shallow multitasking. Our teachers integrate metacognitive strategies ‚Äì helping students plan, monitor, and evaluate their learning. Students are also encouraged to explore offline learning moments through reading, creative projects, and our signature STEAM & Design Thinking and Forest School programmes, which provide immersive, hands-on experiences away from screens. Empowering Teens to Thrive Digitally Our goal at Sunmarke is to raise responsible digital citizens, teenagers who understand that technology should empower, not consume, their lives. Through a blend of Positive Education , and Parent Well-being workshops, we work closely with families to foster balanced habits at home and at school. Parents are guided on how to model healthy screen use, set boundaries, and create environments where digital wellness is prioritised. In Conclusion In the digital world, balance is key. By integrating well-being, mindfulness, and purposeful technology use into every aspect of learning, Sunmarke ensures that our students grow not only as capable digital learners but also as resilient, self-aware individuals. At Sunmarke, we believe that when students learn to balance screen time, sleep, and study, they don‚Äôt just succeed academically ‚Äì they truly thrive in life. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Beyond Grammar: How the Fortes English Language Programme Shapes Confident Communicators At Sunmarke School, we believe that mastering a language is about much more than learning grammar rules or memorising vocabulary. Our Fortes English Language Programme has been carefully designed to equip students with the skills and confidence to not only communicate effectively in today‚Äôs global environment, but to also grow into confident academic contributors in our English medium school. A Curriculum Rooted in Excellence The Fortes English Language Programme is embedded within Sunmarke School‚Äôs forward-thinking curriculum. Drawing on the best practices from leading educational frameworks, it emphasises the development of reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills through topic based input to ensure students are engaged. Lessons are carefully structured to progress from foundational knowledge of basic communicative language to advanced proficiency in cognitive academic language, allowing students to build confidence step by step. Unlike traditional programmes that focus solely on exams, Fortes encourages students to use English in real-world contexts. Whether it‚Äôs engaging in classroom debates, delivering presentations, or collaborating on creative writing projects, students are constantly applying their language skills in practical situations. Building Confidence Through Active Learning Confidence is the hallmark of a strong communicator. At Sunmarke, the Fortes programme is designed to nurture this quality by creating a supportive, immersive environment. Small group activities and peer discussions within small language focused classes allow students to practice speaking and listening without fear of making mistakes. Our teachers are not only language experts but also mentors who inspire students to take ownership of their learning. By setting achievable goals and celebrating progress, they help students overcome hesitation and find their authentic voice. Integrating Technology and Innovation The Fortes programme also leverages technology to enhance learning. Interactive platforms, multimedia resources, and personalised digital exercises make lessons engaging and adaptable to each student‚Äôs learning style. This modern approach ensures that students are comfortable using English across digital and traditional mediums alike, preparing them for future academic and professional environments. Beyond the Classroom At Sunmarke, learning extends beyond the classroom. These experiences help students internalise the language in ways that textbooks alone cannot achieve. By combining rigorous academic instruction with practical application, the Fortes English Learning Language Programme transforms students into articulate, confident communicators ready to thrive in any setting. The Sunmarke Advantage Choosing Sunmarke School means giving your child access to a holistic English programme that values both competence and confidence. Fortes goes beyond grammar, focusing on the skills that truly matter: clarity of thought, persuasive communication, and the ability to connect with others. In a world where effective communication is key to success, the Fortes English Language Programme ensures that every student at Sunmarke is prepared not just to speak English‚Äîbut to speak it with confidence. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: How Innovation in Secondary Education Sparks Student Growth
content: How Innovation in Secondary Education Sparks Student Growth Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Beyond the Textbook: Sunmarke‚Äôs Innovative Approach to Secondary Education In today‚Äôs fast-changing world, education can no longer be confined to the four walls of a classroom or the pages of a textbook. At Sunmarke School, our Secondary programme within the British curriculum is designed to go beyond traditional methods, equipping students with the knowledge, skills, and values they need to thrive in university, careers, and life. A Rich and Rigorous British Curriculum Our Secondary students follow the highly respected British curriculum, which provides a strong academic foundation while encouraging independent thought and intellectual curiosity. From Key Stage 3 through to IGCSEs and A-Levels, pupils are challenged to achieve excellence across subjects, but learning is never limited to memorising facts. Instead, we place emphasis on enquiry, critical thinking, and real-world application. Every lesson begins with a ‚ÄòBig Question‚Äô ‚Äì a thought-provoking prompt that sparks curiosity, encourages communication, and sets the stage for inquiry-based learning. By regularly linking subjects together and embedding global and UAE contexts into lessons, students see the relevance of what they learn and make authentic connections to the world around them. Active, Student-Centred Learning We believe that students learn best when they are active participants in their education. Lessons are designed to be engaging, interactive, and personalised. Teachers use project-based learning, collaborative activities, debates, and experiments to make knowledge come alive. Activities are carefully differentiated to meet the needs of diverse learners, using flexible grouping strategies and modified tasks to support and challenge each student. This ensures that every learner can progress at their own pace, while also developing confidence to explore new ways of learning. Student choice and autonomy are encouraged, enabling pupils to take ownership of their learning while developing open-mindedness and resilience. Reflection is embedded in every stage, with students engaging in ‚ÄòReact‚Äô feedback ‚Äîa written dialogue with teachers on assessed work‚Äîto reflect, set goals, and drive progress forward. Problem-solving, innovation, and enterprise are intrinsic parts of learning. Whether analysing a Shakespearean play through performance, applying mathematical concepts to real-life problems, or designing sustainable solutions in science and design projects, students develop mastery alongside creativity and adaptability. Harnessing Technology and Innovation In a digital age, technology plays a central role in our classrooms. At Sunmarke, we integrate state-of-the-art learning platforms, virtual reality experiences, and AI-powered tools to personalise education. These tools enable real-time monitoring of student progress, allowing teachers to adjust instruction to suit readiness, interest, and learning styles. Technology also supports metacognitive growth‚Äîhelping students set goals, monitor their progress, and reflect on their thinking. This explicit focus on self-regulation ensures that students not only consume knowledge but also understand how they learn best. Building Skills for Life Beyond subject knowledge, our Secondary programme focuses on nurturing essential life skills such as communication, problem-solving, teamwork, leadership, and resilience. Students are encouraged to articulate their thought processes and reasoning, deepening their understanding while sharpening their ability to collaborate and persuade. Through opportunities like Model United Nations, TEDx events, enterprise challenges, and entrepreneurship initiatives, students learn to work strategically, innovate boldly, and articulate their ideas with confidence. These experiences prepare them to become adaptable and compassionate leaders in an interconnected world. A Holistic Education Ethos Sunmarke‚Äôs Positive Education ethos underpins everything we do. We balance academic achievement with wellbeing, character development, and values-based learning. From arts and sports to service projects and community initiatives, students are given opportunities to thrive beyond the classroom. Our ethos ensures a well-rounded education that fosters both excellence and empathy, shaping individuals who are not only successful but also grounded, compassionate, and future-ready. Preparing for the Future Our forward-thinking approach ensures students are well-prepared for life beyond school. Dedicated career guidance, personalised learning pathways, university preparation programmes, and exposure to industry leaders provide clarity about aspirations and next steps. By integrating rigorous academics, innovative pedagogy, cutting-edge technology, and a strong emphasis on wellbeing, Sunmarke students graduate with outstanding results, adaptability, and purpose‚Äîthe qualities needed to thrive in an ever-changing world. At Sunmarke, Secondary education goes far beyond the textbook. By blending the rigour of the British curriculum with innovative teaching methods, personalised learning, metacognitive strategies, and a strong focus on wellbeing and character, we create an environment where students are inspired to think critically, act compassionately, and achieve boldly. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: Why Project-Based Learning Makes STEAM Education Exciting
content: Why Project-Based Learning Makes STEAM Education Exciting Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Learning Through Doing: The Power of Projects in Sunmarke‚Äôs STEAM Education At Sunmarke School, education goes far beyond textbooks and exams. We believe the most meaningful learning happens when students actively engage with real-world challenges, think critically, and apply their knowledge in practical ways. This is why STEAM education ‚Äì Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics ‚Äì is at the heart of our curriculum, blending creativity with problem-solving and academic rigour. One of the most impactful approaches we take in our STEAM provision is Design Thinking. This method allows students to creatively solve real-world problems with empathy, collaboration, and interdisciplinary skills that mirror how professionals innovate and make meaningful change. Why Projects Matter in STEAM Education In the British curriculum, a strong emphasis is placed on developing not just knowledge, but also critical thinking, creativity, and collaboration. Projects bring these aims to life. Connecting theory to practice: A lesson on renewable energy becomes far more memorable when students design and build their own solar-powered car. Encouraging creativity: The ‚ÄòA‚Äô in STEAM ensures that artistry and innovation are woven into problem-solving, whether through designing prototypes, coding interactive media, or using visual arts to present findings. Building resilience: Projects often involve trial and error, encouraging pupils to see mistakes as opportunities to refine and improve their ideas. Collaboration and leadership: Working in groups helps students practise teamwork, communication, and leadership ‚Äì vital skills for university and future careers. Sunmarke‚Äôs Approach to STEAM Projects From Early Years through to Sixth Form , Sunmarke pupils take part in projects that are carefully designed to stretch their imagination while strengthening academic knowledge. In EYFS and Primary, children explore hands-on challenges such as building catapults, designing sustainable vehicles, constructing drone chassis, baking for Fairtrade and healthy eating while running a marketing enterprise, creating space rovers and rockets, and experimenting with zoetropes. In Secondary , students delve deeper into cross-disciplinary tasks. For example, they might design a sustainable home that integrates principles from science, technology, and design thinking, or create a digital animation that communicates a scientific concept to younger pupils. Students also shine on global platforms, such as Junk Kouture , where Sunmarke teams have achieved remarkable recognition by designing high-fashion outfits from recycled materials‚Äîblending sustainability, creativity, and engineering in a way that inspires peers around the world. At Sixth Form level, projects become even more sophisticated, aligning with GCSE, A-Level and BTEC coursework. Students often tackle real-world case studies, sometimes in partnership with external organisations or industry experts, preparing them for higher education and the workplace. Preparing Students for the Future Project-based STEAM learning aligns perfectly with the skills demanded by the 21st-century economy. Employers are increasingly seeking individuals who can innovate, adapt, and collaborate. By immersing pupils in real-life scenarios and encouraging them to think outside the box, Sunmarke equips students not only with academic excellence but also with the mindset to become future-ready leaders, creators, and problem-solvers. A Culture of Innovation At Sunmarke, projects aren‚Äôt an ‚Äúadd-on‚Äù but a core philosophy of learning. They showcase our commitment to Positive Education , where academic success is balanced with character development, wellbeing, and a spirit of innovation. By learning through doing, our students gain confidence in their abilities, pride in their achievements, and the courage to take on new challenges. In essence, Sunmarke‚Äôs STEAM projects bring learning to life. They transform abstract theories into tangible experiences, empower pupils to discover their passions, and prepare them to make meaningful contributions in an ever-changing world. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: Discover Early Years Maths Through Play at Sunmarke
content: Discover Early Years Maths Through Play at Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Little Learners, Big Numbers: Bringing Maths to Life in the Early Years Mathematics is often thought of as a subject of precision, formulas, and problem-solving. But at Sunmarke School, we see it as much more. In the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS), mathematics is about sparking curiosity, developing confidence, and laying the foundations for a lifetime of learning. Why Early Maths Matters Research shows that early mathematical understanding is a strong predictor of later academic achievement. While the British curriculum formally begins at Key Stage 1, the EYFS framework provides the vital preparation needed to ensure that children transition smoothly and confidently into it. In EYFS, children don‚Äôt just learn about numbers ‚Äì they develop reasoning, problem-solving, and pattern recognition skills, all while making sense of the world around them in playful, meaningful ways. From spotting shapes in their environment to counting blocks during play, children quickly discover that maths is everywhere. At Sunmarke, teachers design experiences that encourage exploration, questioning, and experimentation. This hands-on approach ensures that mathematics feels engaging and relevant right from the start. Making Numbers Fun At Sunmarke, learning maths in EYFS extends beyond the classroom walls and into everyday routines, play, and imagination. For example: Role-play activities: Children might run a pretend shop, counting coins and giving change, or create a picnic in the play kitchen, making sure everyone has an equal share of food. Outdoor learning: Counting steps while climbing, spotting patterns in nature, or building with blocks to understand shapes and symmetry. Songs and rhymes: Classics like Five Little Ducks or One, Two, Buckle My Shoe use rhythm and repetition to help little learners remember number sequences. Storytelling: Stories such as The Very Hungry Caterpillar or Ten Little Superheroes bring abstract mathematical concepts to life in fun, relatable ways. Classroom routines: Tidy-up time becomes a maths opportunity when children organise pencils by colour or sort blocks by shape. Through these everyday experiences, children learn that maths is not something to fear but something to enjoy. Building Confidence and Independence A key principle of the EYFS framework is encouraging children to think critically and solve problems independently. Teachers act as facilitators, guiding pupils to explore solutions rather than providing them directly. For example, when dividing snacks during a pretend picnic, children experience the foundations of division in a natural and enjoyable way. By celebrating effort and progress ‚Äì not just correct answers ‚Äì we nurture resilience and confidence. This growth mindset is essential not only for mathematics but also for lifelong learning. Preparing for the Future The EYFS framework is carefully aligned with the British curriculum, ensuring that children develop the skills they need for a successful transition into Key Stage 1 and beyond. By making maths playful, interactive, and meaningful, Sunmarke helps children build both competence and confidence. Our aim is for every child to see numbers not as obstacles but as tools for discovery. With the right encouragement, little learners can develop a genuine love for mathematics and approach ‚Äúbig numbers‚Äù with excitement and curiosity. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: British Curriculum Schools - Sunmarke School, Best School in Dubai
content: British Curriculum Schools - Sunmarke School, Best School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership
