title: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke
content: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai‚Äôs Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke‚Äôs campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS‚Äô unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child‚Äôs healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children‚Äôs imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‚Äòlearn through play‚Äô and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We‚Äôre committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‚ÄòTransition Days‚Äô children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child‚Äôs development and preparation for life in the modern world, it‚Äôs also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they‚Äôll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS‚Äô unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award ‚Äì Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. This accolade was presented by Her Excellency Shaikha Lubna Bint Khalid Al Qasimi, a prominent Emirati politician and a respected member of the Sharjah royal family. This recognition celebrates Mrs. Mankani‚Äôs extraordinary contributions to the education sector and her unwavering commitment to academic excellence and innovation. To read more about the Being She Awards in association with Gulf News and this inspiring event, please view the feature article here. Mother, Baby & Child Awards 2021-22 ‚Äì Gold Winners We are proud to announce that Jumeirah International Nurseries won the MBC Nursery of the Year 2021-22 Award . We thank all the JINS families who have showered us with so much love, our JINS team for their outstanding commitment, and most of all our amazing children for making each moment spent with them so special. The Bayut Awards We were nominated as the Best Nursery Chain in Dubai at the prestigious Bayut Awards 2021. These awards pay tribute to the vision of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President of UAE and Ruler of Dubai, towards making Dubai the happiest city in the world. The Readers Choice Award Jumeirah International Nurseries were proud winners of the Best Nursery 2018 Award by the Russian Emirates, Family and Kids Magazine. Edarabia ‚Äì Parents Choice Jumeirah International Nurseries received the ‚ÄòParents Choice‚Äô 2017 Award by Edarabia.com. DEWA Conservation Awards The Jumeirah International Nurseries Team won the DEWA Conservation Awards 2017 in the Nursery Category. Our staff and teachers are humbled with this accolade, and empowered to strive even harder to teach our children the importance of energy and water conservation. title: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke
content: Best Nursery School in Dubai - Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Nursery > Our Approach Our Approach Dubai‚Äôs Most Loved Early Childhood Centre - Where Each Day Brings A New Learning Adventure Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke‚Äôs campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School. With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners. Nursery School in Dubai Areas of Learning JINS‚Äô unique educational framework blends the World-Class British EYFS Curriculum with Reggio-Emilia, The Curiosity Approach and Montessori principles to bring hands-on learning experiences to life. Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery. Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude. These seven areas of learning are essential for your child‚Äôs healthy development and form the core framework of our educational programmes: 3 Core Areas of Learning Physical Development Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development 4 Specific Areas of Learning Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Extraordinary Indoor & Outdoor Spaces With 9 vibrant branches in Dubai, JINS provides rich learning environments that ignite children‚Äôs imagination and stimulate endless moments of discovery and exploration. Our nature-inspired Early Childhood Centre in the heart of the JVT community offers stimulating and engaging spaces where every detail is crafted to inspire and nurture young minds. Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas. Learning Through Play Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‚Äòlearn through play‚Äô and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We‚Äôre committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‚ÄòTransition Days‚Äô children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child‚Äôs development and preparation for life in the modern world, it‚Äôs also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they‚Äôll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS‚Äô unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award ‚Äì Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. This accolade was presented by Her Excellency Shaikha Lubna Bint Khalid Al Qasimi, a prominent Emirati politician and a respected member of the Sharjah royal family. This recognition celebrates Mrs. Mankani‚Äôs extraordinary contributions to the education sector and her unwavering commitment to academic excellence and innovation. To read more about the Being She Awards in association with Gulf News and this inspiring event, please view the feature article here. Mother, Baby & Child Awards 2021-22 ‚Äì Gold Winners We are proud to announce that Jumeirah International Nurseries won the MBC Nursery of the Year 2021-22 Award . We thank all the JINS families who have showered us with so much love, our JINS team for their outstanding commitment, and most of all our amazing children for making each moment spent with them so special. The Bayut Awards We were nominated as the Best Nursery Chain in Dubai at the prestigious Bayut Awards 2021. These awards pay tribute to the vision of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President of UAE and Ruler of Dubai, towards making Dubai the happiest city in the world. The Readers Choice Award Jumeirah International Nurseries were proud winners of the Best Nursery 2018 Award by the Russian Emirates, Family and Kids Magazine. Edarabia ‚Äì Parents Choice Jumeirah International Nurseries received the ‚ÄòParents Choice‚Äô 2017 Award by Edarabia.com. DEWA Conservation Awards The Jumeirah International Nurseries Team won the DEWA Conservation Awards 2017 in the Nursery Category. Our staff and teachers are humbled with this accolade, and empowered to strive even harder to teach our children the importance of energy and water conservation. Enquire at Jumeirah International Nurseries

Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners. Outstanding Care The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We‚Äôre committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education. We are proud holders of the ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems) and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the ISO 21001 (Education Systems) Certification. At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres: Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day A full-time nurse on site Doctor visits twice a week Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children Transition to Big School At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3. We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme. On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together. In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‚ÄòTransition Days‚Äô children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music. The JINS Family Club We believe that Early Childhood Centres are more important than ever before. As well as being crucial years for your child‚Äôs development and preparation for life in the modern world, it‚Äôs also a place for families to come together and feel supported. Our parents can become a member of the JINS Family Club where they‚Äôll have access to expert speakers and interactive workshops aimed at supporting you on your parenting journey. Follow the JINS Family Club Instagram Page here. JINS Awards & Recognitions JINS‚Äô unique approach to early years education, innovative facilities and best teaching practices has gained recognition from parents and other distinguished platforms in the region. Some of our awards and recognitions include: Gulf News and Being She Lifetime Achievement Award ‚Äì Mrs. Mankani, Founder of JINS Our visionary and esteemed Founder, Mrs. Shakuntala Mankani, has been honoured with the Lifetime Achievement Award at the prestigious Gulf News and Being She Excellence Awards 2024. This accolade was presented by Her Excellency Shaikha Lubna Bint Khalid Al Qasimi, a prominent Emirati politician and a respected member of the Sharjah royal family. This recognition celebrates Mrs. Mankani‚Äôs extraordinary contributions to the education sector and her unwavering commitment to academic excellence and innovation. To read more about the Being She Awards in association with Gulf News and this inspiring event, please view the feature article here. Mother, Baby & Child Awards 2021-22 ‚Äì Gold Winners We are proud to announce that Jumeirah International Nurseries won the MBC Nursery of the Year 2021-22 Award . We thank all the JINS families who have showered us with so much love, our JINS team for their outstanding commitment, and most of all our amazing children for making each moment spent with them so special. The Bayut Awards We were nominated as the Best Nursery Chain in Dubai at the prestigious Bayut Awards 2021. These awards pay tribute to the vision of HH Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President of UAE and Ruler of Dubai, towards making Dubai the happiest city in the world. The Readers Choice Award Jumeirah International Nurseries were proud winners of the Best Nursery 2018 Award by the Russian Emirates, Family and Kids Magazine. Edarabia ‚Äì Parents Choice Jumeirah International Nurseries received the ‚ÄòParents Choice‚Äô 2017 Award by Edarabia.com. DEWA Conservation Awards The Jumeirah International Nurseries Team won the DEWA Conservation Awards 2017 in the Nursery Category. Our staff and teachers are humbled with this accolade, and empowered to strive even harder to teach our children the importance of energy and water conservation. Enquire at Jumeirah International Nurseries

At JINS, every child that joins us goes on an individual learning journey to fulfill their potential. We take a holistic approach and support our children with enriching learning opportunities that take them beyond academics, including classes in Arabic, French, Arabic, Russian, Gymnastics and Ballet. Activities and Clubs Our Specialist Arabic and French classes are taught in a fun and interactive manner on a weekly basis Music and Dance classes help our children‚Äôs physical development through the use of music and movement We work with many 3rd Party Providers to offer extensive extracurricular activities such as Gymnastics, Ballet, Drama, Gardening, Football, Judo, Tennis, STEAM and Robotics, plus a Healthy Eating Programme with the provider ‚ÄòBaby Eats‚Äô Aftercare Programme: The JINS Learning Hub The JINS Learning Hub is an afternoon enrichment programme offering a variety of fun and educational activities for children daily from 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm. At JINS, every child that joins us goes on an individual learning journey to fulfill their potential. We take a holistic approach and support our children with enriching learning opportunities that take them beyond academics, including classes in Arabic, French, Arabic, Russian, Gymnastics and Ballet. Activities and Clubs Our Specialist Arabic and French classes are taught in a fun and interactive manner on a weekly basis Music and Dance classes help our children‚Äôs physical development through the use of music and movement We work with many 3rd Party Providers to offer extensive extracurricular activities such as Gymnastics, Ballet, Drama, Gardening, Football, Judo, Tennis, STEAM and Robotics, plus a Healthy Eating Programme with the provider ‚ÄòBaby Eats‚Äô Aftercare Programme: The JINS Learning Hub The JINS Learning Hub is an afternoon enrichment programme offering a variety of fun and educational activities for children daily from 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm. Key features include: A play-based environment and custom-designed tasks to enhance children‚Äôs learning Myriad indoor and outdoor facilities including climbing frames, sandpits and discovery areas Art and craft projects to help students explore their creativity Problem-solving in mathematics and construction areas Reading areas for rest and recreation Fully trained staff at all clubs to support children and scaffold their learning Enquire at Jumeirah International Nurseries

title: EYFS - Early Years Curriculum for FS1 & FS2 | Sunmarke School Dubai
content: EYFS - Early Years Curriculum for FS1 & FS2 | Sunmarke School Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Early Years Curriculum Learning > EYFS > Early Years Curriculum Early Years Curriculum Setting The Foundation For A Fulfilling Educational Journey Sunmarke‚Äôs Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) offers a broad and balanced curriculum for our youngest students aged 3 to 5 years, once again proving its credentials as one of the best British curriculum schools in Dubai. Children acquire new skills through 7 areas of learning and development. In the initial stages, three Prime Areas are in focus: Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language Development. Growing up, the Prime Areas help develop skills in 4 Specific Areas: Literacy Mathematics Understanding of the World Expressive Arts and Design Laying the Foundations for Lifelong Learning in FS1 and FS2 At Sunmarke, our Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS), comprising FS1 (Nursery) and FS2 (Reception) , offers a broad, balanced, and enriching curriculum for children aged 3 to 5. Rooted in the British curriculum and recognised as one of Dubai‚Äôs leading EYFS providers, our programme nurtures each child‚Äôs unique strengths and interests through play-based, inquiry-led learning. A Curriculum Designed Around the Whole Child The EYFS curriculum at FS1 and FS2 is structured around seven key areas of learning and development: Prime Areas (Early Focus): Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language These areas are particularly emphasised in FS1 , helping our youngest learners develop the essential foundations of confidence, relationships, movement, and communication. Specific Areas (Building on the Foundations): Literacy Mathematics Understanding the World Expressive Arts and Design As children progress into FS2 , these specific areas become more prominent, supporting emerging literacy and numeracy skills, creative expression, and a growing awareness of the world. Characteristics of Effective Learning Across FS1 and FS2, we recognise that children learn in different ways. The EYFS framework promotes three key learning characteristics: Playing and Exploring: Investigating and experiencing, ‚Äòhaving a go‚Äô Active Learning: Concentrating, persevering, and celebrating achievement Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing ideas, making connections, and problem-solving These traits guide how learning is planned and delivered across both FS1 and FS2, ensuring that each child‚Äôs development is supported in a way that reflects their interests, needs, and learning styles. Learning Through Play and Projects At Sunmarke, we view play as a powerful vehicle for learning in both FS1 and FS2. Our curriculum is intentionally designed to offer rich, purposeful play experiences that allow children to explore, imagine, and make sense of the world in a way that is meaningful to them. In FS1 , children are encouraged to investigate through hands-on exploration, sensory play, and open-ended experiences that develop early communication, social, and physical skills. As they transition into FS2 , children engage in more structured yet still playful learning that builds early literacy and numeracy skills while continuing to promote creativity and curiosity. Our project-based learning approach further enhances engagement. Each term, both FS1 and FS2 children explore exciting, inquiry-led themes such as ‚ÄúI Believe I Can Fly,‚Äù ‚ÄúSomewhere Out There,‚Äù and ‚ÄúUp, Up and Away.‚Äù These projects spark imagination and are shaped by the children‚Äôs own interests and questions, creating a deep sense of ownership and wonder. Whether FS1 children are building a fairy tale castle or FS2 pupils are investigating the planets, our environments are carefully curated to provide challenge, joy, and discovery. Through child-initiated and adult-guided activities, children develop critical thinking, collaboration, and communication‚Äîthe building blocks of future learning. A Holistic and Nurturing Approach At Sunmarke, we believe that every child in FS1 and FS2 is a unique individual. Our holistic approach to early education goes beyond academics to nurture each child‚Äôs emotional, social, physical, and intellectual development. We incorporate globally respected early years methodologies including elements of the Reggio Emilia philosophy , Montessori principles , and the Curiosity Approach . This eclectic framework values child-led exploration, independence, and a strong connection to the learning environment‚Äîcreating rich opportunities for discovery and expression. Our learning spaces are thoughtfully designed to be calm, beautiful, and engaging, reflecting the importance of the environment as the ‚Äòthird teacher‚Äô. Teachers and support staff observe closely, respond sensitively, and plan responsively to extend learning in authentic, meaningful ways. Strong partnerships with parents, a passionate team of educators, and a shared belief in the limitless potential of every child create a warm, supportive community. In FS1 and FS2, children feel safe, seen, and inspired‚Äîlaying a confident foundation for their journey through school and life. Characteristics of Effective Learning The characteristics of Effective Learning describe how children learn and respond to teaching in the Foundation Stage, a factor determined by their individual learning characteristic. Three traits of effective teaching and learning identified by the EYFS are: Playing and Exploring: Finding out, discovering, willing to ‚Äòhave a go‚Äô and playing with what they know Active Learning: Being involved and concentrating, trying and persevering, taking pleasure from achievements Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing their own ideas, making links and selecting their own ways to complete tasks 7 Curriculum Areas To enhance the learning experience and make it impactful, Sunmarke has selected 7 curriculum areas taught through unique projects and interests, most of which are child-initiated activities that incorporate elements of imagination, investigation and ‚Äòout of the box‚Äô ideas, concepts and solutions. The EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play which enhances critical thinking abilities, fuels risk-taking and creative skills. Examples of topics are ‚ÄòI believe I can fly‚Äô, ‚ÄòSomewhere out there‚Äô and ‚ÄòUp up and away.‚Äô The initiative EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play. Our teaching philosophy is designed to treat all children as unique individuals in their own right. Our holistic approach towards education ensures that parents/carers, class teachers, specialist teachers and learning assistants work very effectively together to support our firm belief that ‚Äòevery child is unique‚Äô. Our maxim is that happy and well-motivated children are good learners. The Foundation Stage is a safe, secure and friendly environment for our youngest children to gain confidence and independence, as they prepare for the next stage of schooling. It is a foundation for future learning. Characteristics of Effective Learning (CoEL) are a revived element in the current Early Years Foundation Stage Curriculum (EYFS). CoEL advocates that while planning and guiding children‚Äôs activities, practitioners must reflect on the different ways that students learn, and these lessons must be reflected in their practice.

title: EYFS Sunmarke, Dubai - Laying The Foundations For A Lifelong Love Of Learning
content: EYFS Sunmarke, Dubai - Laying The Foundations For A Lifelong Love Of Learning Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > EYFS > Our Approach EYFS Curriculum Our Approach Laying The Foundations For A Lifelong Love Of Learning A child‚Äôs journey of education begins in the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) department at Sunmarke. Blending a range of outstanding Early Years practices from the best international schools, we commit to a child-initiated learning approach and a sophisticated play-based curriculum that enables students to fulfil their unique potential. Sunmarke‚Äôs Amazing Philosophy and Journey A- Autonomy: Children are central to everything we do; all projects stem directly from their interests. M ‚Äì Mindset: In line with Sunmarke‚Äôs ‚ÄòPositive Education‚Äô ethos, we teach children to have a ‚ÄòGrowth Mindset‚Äô, encouraging endless possibilities. A- Academics: We provide a broad, balanced yet innovative British curriculum based on the Early Years Foundation Stage, building the bedrock for the future. Z -Zest: Happiness is a key agenda at Sunmarke School; we truly believe that if a child is happy and enthusiastic, they learn better. I ‚Äì Individuality: Our personalised curriculum ensures every child‚Äôs individuality is recognised. Strong teacher/pupil relationships allows tutors to identify and cater to a child‚Äôs interests, strengths and challenges. N ‚Äì Nurture: We nurture every child to enable them to grow and reach their fullest potential. G ‚Äì Grow: Every child that enters EYFS has a special and incredible journey that helps them grow and develop into happy, healthy teens. Learning Through Play Imaginative and creative play is how children learn about the world. During imaginative play, they manipulate materials, express themselves verbally and non-verbally, plan, act, interact, react and try different roles. Learning is most effective when children participate in creative play with dolls, vehicles, blocks, rocks, cardboard, or boxes. Employing creative thinking while manipulating play dough, creating recipes by mixing dirt and water, working with art materials, splashing in puddles, or pretending to fly can further child development. Imagination fosters cognitive and social development by allowing children to contemplate different resolutions, thus boosting their self-confidence. Our Early Years Foundation Stage has been rated as ‚Äò Outstanding ‚Äô in the latest KHDA‚Äôs DSIB inspection report (2023-24) with ‚Äò Outstanding Personal Development & Learning Skills and Outstanding Curriculum and Curriculum Adaptation‚Äô.

A Curriculum Designed Around the Whole Child The EYFS curriculum at FS1 and FS2 is structured around seven key areas of learning and development: Prime Areas (Early Focus): Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Communication and Language These areas are particularly emphasised in FS1 , helping our youngest learners develop the essential foundations of confidence, relationships, movement, and communication. Specific Areas (Building on the Foundations): Literacy Mathematics Understanding the World Expressive Arts and Design As children progress into FS2 , these specific areas become more prominent, supporting emerging literacy and numeracy skills, creative expression, and a growing awareness of the world. Characteristics of Effective Learning Across FS1 and FS2, we recognise that children learn in different ways. The EYFS framework promotes three key learning characteristics: Playing and Exploring: Investigating and experiencing, ‚Äòhaving a go‚Äô Active Learning: Concentrating, persevering, and celebrating achievement Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing ideas, making connections, and problem-solving These traits guide how learning is planned and delivered across both FS1 and FS2, ensuring that each child‚Äôs development is supported in a way that reflects their interests, needs, and learning styles. Learning Through Play and Projects At Sunmarke, we view play as a powerful vehicle for learning in both FS1 and FS2. Our curriculum is intentionally designed to offer rich, purposeful play experiences that allow children to explore, imagine, and make sense of the world in a way that is meaningful to them. In FS1 , children are encouraged to investigate through hands-on exploration, sensory play, and open-ended experiences that develop early communication, social, and physical skills. As they transition into FS2 , children engage in more structured yet still playful learning that builds early literacy and numeracy skills while continuing to promote creativity and curiosity. Our project-based learning approach further enhances engagement. Each term, both FS1 and FS2 children explore exciting, inquiry-led themes such as ‚ÄúI Believe I Can Fly,‚Äù ‚ÄúSomewhere Out There,‚Äù and ‚ÄúUp, Up and Away.‚Äù These projects spark imagination and are shaped by the children‚Äôs own interests and questions, creating a deep sense of ownership and wonder. Whether FS1 children are building a fairy tale castle or FS2 pupils are investigating the planets, our environments are carefully curated to provide challenge, joy, and discovery. Through child-initiated and adult-guided activities, children develop critical thinking, collaboration, and communication‚Äîthe building blocks of future learning. A Holistic and Nurturing Approach At Sunmarke, we believe that every child in FS1 and FS2 is a unique individual. Our holistic approach to early education goes beyond academics to nurture each child‚Äôs emotional, social, physical, and intellectual development. We incorporate globally respected early years methodologies including elements of the Reggio Emilia philosophy , Montessori principles , and the Curiosity Approach . This eclectic framework values child-led exploration, independence, and a strong connection to the learning environment‚Äîcreating rich opportunities for discovery and expression. Our learning spaces are thoughtfully designed to be calm, beautiful, and engaging, reflecting the importance of the environment as the ‚Äòthird teacher‚Äô. Teachers and support staff observe closely, respond sensitively, and plan responsively to extend learning in authentic, meaningful ways. Strong partnerships with parents, a passionate team of educators, and a shared belief in the limitless potential of every child create a warm, supportive community. In FS1 and FS2, children feel safe, seen, and inspired‚Äîlaying a confident foundation for their journey through school and life. Characteristics of Effective Learning The characteristics of Effective Learning describe how children learn and respond to teaching in the Foundation Stage, a factor determined by their individual learning characteristic. Three traits of effective teaching and learning identified by the EYFS are: Playing and Exploring: Finding out, discovering, willing to ‚Äòhave a go‚Äô and playing with what they know Active Learning: Being involved and concentrating, trying and persevering, taking pleasure from achievements Creating and Thinking Critically: Developing their own ideas, making links and selecting their own ways to complete tasks 7 Curriculum Areas To enhance the learning experience and make it impactful, Sunmarke has selected 7 curriculum areas taught through unique projects and interests, most of which are child-initiated activities that incorporate elements of imagination, investigation and ‚Äòout of the box‚Äô ideas, concepts and solutions. The EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play which enhances critical thinking abilities, fuels risk-taking and creative skills. Examples of topics are ‚ÄòI believe I can fly‚Äô, ‚ÄòSomewhere out there‚Äô and ‚ÄòUp up and away.‚Äô The initiative EYFS curriculum is designed and based on the philosophy of learning through play. Our teaching philosophy is designed to treat all children as unique individuals in their own right. Our holistic approach towards education ensures that parents/carers, class teachers, specialist teachers and learning assistants work very effectively together to support our firm belief that ‚Äòevery child is unique‚Äô. Our maxim is that happy and well-motivated children are good learners. The Foundation Stage is a safe, secure and friendly environment for our youngest children to gain confidence and independence, as they prepare for the next stage of schooling. It is a foundation for future learning. Characteristics of Effective Learning (CoEL) are a revived element in the current Early Years Foundation Stage Curriculum (EYFS). CoEL advocates that while planning and guiding children‚Äôs activities, practitioners must reflect on the different ways that students learn, and these lessons must be reflected in their practice.

content: EYFS - Enriched Learning Programme at Sunmarke, Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Enriched Learning Learning > EYFS > Enriched Learning Enriched Learning An Opportunity To Enhance Students' Skills Beyond The Classroom Sunmarke offers an exciting after-school programme led by our experienced EYFS teachers and support staff. The Active Minds Programme is available Monday to Thursday, 1.30 pm to 5 pm with enough flexibility. MORE ABOUT THE ACTIVE MINDS PROGRAMME Active Minds offers a wide range of activities and multiple classes for children from FS1 to Year 2. This programme gives them the opportunity to collaborate, investigate, explore and socialise with a large circle of peers. A typical Active Minds afternoon would be as follows: Children remain with their class teacher for enrichment activities before lunch at 1:30pm. Post lunch, they begin their first activity which could be creative crafts, music and movement, gardening, STEAM activities or languages. They visit the library, take part in some outdoor activities or spend some time being digital detectives. Activities and Clubs At Sunmarke, participation in extra-curricular activities, be it in sports, creative arts or music, is as important as academic achievement. This philosophy is at the core of our Extra Curricular Activities (ECAs) within the EYFS department that offers students interesting experiences in a supporitve environment. Here is a list of the paid enrichment activities provided by our trusted external agencies to children after school: Football with Eagles Sports Kids Tennis with Unlimited Sports Dance with Ignite Mini Mixed Martial Arts with Power 4 Sports Academy Russian lessons with Headway French lessons with Headway

of Innovative and Compelling Learning Opportunities Sunmarke‚Äôs Primary phase nurtures a child‚Äôs development in all aspects, with teachers committed to knowing your child as an individual and making them feel valued and respected. The British curriculum subjects are taught in a creative and engaging manner alongside the mandated UAE subjects, with students immersed in a STEAM curriculum that enables them to make purposeful connections between all areas of their learning. Thinking Skills Extensive facilities that befit great international schools, an engaging learning environment, future-focused programmes, rewards for achievements and individual attention help students build confidence. In Key Stage 1 (KS1), we nurture a growth mindset and introduce students to more formal learning. They achieve greater self-reliance, effective study habits and learn to work and collaborate with others. In Key Stage 2 (KS2), we foster confident and competent learners as well as good communicators. Students develop self-discipline and independence as well as respect, humility and compassion for others. Leadership Sunmarke places great importance in cultivating student leadership. From Year 1, children start to take responsibility for their own learning, become Lead Learners and develop resilience. Sunmarke students are trained to be leaders in every area of school life: Our Primary Head Boy and Girl are active participants in whole-school initiatives that influence policy Our House Captains instill a sense of pride and ambition in their fellow students Student Council representatives gauge pupil opinion and campaign for change Wellbeing Champions work to ensure students are safe and happy Our Eco-Warriors work tirelessly to ensure a cleaner, more sustainable future for us all Digital Learning Sunmarke sees technology as a useful tool to support learning. We believe in incorporating technology purposefully to enhance our students‚Äô autonomy, independence and learning experience. Towards this, our Primary students use iPads or tablets, interactive screens and a variety of AI apps. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Instilling social responsibilities in our students is important to Sunmarke. We want our children to grow into aware, responsible global citizens who develop empathy, cultural awareness, tolerance and a greater understanding of environment and sustainability concepts. This goes hand-in-hand with the character strengths that are an intrinsic part of our Positive Education approach. Here are a few examples of our past and continuing social initiatives to achieve these objectives: Our Eco-Warriors liaise with local environmental groups and charities to promote environmental awareness among their peers Every year group learns about sustainable living through growing and harvesting their own hydroponics STEAM projects are tailored to develop children‚Äôs understanding of social responsibility and designed to tackle real life social, environmental and economic issues Students take part in residential trips and charitable ventures such as The Shoebox Appeal and Emirates Red Crescent Ramadan food collections Students plan and execute entrepreneurial activities to raise money for worthwhile causes

of Innovative and Compelling Learning Opportunities Sunmarke‚Äôs Primary phase nurtures a child‚Äôs development in all aspects, with teachers committed to knowing your child as an individual and making them feel valued and respected. The British curriculum subjects are taught in a creative and engaging manner alongside the mandated UAE subjects, with students immersed in a STEAM curriculum that enables them to make purposeful connections between all areas of their learning. Thinking Skills Extensive facilities that befit great international schools, an engaging learning environment, future-focused programmes, rewards for achievements and individual attention help students build confidence. In Key Stage 1 (KS1), we nurture a growth mindset and introduce students to more formal learning. They achieve greater self-reliance, effective study habits and learn to work and collaborate with others. In Key Stage 2 (KS2), we foster confident and competent learners as well as good communicators. Students develop self-discipline and independence as well as respect, humility and compassion for others. Leadership Sunmarke places great importance in cultivating student leadership. From Year 1, children start to take responsibility for their own learning, become Lead Learners and develop resilience. Sunmarke students are trained to be leaders in every area of school life: Our Primary Head Boy and Girl are active participants in whole-school initiatives that influence policy Our House Captains instill a sense of pride and ambition in their fellow students Student Council representatives gauge pupil opinion and campaign for change Wellbeing Champions work to ensure students are safe and happy Our Eco-Warriors work tirelessly to ensure a cleaner, more sustainable future for us all Digital Learning Sunmarke sees technology as a useful tool to support learning. We believe in incorporating technology purposefully to enhance our students‚Äô autonomy, independence and learning experience. Towards this, our Primary students use iPads or tablets, interactive screens and a variety of AI apps. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Instilling social responsibilities in our students is important to Sunmarke. We want our children to grow into aware, responsible global citizens who develop empathy, cultural awareness, tolerance and a greater understanding of environment and sustainability concepts. This goes hand-in-hand with the character strengths that are an intrinsic part of our Positive Education approach. Here are a few examples of our past and continuing social initiatives to achieve these objectives: Our Eco-Warriors liaise with local environmental groups and charities to promote environmental awareness among their peers Every year group learns about sustainable living through growing and harvesting their own hydroponics STEAM projects are tailored to develop children‚Äôs understanding of social responsibility and designed to tackle real life social, environmental and economic issues Students take part in residential trips and charitable ventures such as The Shoebox Appeal and Emirates Red Crescent Ramadan food collections Students plan and execute entrepreneurial activities to raise money for worthwhile causes

Curriculum A Curriculum Underpinned by our Positive Education Ethos Philosophy At Sunmarke, we firmly believe in equipping our students with the skills they‚Äôll need in the ever-changing landscape of 21st Century thinking and work. We do this by empowering our students through an innovative and character-building education that inspires them to thrive and achieve with purpose. Our curriculum design serves to reflect this. Whilst maintaining academic rigour through the British National Curriculum, our holistic Positive Education ethos and ambitious commitment to innovative technology ensures our children achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success. Additionally, opportunities for Forest School lessons and outdoor learning are provided to all Primary students. Therefore, the drivers for our curriculum are based on two principles: all learning is purposeful with real-life application and context; and students can make connections across interdisciplinary skills. STEAM With the opening of our dedicated STEAM Centre, SPACE-X, and the addition of specialist resident design technology and computing teachers, we have redesigned our curriculum to take us from our thematic roots to design thinking, using the Stanford d.school approach below. Whilst English and maths remain explicitly on the timetable, children work on STEAM theme projects across science, design technology, engineering, the arts, maths and humanities, with the option to also make purposeful links to our UAE moral, social and cultural studies and Values in Action objectives . Living in the UAE, it is vital we also make purposeful links to our local surroundings, Islamic culture and Arabic language. This hands-on approach to problem-solving enables each STEAM theme to culminate in a proposed project which requires the students to design/make/create something which draws upon the knowledge and skills which they have learnt over the course of the project . During each STEAM project , each class will spend two weeks in SPACE-X, where the support of our specialists will enable children‚Äôs designs to come to life. Primary Core Subjects Primary Foundation Subjects English History Mathematics Geography STEAM (including science) Modern Foreign languages (MFL): French/Mandarin Arabic Art & Design Islamic Computing Values in Action/moral, social and cultural studies Music Physical Education (including swimming) In addition to the subjects above, Sunmarke offers a diverse range of sports, co-curricular and enrichment activities to supplement the academic programme.

Performing Arts A Creative Hub to Shape Students' Artistic and Aesthetic Sensibilities Our classes in music, art, computing, languages, PE and others are carefully planned to match each year group‚Äôs STEAM projects wherever possible. They also embrace our Positive Education ethos and make meaningful links with moral, social and cultural studies objectives. Students are taught to appreciate art and design from different periods, created by famous composers, engineers, linguists and sporting heroes. This enhances their knowledge of form, texture, pitch, tone, coding and robotics, pronunciation and composition, and timing and precision. These skills are further built upon in ECAs, including our Performing Arts elective that prepares students for the annual musical performance. Stimulating displays in classrooms and corridors result in widespread appreciation of their achievements and efforts throughout the year. Music There is something for everyone in Sunmarke‚Äôs music department. Our specialist music teachers ignite every child‚Äôs passion for music, be they a grade 7 pianist or an enthusiast in different musical genres. Students are encouraged to perform as much as possible: in assemblies, concerts, school productions ‚Äì our school is their stage! See the highlight pictures below from our previous musical, which brought High School Musical to life with our talented Primary students. Stay tuned for this year‚Äôs spectacular production of Roald Dahl‚Äôs Matilda the Musical ! Performances There are many opportunities for students to shine on stage at Sunmarke Primary, with a vibrant calendar of performances that celebrate creativity, confidence and collaboration. Each year, our students captivate audiences through a wide range of events: Winter Performances: Our Year 1 and 2 students take to the stage to share a heart-warming mix of songs, poems and dances, reflecting their learning journeys from Term 1. Snowmarke: A much-anticipated concert-style showcase, Snowmarke features selected students from Years 3 to 6 performing music, dance and drama with exceptional flair. Summer Showcases: Year 3 4 and 5 students take audiences on a musical journey inspired by their curriculum, with original performances that highlight their creativity and enthusiasm. Primary Musical: A highlight of the year, our annual musical sees Year 5 and 6 students audition, rehearse and perform in a full-scale production. Recent shows have included Beauty & The Beast , Peter Pan (and upcoming Matilda Jr) , demonstrating the incredible talent and commitment of our young performers.

Clubs are held from Monday to Thursday after school. A typical range of clubs and activities includes: Year 2 Fine Motor Skills Fine motor club is an opportunity to develop your fine motor skills and communication skills by working with partners. Students will take part in a range of creative activities which support in fine motor development and handwriting skills. Mathletics Club An amazing opportunity for students to develop a lifelong love of maths through: Confidence with maths facts fluency Enjoyment of solving maths problems Tackling maths puzzles/games Fun with maths song and play Yoga & Mindfulness At Sunmarke, well-being and positivity are at the heart of everything we do. In this yoga and mindfulness club, students get the chance to end the day calmly with some relaxing activities that promote mindfulness, well-being and appreciation. Multi Sports Want to get active and have some fun? This club allows children to enjoy energetic activities while being active and blowing off some steam. Students will focus on developing basic movement skills through fun games while coming together to make new friends and work in teams. Fun with French This club promotes the love of language and the amazing experiences that come along with learning. Students will get the chance to become more confident in French and learn new vocabulary through games and engaging activities. Board Games Strategy and focus are major skills of almost every board game. In this activity, students have the chance to develop these skills in an interactive group setting. Have a favourite board game or one that you think people wouldn‚Äôt have played before? Bring it along to Board Games Club and enjoy developing your critical thinking, problem-solving and strategic skills. Photography Club If you would like to develop your photography and creative outlook, this is an excellent activity for you. During this club, you will learn about what good photography requires and how to edit and improve your images. Come explore the artist within! Art Club Art club gives students the chance to learn and develop art skills, using drawing and sketching techniques you will learn to create inventive and creative artwork. Work alongside other talented students to enhance your creative flair and enjoy learning new things. Year 3 & Year 4 Book Worms In Book Worms, students will be able to develop an inner love of reading. In this club, you will read both individually and as a group, writing book reviews and promoting a love of reading across the school. Creative Writing Club ‚ÄúWriting is the painting of the voice.‚Äù Get your favourite pens ready as we embark on an adventure where your creative dreams can come true. Creative writing club gives all students the chance to develop new vocabulary and enhance their love of writing. Fun and engaging topics ensure students get a chance to develop their own stories. Digital Art Are you an aspiring artist or graphic designer? Join the digital art club to develop your digital art skills. You will work collaboratively to grow your understanding of digital artwork using the Sketchbook art application. Year 3 and Year 4 Choir Join the Year 3 and Year 4 choir to develop your inner performer. You will have the chance to enhance your creative talents and grow in confidence as you practise a range of songs throughout the term. This is a great chance to start your stage career early. Year 3 and Year 4 Yoga & Mindfulness At Sunmarke, well-being and positivity are at the heart of everything we do. In this yoga and mindfulness club, students get the chance to end the day calmly with some relaxing activities that promote mindfulness, well-being and appreciation. Creators club Do you enjoy being creative? If so, come along to Creators Club where you will have the opportunity to build your self-esteem, resilience, and gain a sense of accomplishment whilst engaging in fun creative arts and crafts projects. Maths Stars Join the Maths Stars to explore maths in a fun and creative way, whilst also showing off your artistic skills! Each week, you will use your maths knowledge to create a piece of colourful and interesting artwork. You will also have the opportunity to explore some challenging maths problems and investigations. Year 3 and Year 4 Board Games Strategy and focus are major skills of almost every board game. In this activity, students have the chance to develop these skills in an interactive group setting. Have a favourite board game or one that you think people wouldn‚Äôt have played before? Bring it along to Board Games Club and enjoy developing your critical thinking, problem-solving and strategic skills. Coding for beginners This is a great opportunity to develop your coding skills in a safe and supportive space. The Coding for Beginners club will be able to take students through the key concepts and building blocks of coding in a fun and expressive way. Poetry Club With a mix of creative writing skills and performance poetry, this club is perfect to build your confidence in both writing and public speaking. During these sessions, students will be sharing fun and engaging activities which develop key literacy skills. Zumba Dance Get fit and active with the Zumba club; you will have had fun dancing and developing your rhythm. An extremely fun and engaging way for students to express themselves and stay active. Woodwork Join the woodwork club to gain lots of new key skills. In this club, you will develop your design and technology skills, creating fun and exciting woodwork projects. Lego Robotics LET‚ÄôS CODE LEGO! Build your own LEGO creations, improve your coding skills and have lots of fun working within a team. Student will develop their coding and building skills as they tackle challenges and solve problems. Mandarin for Beginners Year 3 and Year 4 Keen to become multi-lingual? Then why not learn Mandarin from a native speaker? This class will give you the chance to learn Mandarin in fun and creative ways, filled with language games and interactive tasks. Year 5 & Year 6 Stop Motion Animation & Green Screen In this exciting club, students will learn how to create short animated films and clips using stop-motion techniques. A great club to develop your creativity and innovation! Basketball Join the basketball club to develop your inner sportsperson. This club is open to all who would like to build skills in a new sport, or anyone who has an existing passion for basketball. We will see you at the 3-point line. Year 5 and Year 6 Yoga & mindfulness We are incredibly committed to the well-being of all students. During yoga and mindfulness club, students get the chance to focus on themselves and support their own mental well-being. This has been shown to improve physical and mental health in school-age children. Yoga improves balance and strength. Year 5 and Year 6 Book Worms Join the Book Worms club to develop an inner love of reading. In this club, you will read both individually and as a group, writing book reviews and promotes a love of reading across the school. Year 5 and Year 6 Coding for beginners This is a great opportunity to develop your coding skills in a safe and supportive space. The Coding for Beginners club will be able to take students through the key concepts and building blocks of coding in a fun and expressive way. watercolour Painting Paint like Monet and Vincent Van Gogh! Dive into the history of some of the most famous painters in the world by indulging in the vibrant and translucent nature of watercolour painting. Its quick-drying qualities mean you can take a new masterpiece home with you every single week! Sunmarke Newsletter This club gives students an opportunity to become journalists and discover and write about all of the exciting things that happen at Sunmarke. We will collaboratively create a Sunmarke newsletter for all to read. Year 5 and Year 6 Fun with French This club promotes the love of language and the amazing experiences that come along with learning. Students will get the chance to become more confident in French and learn new vocabulary through games and engaging activities. Textiles Club In this club, you will have the opportunity to learn unique textiles skills such as hand stitching and machine sewing. Your skills will be developed through fun activities and brought together to create your final product. Year 5 and Year 6 Board Games Strategy and focus are major skills of almost every board game. In this activity, students have the chance to develop these skills in an interactive group setting. Have a favourite board game or one that you think people wouldn‚Äôt have played before? Bring it along to Board Games Club and enjoy developing your critical thinking, problem-solving and strategic skills. Year 3 ‚Äì 6 Spanish for Natives HOLA! come and join our Spanish for native speakers ECA. Take the opportunity to practise your spoken and written language skills in a fun and collaborative way. We will explore a variety of topics in Spanish, develop an understanding of Spanish and Latin American traditions through a variety of projects and hands on activities. Mandarin for Beginners Year 5 and Year 6 Keen to become multi-lingual? Then why not learn Mandarin from a native speaker? This class will give you the chance to learn Mandarin in fun and creative ways, filled with language games and interactive tasks. Arabic & Islamic Arabic Educational Games Come and join our Arabic activities club to have fun with educational games that help you to support your Arabic language skills. We will focus on new vocabulary and spoken Arabic. Year 5 and Year 6 Arabic Art Come and join the Arabic art club to explore the exciting and rich world of Arabic art. We will practise art techniques while also learning about the history and culture surrounding Arabic art. Let‚Äôs enjoy doing Arts to discover more fun in Arabic. Islamic Culture Looking for a fun and educational extracurricular activity? Join our Islamic culture club! This club is open to all students who are interested in learning more about the rich history and traditions of Islam. Through engaging activities and discussions, we explore various aspects of Islamic culture, including art, music, literature, cuisine, and more. Whether you are a practising Muslim or simply interested in learning more about this fascinating culture, our Islamic culture club is the perfect place for you! Arabic Reading Are you looking to improve your Arabic reading skills? Look no further than our Arabic Reading Club! Our club is open to students of all levels who are interested in enhancing their reading proficiency in Arabic. Through guided reading sessions, group discussions and interactive activities, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to build your vocabulary, improve your pronunciation, and develop your comprehension skills. Our club members come from diverse backgrounds and share a passion for learning the Arabic language and its rich literary tradition. Join us and expand your knowledge of this beautiful language while making new friends and having fun! Arabic Arts and Crafts Join our Arabic arts and crafts club and explore the beauty of Arabic calligraphy, textile art and more! Our club is open to students of all skill levels who are interested in creating unique and beautiful works of art inspired by the rich cultural heritage of the Arabic-speaking world. Our experienced instructors will guide you through the process of creating your own masterpieces, using a variety of materials and techniques. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn about the history and symbolism behind Arabic art and craft traditions, while developing your own creativity and imagination. Our club is a welcoming and inclusive community where you can express yourself, make new friends, and discover the joy of creating something beautiful with your own hands. Join us today and let your creativity soar! Emirati Culture club Are you fascinated by Emirati culture? Do you want to learn more about the traditions and customs of the United Arab Emirates? Look no further than our Emirati culture club! Our club is open to all students who are interested in exploring the unique and diverse culture of the UAE. Through engaging activities, discussions and events, we delve into various aspects of Emirati culture, including art, music, cuisine and more. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to connect with other students who share your interests, and learn from knowledgeable guest speakers and experts in the field. Whether you are a UAE national or an international student, our Emirati culture club is the perfect place for you to learn about and appreciate the rich cultural heritage of the UAE.

Multi Sports Want to get active and have some fun? This club allows children to enjoy energetic activities while being active and blowing off some steam. Fun with French This club promotes the love of language and the amazing experiences that come along with learning. want to pursue a career in the 21st century, basic computer programming is an essential skill to learn.‚Äù ‚Äì Professor Stephen Hawking, Theoretical Physicist, Cosmologist, and Author Coding is a third language for students at Sunmarke from Year 1 to Year 13. Students learn Programming about Hardware, Software Development, Computational Thinking, Computer Logic, Networking, Computer Communication, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, e-Waste, and Emerging technologies. Key Features: Coding Computing lessons for all learners from Year 1 to Year 13. Programmable Microcomputer hardware taught in the curriculum from KS2: MicroBits, Raspberry Pi, and SAM Lab. Expert Computing and ICT subject specialist teaching and support team. Our school offers a wide array of pathways for learners in this subject. Students can choose in KS4 from BTEC Level 2 IT, IGCSE ICT, and IGCSE Computer Science. And at KS5 we offer International A Level IT, A Level Computer Science, BTEC Level 3 IT, and IB ITGS. For extra-curricular activities , we have a dedicated computer building, robotics, game making, First Lego League, and other clubs. Sunmarke prepares its students to excel in a tech-enabled world.
