Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Our Approach Learning > Sixth Form > Our Approach Sixth Form School in Dubai Our Approach Achieving Outstanding Results With The Right Balance of Support, Inspiration And Challenge Sunmarke‚Äôs Sixth Form is imbued with the Positive Education approach, our dynamic and innovative Sixth Form curriculum is designed to meet the needs, talents and interest of our students, making them future-ready. Through our different pathways, we encourage students to ask questions about the world around them and think from multiple perspectives. We are unique in offering A-Levels, BTECs, and being an IB World School, we also offer the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme. Whether students choose the A-Level, BTEC; or the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme pathway, we inspire purpose and drive passion. Here at Sunmarke we care about the journey that students go on and the skills they develop along the way. Our students are not defined by grades, they are a collection of skills and interests that show their passion, and we want them to strive to be better learners to best prepare them for the path they choose after they graduate. Students will develop these skills through sessions run in form time on developing as a learner and preparing for higher education. While attending sessions for the latter, students will be exposed to resources that will help them explore their passions through reading, videos and courses outside of the curriculum that are now available online at the click of a button. Outside of the form room is where you will differ in terms of skills developed. The International Baccalaureate Programmes places more of an emphasis in developing a variety of skills due to the diverse subjects students have to take whereas A-Levels allow students to delve deeper into a smaller selection of subjects. Different still are BTEC qualifications which have no exams and will, therefore, develop your investigation and research skills as you look to answer your briefs. Leadership All students at Sunmarke‚Äôs Sixth Form are leaders and role models and they embrace this responsibility fully. These young leaders play a crucial role in the growth of the school and the community. Within their academics, students are provided options to lead their own learning such as through the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ), available to A Level and BTEC students or through various pieces of coursework, such as the Extended Essay and Reflective Project on the International Baccalaureate pathways. There are several opportunities for students to assume leadership roles, form their own extra-curricular activities and represent the school as Senior Prefects, Senior Student Leadership Team, House Captains and Subject Ambassadors. Thinking Skills Preparing students to flourish in an environment that encourages critical and independent thinking, Sunmarke‚Äôs Sixth Form is imbued with the Positive Education approach. Students are trained through the Theory of Knowledge (TOK) curriculum that motivates them to ask questions about the world around them and think from multiple perspectives. Digital Learning Sixth Form students model the use and integration of digital technologies throughout their curriculum. Many digital tools are available such as Questia School, an online library and UniFrog, a platform for search, shortlist and applying for university courses. Sixth Form Students are taught to be at ease with technology, but also encouraged to question its validity, reliability and responsibility in a modern world. Media literacy is given a lot of importance at Sunmarke as students prepare to navigate the world beyond the school. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Sunmarke Sixth Formers take the lead in service, learning and providing solutions while developing collaboration, leadership and social skills. There are structured programmes for students to follow such as CAS (Creativity, Activity, Service) and Service Learning that lists a set of objectives to be used as guidance. These are ‚Äòneed and solution-based‚Äô programmes where students can choose to give service to their peers, the school, the local community and even make a global difference. These programmes make them understand the difference they can make to the world while developing emotional intelligence. Global Outlook As an international school training students to excel globally, we foster an ethos of honesty, responsibility, tolerance and respect for others within the academic and Positive Education curriculum. Sixth Form students take a leading role in celebrations such as International Day by sharing their own cultures and traditions with the rest of the community. As a multi-pathway school, we aim to make our students global citizens. Key Stage 4 Options Booklet Sunmarke has designed the below listed booklet to give information to our students about the courses they could study in Years 10 and 11. These are useful as a guide to choose the right options and also serve as a reference point throughout the two year IGCSE, GCSE or BTEC Level 2 programmes. It gives a glimpse of the areas of study within each subject that can be used to support the teaching and learning. Sunmarke parents can view the PDF version of the Key Stage 4 Options Booklet from our parent communication portal, VLE. Click here to view the Key Stage 4 Options Booklet Sixth Form Options Booklet We have designed the below booklet to inform and support our students on the multiple pathways available to them. We are unique in offering A Levels, BTECs, and being an IB world school, we also offer the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme and the International Baccalaureate Career Related Programme. It is therefore, important to understand each one to make an informed decision. Sunmarke parents can view the PDF version of the Sixth Form Options Booklet from our parent communication portal, VLE. Click here to view the Sixth Form Options Booklet

Here at Sunmarke we care about the journey that students go on and the skills they develop along the way. Our students are not defined by grades, they are a collection of skills and interests that show their passion, and we want them to strive to be better learners to best prepare them for the path they choose after they graduate. Students will develop these skills through sessions run in form time on developing as a learner and preparing for higher education. While attending sessions for the latter, students will be exposed to resources that will help them explore their passions through reading, videos and courses outside of the curriculum that are now available online at the click of a button. Outside of the form room is where you will differ in terms of skills developed. The International Baccalaureate Programmes places more of an emphasis in developing a variety of skills due to the diverse subjects students have to take whereas A-Levels allow students to delve deeper into a smaller selection of subjects. Different still are BTEC qualifications which have no exams and will, therefore, develop your investigation and research skills as you look to answer your briefs. Leadership All students at Sunmarke‚Äôs Sixth Form are leaders and role models and they embrace this responsibility fully. These young leaders play a crucial role in the growth of the school and the community. Within their academics, students are provided options to lead their own learning such as through the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ), available to A Level and BTEC students or through various pieces of coursework, such as the Extended Essay and Reflective Project on the International Baccalaureate pathways. There are several opportunities for students to assume leadership roles, form their own extra-curricular activities and represent the school as Senior Prefects, Senior Student Leadership Team, House Captains and Subject Ambassadors. Thinking Skills Preparing students to flourish in an environment that encourages critical and independent thinking, Sunmarke‚Äôs Sixth Form is imbued with the Positive Education approach. Students are trained through the Theory of Knowledge (TOK) curriculum that motivates them to ask questions about the world around them and think from multiple perspectives. Digital Learning Sixth Form students model the use and integration of digital technologies throughout their curriculum. Many digital tools are available such as Questia School, an online library and UniFrog, a platform for search, shortlist and applying for university courses. Sixth Form Students are taught to be at ease with technology, but also encouraged to question its validity, reliability and responsibility in a modern world. Media literacy is given a lot of importance at Sunmarke as students prepare to navigate the world beyond the school. Please view our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy here . Social Responsibility Sunmarke Sixth Formers take the lead in service, learning and providing solutions while developing collaboration, leadership and social skills. There are structured programmes for students to follow such as CAS (Creativity, Activity, Service) and Service Learning that lists a set of objectives to be used as guidance. These are ‚Äòneed and solution-based‚Äô programmes where students can choose to give service to their peers, the school, the local community and even make a global difference. These programmes make them understand the difference they can make to the world while developing emotional intelligence. Global Outlook As an international school training students to excel globally, we foster an ethos of honesty, responsibility, tolerance and respect for others within the academic and Positive Education curriculum. Sixth Form students take a leading role in celebrations such as International Day by sharing their own cultures and traditions with the rest of the community. As a multi-pathway school, we aim to make our students global citizens. Key Stage 4 Options Booklet Sunmarke has designed the below listed booklet to give information to our students about the courses they could study in Years 10 and 11. These are useful as a guide to choose the right options and also serve as a reference point throughout the two year IGCSE, GCSE or BTEC Level 2 programmes. It gives a glimpse of the areas of study within each subject that can be used to support the teaching and learning. Sunmarke parents can view the PDF version of the Key Stage 4 Options Booklet from our parent communication portal, VLE. Click here to view the Key Stage 4 Options Booklet Sixth Form Options Booklet We have designed the below booklet to inform and support our students on the multiple pathways available to them. We are unique in offering A Levels, BTECs, and being an IB world school, we also offer the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme and the International Baccalaureate Career Related Programme. It is therefore, important to understand each one to make an informed decision. Sunmarke parents can view the PDF version of the Sixth Form Options Booklet from our parent communication portal, VLE. title: A-Levels Sixth Form Schools in Dubai | Sunmarke School Dubai
content: A-Levels Sixth Form Schools in Dubai | Sunmarke School Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login A-Levels Learning > Sixth Form > A-Levels A-Levels An Internationally Recognised Qualification Focusing On Content-Driven Academic Subjects Why study A-Levels? Advanced Level qualifications (known as A-Levels) are individual subject based qualifications. They are one option available to students who are looking to study at university. With A-Levels being standalone qualifications, there is no requirement on subject combinations and students‚Äô only constraint is the combinations available within the school timetable. A-Levels are graded from A*-E. What does this Pathway look like? Students will usually take 3 or 4 A-Levels and this would be what universities would be looking for as offers are based mainly on 3 A-Level grades. If you are debating which subjects to choose, we recommend you start with 4 A-Levels so you can have a range to begin with which you can narrow down later. Students will receive 6 lessons per subject each week with most subjects being 100% examination-based. Subjects either fit into the category of modular A-Levels or linear A-Levels. In modular subjects, students will take up to three exams in Year 12 and up to three in Year 13 whereas, with linear A-Levels, students complete all exams at the end of Year 13. How does this Pathway lead to University? A-Levels are internationally recognised qualifications which will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. While taking A-Levels would give you the necessary prerequisites with regards to subjects, you may need to take further tests in English in order to study at universities where courses are delivered in English. In addition, students wishing to study certain subjects worldwide need to review the Mathematics requirements for entry into the university of their choice. What skills will I develop? Taking a combination of A-Levels will allow you to specialise in a particular area post 16 as opposed to waiting until you begin university. With few subjects having coursework components, there is a lot of focus on exam skills. However, there is the option of taking the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ) in order to develop your academic writing and research skills. Furthermore, the EPQ is a perfect opportunity for you to demonstrate and develop your interest in an area you want to go on to study at university; competitive universities are always looking for examples of students pursuing their academic passions outside of the classroom. Whether it be the other EPQ or another opportunity, we recommend you find an outlet to explore your passions through extra-curricular activities.

title: BTEC Programme - Business and Technology Education Council, Sunmarke
content: BTEC Programme - Business and Technology Education Council, Sunmarke Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login BTECs Learning > Sixth Form > BTECs BTECs A Dynamic BTEC Programme Helping Students Develop Vocational Skills To Move To University Or Into Direct Employment What are BTECs? Short for Business and Technology Education Council, BTECs are a practical-based, vocational qualification which offers the same equivalence to A-Levels when converted into UCAS points. Many industry sectors have a set of National Occupational Standards that professionals must follow. The learning content of BTECs is built around these National Occupational Standards, which is why BTECs are recognised as valuable qualifications. They provide the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a field or subject and are an excellent alternative to the more theory focused A-Levels or subjects on the IB Diploma Programme. What does this Pathway look like? BTECs are taught through application with students often going on educational visits and meeting industry specialists as well as completing one week of work experience in Year 12. Assessments are via regular coursework and projects throughout the 2-year course. If you know you don‚Äôt excel in exam conditions, BTECs can relieve this pressure, spreading out the work that dictates your final grade as 100% of your final grade will come from these coursework components. Students are able to take a combination of BTECs and A-Levels in order to have a balance between hands on learning whilst also taking more traditional subjects. How does this Pathway lead to University? BTECs are equivalent to A-Levels in terms of applications to universities. However, there are some universities which don‚Äôt accept these qualifications so you would need to research the different countries you would like to apply for in order to ensure you meet the admissions criteria for your desired destination. What skills will I develop? BTECs truly prepare students for the real world, offering them practical skills to be successful in the industry of their choosing. If you enjoy practical learning and want to study a specialised range of subjects, BTECs are the perfect option for you. Within each subject, more technical skills are developed; for example, we are very proud of our BTEC Media courses that allow students to create using hi-tech equipment as students learn how to get the most out of this technology.

Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Learning > Sixth Form > IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Supporting Students To Compete At The Global Level The mission of the International Baccalaureate Organisation (IBO)‚Äôs programmes is to ‚Äúdevelop inquiring, knowledgeable and caring young people who help to create a better and more peaceful world through education that builds intercultural understanding and respect.‚Äù Sunmarke offers the IB Diploma Programme as this mission aligns with our own to ‚ÄúNurture the next generation of change-makers for a better tomorrow.‚Äù Through its exceptional academic and non-academic initiatives, our school grooms our students to use their education to positively influence their communities. Find out more about the details of the IB Diploma Programme at Sunmarke. What is the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme? The International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IBDP) is a holistic programme which gives you a broad post 16 education whilst also allowing you to specialise in three subjects. You will take three Standard Level subjects and three Higher Level subjects as well as the Extended Essay, Theory of Knowledge and the Creativity, Activity and Service Programme (CAS). Each subject is graded from 1-7 with the diploma core (Theory of Knowledge and Extended Essay) giving 3 more points depending on the combination of grades in these components. Students must achieve a minimum total of 24 points to pass the Diploma Programme. What does this Pathway look like? Each week you will receive lessons in your 6 subjects (typically 4 lessons for higher level and 3 for standard level) as well as lessons in Theory of Knowledge (TOK). You will also receive sessions to develop writing and research skills needed for the Extended Essay. This is a piece of academic writing where you choose the subject, topic and research question to produce an answer in a 4,000 word research report. The CAS programme is a non-graded component which encourages students to set objectives in creative, active and service experiences outside of the classroom. Each subject has a coursework component worth at least 20% meaning the whole grade does not rest on the final exams. How does this Pathway lead to University? An internationally recognised qualification, the IBDP will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. With the DP developing more than just subject knowledge, universities see it as a perfect higher education preparation programme. As all students study English Language and Literature, you will meet the language requirement of most universities that deliver courses in English. The IBDP programme also continues a student‚Äôs study in Mathematics. Students completing the IBDP programme continue to study Mathematics and English throughout their Secondary education and are then able to demonstrate 4 years of study in Mathematics and English during the application process. The IB Diploma, due to its holistic nature and its requirements, is highly valued by universities worldwide. What skills will I develop? Through coursework components, the Extended Essay and Theory of Knowledge, you will learn to think critically, write well constructed, balanced arguments and write using an academic structure. The CAS programme develops skills to ensure you are a well-rounded student who has lots of experiences beyond the classroom to make you really stand out in university applications and interviews. IB Diploma Programme courses options on offer at Sunmarke: English Language & Literature Environmental Systems and Societies French Spanish Psychology Business Management Visual Arts Economics Physics Biology Chemistry Maths: Analysis & Approaches Maths: Application & Interpretation Film ¬© International Baccalaureate Organization 2018 At the core of the IB Programmes is a focus on teaching and learning, and the IB Learner Profile. The IB Learner Profile is a set of traits which the IB believes students must develop to meet the mission‚Äôs long-term goal. Throughout the two years of the programme, teachers will promote these attributes in lessons to help students become better learners which will enhance their academic journey and prepare them to be more independent after graduating from school. Below are the 10 traits that make up the IB Learner Profile.

programme that aims to builds leadership skills through various community initiatives Civitas is a Latin term for a body of cives or citizens united by a common law or purpose Our Mission Our mission is to develop global leaders with outstanding citizenship. Our Philosophy We believe that leadership, empathy and community can be nurtured in each student through various community outreach initiatives. We believe each student possesses unique strengths and capabilities and it is our responsibility to provide opportunities for personal growth and empowerment by enabling individuals to make meaningful contributions to Civitas societies. Our Purpose Civitas provides an exciting platform and opportunity for Sixth Form students to lead initiatives developing their leadership and organizational skills as well as knowledge. Each initiative or project has the dual purpose of student enrichment and community outreach developing engaged global citizens. Meet the CIVITAS Team Introducing the Head of Civitas Societies! Meet the extraordinary leader at Civitas, overseeing our 7 vibrant societies, including Medicine and Law. Get ready for exciting updates as our society heads take the stage to share their insights and initiatives. Stay tuned on our socials for more from our inspiring leaders! Introducing our Math Tutoring Leader! Meet Muhammad, the exceptional leader of our Math tutoring initiative within Civitas, our inspiring programme for student development, collaboration, and enrichment. Muhammad leads our dedicated volunteers from Secondary and Sixth Form as they support younger students in solving math problems. Stay tuned to learn more about their invaluable contributions! Introducing leader of our Student Enrichment Branch! Here‚Äôs introducing Kynan, the dynamic leader of our Student Enrichment Branch of the Civitas Programme, an exciting initiative for student growth and development. The goal is to foster a vibrant community where children support each other and work together in an academic setting. Stay tuned to learn more about the programme, including the ‚ÄòStudent Academic Tutoring‚Äô aspect, where senior volunteers provide valuable support to lower secondary students. Introducing Co-Leaders of the Science Society! Introducing Civitas‚Äô Co-Leaders of the Science Society ‚Äì a passionate community of students devoted to all things Science! Our leaders will empower younger students through exciting activities and events, enriching their knowledge and igniting their passion for Science.

Counsellor Careers Counsellor Specialist Staff To Guide and Inspire Students To Find The Right Career Pathway Specialist One-to-One Support Sunmarke has two full-time Careers Counsellors, who, along with Form Tutors and the Head of 6 th Form, advise students on their higher education and career path. Students works closely with these experts and parents are always welcome to speak to our Careers and University team to find a pathway suitable for their child. Through conversations and research, students can find their calling and a pathway of study that excites and enthuses. Read below to see the different opportunities and platforms we use in order to help students get excited about education outside of the Sunmarke classrooms. UNIFROG Unifrog is the career and university platform that is used at Sunmarke School. It‚Äôs an impartial, user-friendly platform that helps students to research their future pathways. It contains a repository of career lessons, information on pathways, universities around the world, CV builder, personality tests, and links to MOOCs (online courses). Unifrog is useful for students in their last four years of study but can be accessed and used by all in Secondary. Students can use the platform to start to explore the different post 18 pathways and the application process for their chosen route. Careers lessons in Y12 focus on psychometric testing, university and career research and to start working on application requirements such as personal statements and US university essays. We encourage all families to explore this platform together as early as possible in order to start the conversation as to where a student may study as well as what the course requirements are in order to make sure the right combination of subjects are being chosen post 16. There are many factors that go into shortlisting universities such as location, size, tuition fees or university housing to name just a few; with all this choice, it is important to narrow down to specific countries in Year 12 so the application process is not overwhelming in Year 13. Students work one-on-one with the university careers counsellors who assist and guide students through every step of the application process. University Destinations Sunmarke students achieve their first choice university destinations which has included UK Russel Group schools, and top Worldwide destinations such as the Imperial College London, NYU, University of Amsterdam, Bocconi, Carnegie Mellon, UCLA, UC San Diego, Georgia Tech, The University of Toronto, McGill and University of Edinburgh. For a full list of our destinations, click here . Offline University Guidance Parents are invited to join our ‚ÄòSunRise Sessions‚Äô where they learn about different aspects of applying to universities around the world and get informed about the procedures and pathways. Our tailored programme of learning includes researching courses, writing personal statements, practising for aptitude tests and interviews, holding mock interviews and completing applications. We also host admissions teams from leading universities from around the world each year, giving students a unique opportunity to find out more about their courses and expectations. If Oxford, Cambridge or the American Ivy Leagues are in your sights, we have a specialist team to advise you. Think & Thrive Entrepreneur Series ‚ÄòThink & Thrive‚Äô is Sunmarke‚Äôs very own Speaker Series linking innovators and business leaders in the region with savvy students. A student moderated event, ‚ÄòThink & Thrive‚Äô allows them to interact with guests in a unique, studio-style setting. Guest speakers have included: Ishwar Chugani, CEO and Managing Director of Giordana Fashions Virgin Radio DJ Brent Black Sonia Weymuller, Managing Partner of Venture Souq Zubin Chiba, Corporate Finance Leader and Partner ‚Äì PwC Middle East Maaz Sheikh ‚Äì CEO of Starz Play Nida Raza ‚Äì Senior Director and Head of Global Capital Markets at JLL Manish Hira ‚Äì Managing Director, Hira Industries Balki Radhakrishnan, Vice President and Managing Director ‚Äì General Mills AMEA Dr Marc Sinclair, Head of Orthopaedics ‚Äì King‚Äôs College Hospital Cristina de Torres, Partner ‚Äì PwC Middle East Francois Oberholzer, CFO ‚Äì Flydubai Dr Ryan Penny ‚Äì Therapeutic Lifestyle Consultant Eleni Giokos ‚Äì CNN Correspondent Rasna Al Khamis ‚Äì Chief Marketing Officer of Emirates Nature Kitchen Lachlan ‚Äì RJ at LUV 107.1 and Deputy Program Director / Announcer at TALK 100.3 Maitha Alawadi ‚Äì Scriptwriter and Director Malika Singh ‚Äì Producer Watch one of our Think & Thrive highlights video below: Workplace Internships At Sunmarke Academic knowledge complemented by real-world experience is most effective while preparing students for a great career. At Sunmarke, we encourage our students in Year 10 and 12 to actively participate in work experience programmes during the final week of Term 3. For our Year 12 IBCP students, work experience is an integral part of their curriculum. We work with our parent community and other links to companies to create meaningful experiences for students in a variety of sectors. Companies who participate in our Workplace Internships programme are listed below. Banking : ‚Äì Citibank Investment Banking: ‚Äì JP Morgan Chase ‚Äì Goldman Sachs Consulting: ‚Äì Deloitte ‚Äì McKinsey & Company ‚Äì Delta Partners Business Consultancy ‚Äì PWC Healthcare: ‚Äì Saudi German Hospital ‚Äì New York Dental Studio ‚Äì Kings College Hospital ‚Äì Emirates Specialty Hospital ‚Äì Takeda Pharmaceuticals Hotels & Hospitality: ‚Äì Jumeirah Group ‚Äì Atlantis Hotel ‚Äì Grand Hyatt Creek ‚Äì Zabeel House Hotel ‚Äì Pullman Hotel ‚Äì Business Bay ‚Äì Movenpick JLT Construction: ‚Äì GBH Construction ‚Äì Caterpillar Health & Fitness: ‚Äì Johnson & Johnson ‚Äì Tribe Fit ‚Äì Emirates Golf Club ‚Äì Sustainable City Equestrian Club Technology: ‚Äì IBM ‚Äì Microsoft Finance ‚Äì Help AG Dubai ‚Äì Vision Valley ‚Äì Finastra ‚Äì Logitech ‚Äì FEDS ‚Äì Drones Venture Capital: ‚Äì LAZARD Fund Managers ‚Äì Detec Space Contracting E- Commerce : ‚Äì Lightspeed Online Recruitment: ‚Äì Bayt Retail: ‚Äì Aurea Puig Fashion ‚Äì Guiseppe Zannotti Real Estate: ‚Äì Tabani Real Estate ‚Äì MAG Properties ‚Äì Time Properties Law: ‚Äì Hadef & Partners Aviation: ‚Äì Fly Dubai Energy/ Engineering: ‚Äì SVS Energi ‚Äì Hira Industries Automotive: ‚Äì Pro Fix International ‚Äì Exotic Cars ‚Äì Super Fix Garage Media/TV/ Press/ Production: ‚Äì First and Ten ‚Äì E7awi ‚Äì Base Films Veterinary Services : ‚Äì Paws and Relax ‚Äì Umm Sequim Vet Center ‚Äì European Veterinary Center ‚Äì Pawsome Pets Career Links Careers education, information, advice and guidance is an essential part of the support we offer to students. As options for young people become more varied and complex, it is vital that we support them with knowledge and skills they need to make informed choices. As a result, the careers guidance has a whole-school remit designed to complement the rest of the school curriculum. This policy sets out how career activities are delivered at school and what stakeholders can expect. Aims and Objectives The careers guidance aims to: Encourage students to be ambitious, broaden their horizons and explore their own aspirations throughout their life at school Ensure students‚Äô readiness to take their next step in their learning or career Help students to understand the changing world of work Facilitate meaningful encounters with potential employers Support positive transitions Post-16 and Post-18 Enable students to develop research skills Help them to develop the skills, attitudes and qualities to make a successful transition into the world of work Encourage participation in continued learning, including further and higher education Support inclusion, challenging stereotyping and promoting equality of opportunity Contribute to strategies for raising achievement, particularly by increasing motivation

Design Thinking STEAM & Design Thinking Programme Future-Ready Learning in Our SPACE-X Innovation Lab Programme Overview At Sunmarke School, the STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Mathematics) Signature Programme transforms students into inventors, engineers, designers, and problem-solvers through immersive, real-world learning. Anchored in our state-of-the-art SPACE-X Innovation and Design Thinking Lab, the programme encourages experimentation, collaboration, and creativity from EYFS to Year 11. Who It‚Äôs For All students from EYFS through Year 11 ‚Äî regardless of prior technical knowledge. Support is available for all learning needs, including Students of Determination. Programmes > Environment & Sustainability Environment & Sustainability Programme Nurturing Tomorrow's Environmental Changemakers Through Forest School Programme Overview Preparing Global Environmental Leaders With climate change at the forefront of global challenges, Sunmarke‚Äôs Environment & Sustainability Programme nurtures a deep connection with nature while developing scientific knowledge, eco-leadership, and sustainability values. Our immersive outdoor learning environments ‚Äî including the Forest School, Zen Garden, Vegetable Garden, and Hydroponic Farming Lab ‚Äî make sustainability an everyday experience. Who It‚Äôs For All students from EYFS to Year 13. The programme is cross-disciplinary and fully integrated into academic and co-curricular learning. Learning Journey EYFS: Sensory play, simple conservation habits, nature appreciation Primary: Ecosystem studies, organic gardening, biodegradable product design Secondary: Environmental research, global climate advocacy, sustainability leadership Natural Learning Environments Forest Garden: Guided biodiversity exploration Vegetable Garden: Organic farming and seasonal harvesting Zen Garden: Mindfulness and reflection in nature Hydroponic Lab: Soil-free, water-conserving agriculture using high-tech systems Signature Programme Elements Climate-focused STEM projects and eco-entrepreneurship Desert, beach, and neighbourhood clean-up drives Biodiversity and conservation field studies Student-led petitions and environmental campaigns Integration of UN Sustainable Development Goals TASS ( The Alliance for Sustainable Schools) ‚Äì empowering our students to lead sustainable change through global collaboration and impactful green initiatives. Wellbeing Through Nature Stress reduction, focus, creativity, and resilience through outdoor learning Character strengths like empathy, perseverance, and responsibility nurtured in real-world contexts Curriculum Integration Science: Ecology, conservation biology, climate systems Technology: Environmental monitoring, VR tools, climate modelling Engineering: Renewable energy, sustainable design Math: Statistical analysis and modelling of environmental data Languages: Cultural approaches to conservation (Mandarin, Hindi, French) Facilities & Resources Hydroponic stations, composting units, environmental sensors Outdoor classrooms and natural laboratories Community garden and student-led sustainability zones such as Forest School and Zen Garden. Pathways & Progression GCSE, A-Level, BTEC and IB Environmental Systems & Societies Career preparation in sustainability, conservation, and environmental policy Strong university placement record in environmental and science fields Next Steps Join a Forest School session, explore the Hydroponic Lab, or attend our student-led Sustainability Showcase to witness the programme in action. Programme Signature Programmes > University & Career Readiness Programme University & Career Readiness Programme Helping Students Build Futures That Matter Programme Overview This comprehensive programme supports students from Year 7 to Year 13 in identifying their passions, building their personal brand, and preparing for competitive university and career pathways. Pro Sports Academy Fortes Pro Sports Academy From Playground to Podium: Building Champions On and Off the Field Programme Overview The Pro Sports Academy Programme at Sunmarke is a multi-tiered sports development pathway designed to build both participation and high performance. With over 100 competitive squads, elite coaching, and international representation, students experience sport as a source of joy, discipline, and excellence. Who It‚Äôs For All students from Year 2 to Year 13 ‚Äî from aspiring athletes to passionate sports enthusiasts. What Makes It Unique 104 squads across 13 sports disciplines Performance hubs Coaching by Olympians, ex-professionals, and UEFA-certified coaches Weekly strength & conditioning, sports nutrition, and analytics Girls in Sport strategic focus to increase female athletic leadership Digital Sports Passport tracking participation, achievements, leadership Signature Experiences Representation in DASSA, BSME, World School Games Fortes Falcons international touring squads Netball Masterclasses, Aquathlon Stars, Cheerleading Excellence Performance Nutrition Clinics and Match Analysis Labs Termly intra-school and inter-school competitions Facilities FIFA ‚Äì 18 Sized Football Pitch 200 Meter Athletics Running Track Two Swimming Pools Tennis, Basketball, Volleyball and Netball Courts Two Expansive Multipurpose Halls Pathways Beyond School Scholarships to US and UK universities Coaching and umpire certifications (e.g., Netball C Award) Pathways in sports science, media, and sports management Next Steps Try out for a squad in Term 1, enrol in ECAs, or apply to join the Fortes Falcons for the next season of international competition. Meet Our Team Get to know the passionate coaches and mentors behind the Fortes Pro Sports Academy Programme. Serving both Sunmarke School and Regent International School , our team of certified professionals is dedicated to nurturing talent, building confidence, and helping every athlete reach their full potential ‚Äì both on and off the field. Education Positive Education Where Amazing Happens: Nurturing Hearts, Minds & Character for Life Programme Overview A Global Paradigm Shift in Education Sunmarke School is internationally recognised as a leader in Positive Education (PosEd), combining the science of Positive Psychology with world-class pedagogy. Our whole-school approach fosters wellbeing, character development, and academic excellence through intentional practices embedded across every phase. Who is it for ? Our POSED (Positive Education) programme is designed for all students, from EYFS through to Year 13, nurturing wellbeing, resilience, and character development at every stage of their learning journey. The Science Behind PosEd Based on evidence from the University of Pennsylvania and Geelong Grammar School, PosEd improves academic achievement, social-emotional skills, and mental health. Students flourish by developing emotional intelligence, resilience, optimism, and a strong sense of purpose. Learning Journey EYFS: Play-based social learning, emotional literacy, friendships Primary: Growth mindset, kindness curriculum, resilience games Secondary: Mental health education, leadership through values, strengths-based career planning What Students Experience Daily character strengths integration across all subjects Signature strengths-based learning across six virtues (e.g., wisdom, courage, humanity) Classroom mindfulness, reflective journaling, peer recognition Termly themes and classroom initiatives aligned with PosEd values Support Ecosystem Counsellors, Heads of Year, and form tutors trained in PosEd practices Parent community workshops: Wellness Wednesday, Digital Age Parenting, Nutrition & Wellbeing Drop-in wellbeing support and crisis intervention protocols Recognition & Impact KHDA rated ‚ÄòVery Good‚Äô and BSO awarded an ‚ÄòOutstanding‚Äô rating for wellbeing.‚Äô Top 5 academic performance in Dubai driven by PosEd integration University placements and corporate internships linked to confidence, resilience, and purpose Facilities & Tools Quiet spaces for mindfulness and reflection Digital wellbeing platforms Character strengths diagnostic tools Peer mentorship and PosEd ambassador programme Next Steps Join one of our Positive Education (PosEd) workshops, attend a parent information session, or connect with our dedicated wellbeing team to learn how we nurture student wellbeing, resilience, and character development across all year groups. Language Academy Global Language Academy Connecting Language, Culture & Global Citizenship Programme Overview Sunmarke‚Äôs Global Languages Programme immerses students in two of the world‚Äôs most influential languages ‚Äî Hindi and Mandarin ‚Äî helping them become confident communicators and empathetic global citizens. Through storytelling, culture, cuisine, arts, and literature, students don‚Äôt just learn a language ‚Äî they experience a civilisation. Who It‚Äôs For All students from EYFS to Year 13 ‚Äî including beginners, heritage learners, and those learning as a foreign language. What Students Experience Hindi Programme: Offered from EYFS to Year 6, focusing on festivals, food, theatre, and personal identity Mandarin Programme: Offered from EYFS to Year 9, aligned with the Youth Chinese Test (YCT) and GCSE Integration of language with culture through activities like calligraphy, traditional dance, tai chi, cooking, and music Celebration assemblies, festivals, and school-wide events for Diwali, Holi, and Chinese New Year Learning Journey EYFS: Gentle immersion through storytelling, songs, and sensory activities Primary: Games, roleplay, cultural crafts, cooking, oral fluency Secondary: Grammar, writing, debating, cross-cultural discussions, YCT and GCSE prep Cultural Fluency Development Guest workshops, performances, and cultural exchanges Integrated storytelling and global themes across languages and literature Personal identity development and intercultural understanding Facilities & Learning Tools Immersive classrooms with cultural artefacts Professional audio-visual tools and gamified apps Culturally responsive library collections in Hindi and Mandarin Curriculum and Assessment Aligned with international language learning pathways Integrated into core curriculum, supported by enrichment and ECAs Assessment includes formative feedback, portfolios , and recognised external qualifications Links to IB and A-Level language options , international university language entry requirements Next Steps Speak to the Head of Global, visit a class, attend a cultural showcase, or explore our Languages programme to begin your child‚Äôs multilingual journey. Programmes > Financial Literacy Programme Financial Literacy Programme Empowering Smart Thinkers, Savvy Spenders, and Ethical Investors for Life Programme Overview Rethinking Money, Purpose & Power Sunmarke‚Äôs Financial Literacy Programme builds money-smart who understand how to earn, manage, grow, and give responsibly. Combining practical learning with global best practices, the programme encourages ethical investment, personal finance skills, and entrepreneurial thinking through hands-on experience and real-world simulations. Who is it for? Our Financial Literacy Programme is designed for all students ‚Äî from EYFS through to Year 13 ‚Äî equipping them with essential money management skills from an early age. Learning Journey EYFS: Needs vs wants, saving, goal-setting, money role-play Primary: Micro-enterprises, budgeting for STEAM projects, school markets Secondary: Budgeting, taxes, investment simulations, crypto literacy Flagship Feature (Years 10‚Äì13) Wharton Global High School Investment Competition Select students are invited to represent Sunmarke in this prestigious competition from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania . ‚Ä¢ Compete globally with students from 65+ countries ‚Ä¢ Work in teams to manage a $100,000 virtual portfolio ‚Ä¢ Develop deep skills in financial analysis, strategic thinking, and investor reporting ‚Ä¢ Benefit from mentorship, leadership coaching , and real-world financial expertise Signature Experiences Wharton Global High School Investment Competition Stock market and crypto simulation games Guest talks by ethical investors and bankers Field trips to financial institutions Global microloan projects in collaboration with nonprofits Skills Developed Financial numeracy and budgeting Entrepreneurial strategy and innovation Ethical reasoning and decision-making Self-discipline and long-term goal planning Curriculum Integration Maths: Ratios, interest, modelling Business & Economics: Market dynamics, investment planning Humanities: Ethical wealth, socio-economic systems STEAM: Product Innovation, Pricing and sustainability accounting Recognition & Pathways Competitive edge for degrees in finance, business, economics, and entrepreneurship Preparation for GCSE, A-Level, IB Economics and Business Financial Literacy Journals and Portfolios for university applications Next Steps Attend the Sunmarke Finance Fair, speak with our Business & Economics faculty, or learn about alumni who‚Äôve pursued global business and finance careers. Programmes > Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Accelerated Business Leadership for the Next Generation of Entrepreneurs, Economists & Changemakers Programme Overview From the Classroom to the Boardroom: A First Glimpse at the MBA Mindset The Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme at Sunmarke offers ambitious students in Years 10 to 13 a transformative opportunity to explore the world of business, strategy, leadership, and innovation. Designed in collaboration with Sunmarke‚Äôs business faculty and guest lecturers from the University of Birmingham, this selective programme mirrors the academic and practical rigour of a traditional MBA ‚Äî adapted for high school learners. Who It‚Äôs For Business and Economics students (Y10‚Äì13) Future leaders in entrepreneurship, consulting, finance, marketing, or social impact Motivated students seeking university-level academic challenge and real-world relevance Programme Highlights Weekly MBA-style modules delivered during school hours Led by Sunmarke business faculty and University of Birmingham lecturers Real-world business challenges, simulations, and professional mentoring Capstone business project presented to external academic and industry leaders Key Topics Covered Strategic Thinking & Organisational Leadership Entrepreneurship & Venture Creation Corporate Finance & Investment Decision-Making Marketing Strategy & Brand Development ESG & Business Ethics Global Economics & Market Forces Business Analytics & Data-Driven Decision Making Operations & Supply Chain Management Capstone Business Project Each student or team creates a business plan and formal pitch based on a real-world challenge. They develop: Business model and financial forecasting Market research and investor strategies Public speaking and persuasive presentation skills A final pitch judged by entrepreneurs, university professors, and investors Skills & Student Outcomes Analytical and financial reasoning Team leadership and stakeholder management Strategic problem-solving and innovation Strong university and internship readiness Recognition & Pathways Mini-MBA Certificate of Completion Showcase at Sunmarke‚Äôs Enterprise Exhibition Shortlisted projects may be submitted for interschool and global business competitions Next Steps Apply through the Business Department. Attend the Mini-MBA Info Evening or explore past capstone projects to get inspired. Performing Arts Programme Signature Programmes > Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Empowering Student Voice Through Creative Expression Programme Overview This dynamic programme blends drama, journalism, podcasting, public speaking, film, and media production into a powerful creative journey. Across all phases, students explore how storytelling, movement, voice, and technology can influence, inspire, and ignite change ‚Äî all while developing confidence and stage presence in Sunmarke‚Äôs world-class performing arts facilities. Who It‚Äôs For All students from EYFS to Year 13, with progressive exposure to theatre, communication, media production, and digital storytelling. Learning Journey EYFS & Years 1‚Äì2: Storytelling corners, mini-stages, puppetry, ‚ÄòShow and Tell‚Äô Years 3‚Äì6: Primary Drama, Junior Journalism Club, podcasting, performance poetry Years 7‚Äì9: Music and Drama, ensemble performance, student newspaper writing, public speaking Years 10‚Äì11: IGCSE/BTEC Creative Media, Sunmarke Newsroom, school podcast and radio productions. Years 12‚Äì13: IB Film / A-Level Media, extended podcasts, leadership communication projects Signature Techniques & Tools Voice & Persuasion: TED Talks, MUN, debates Audio & Broadcast: In-house podcasting studio, sound editing tools Written Communication: Blogs, opinion pieces, editorial writing Visual Storytelling: Film production, storyboard workshops, cinematography Stage & Screen: Annual theatre productions, skits, monologues, musical showcases Signature Experiences The Buzz Reporters editorial team Fortes Film Lab with coaching and equipment Speech Festivals and performance showcases Local internships with media houses and radio stations University masterclasses and industry panels Facilities 400-seat Sunmarke Auditorium Podcasting studio and media production suite Film editing lab and digital newsroom setup Black box Music lab Pathways & Progression Media, Journalism, Communications, Performing Arts university pathways Careers in media strategy, podcasting, digital content, stage direction, or public relations Assessment Models Coursework: Video projects, written publications, podcasts and creative portfolios Performance Review: Monologue and group presentation assessments Feedback Cycles: Peer reviews, professional critique panels, and self-evaluation Real-World Metrics: Podcast streams, article views, and theatre audience engagement Next Steps Join a student production, apply to the Buzz Reporters, or pitch your idea for a podcast or short film to the Media & Performing Arts team. Read more Pro Sports Academy Sunmarke‚Äôs Pro Sports Academy develops athletes through elite coaching, 100+ squads, and global competitions, integrating fitness, nutrition, and resilience for lifelong excellence, discipline, and success beyond sport. Read more Positive Education Internationally recognised for its holistic approach, the school blends wellbeing, character development, and Positive Psychology, nurturing resilient, empathetic, confident learners who thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. Details About The Costs Involved And Processes We understand that your child‚Äôs education is one of the greatest personal investments you will make and we guarantee an outstanding education in a world class IB and British curriculum school like Sunmarke will prepare them to thrive and grow in a complex, dynamic world. Year (British Curriculum) Age Range (Years) Sunmarke School Tuition Fees for 2025 ‚Äì 2026 (AED) Term 1 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Term 2 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Term 3 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Foundation Stage 1 3-4 53,040 21,216 15,912 15,912 Foundation Stage 2 4-5 58,164 23,266 17,449 17,449 Year 1 5-6 65,844 26,338 19,753 19,753 Year 2 6-7 65,939 26,376 19,782 19,782 Year 3 7-8 66,824 26,730 20,047 20,047 Year 4 8-9 66,920 26,768 20,076 20,076 Year 5 9-10 66,980 26,792 20,094 20,094 Year 6 10-11 66,982 26,793 20,095 20,095 Year 7 11-12 82,676 33,070 24,803 24,803 Year 8 12-13 82,755 33,101 24,827 24,827 Year 9 13-14 82,876 33,150 24,863 24,863 Year 10 14-15 86,860 34,744 26,058 26,058 Year 11 15-16 86,985 34,793 26,096 26,096 Year 12 16-17 88,411 35,365 26,523 26,523 Year 13 17-18 88,538 35,416 26,561 26,561 Our Annual School Fee Includes: Disclaimer: Does not include activities run by third-party service providers. GCSE, BTEC, IB and A Level examination fee charged separately. Student Individual Needs support is chargeable. Tuition Fees are subject to KHDA approval and are reviewed annually. Enrolment Age Calculator Request a call back KHDA Factsheet 2025-2026 FS 1 FS 2 Year 1 Year 2 Year 3 Year 4 Year 5 Year 6 Year 7 Year 8 Year 9 Year 10 Year 11 Year 12 Year 13 Assessment & Application Fees Application & Assessment Fee: A one-time application fee of AED 525 for new students (this includes the Assessment Fee) ‚Äì Non-refundable & due on submission of Application. Acceptance Fee (New Students): 10% of Tuition Fee ‚Äì Non-refundable & payable within 5 days from the date of Offer. This fee is deducted from the Tuition Fee due in the term of joining. Re-enrolment Fees (Existing Students): 5% of Annual Tuition Fee or AED 500 (whichever is higher) ‚Äì Non-refundable and due at the start of Term 3 of the current academic year. Sibling Discounts Sibling Discounts: If more than one child is admitted to the school for a complete academic year, the following discounts up to a maximum of 4 siblings, will be deducted from that sibling‚Äôs Tuition Fee: ‚Ä¢ Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke: No Discount ‚Ä¢ 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd TermTuition fee as per the SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy NB: Terms and conditions apply to children transferring from Regent International School. Payment Methods Payment of Fees (Tuition, Transport, Exam, Activity & Uniform Fees): For your convenience, we offer parents multiple ways to pay fees. Parents can pay by credit card via the School‚Äôs secure Desktop Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) or VLE Mobile App which can be downloaded from the Google Playstore for Android phones or Apple App Store for iPhones. Once a child is admitted, the Admissions team provides parents with their login credentials, i.e., username and password. Parents can also pay fees by (a) Bank Transfer to the bank account given below, or (b) by Cash, Credit Card or Cheque (in favour of Sunmarke School) at the School‚Äôs Account‚Äôs Office. Uniform fees are to be paid separately at the School‚Äôs Uniform Shop. Fees for field trips, events and fund-raisers must be paid online, (as and when the activity takes place), via the School‚Äôs secure Desktop Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) or VLE Mobile App. Bank Details SCHOOL ACCOUNT DETAILS Payment can be made via wire transfer to the following account: Account Name Sunmarke School LLC Tuition Fees ‚Äì Due Dates Autumn Term: 01 st August Spring Term: 15 th November Summer Term: 15 th February Re-enrolment: 01 st day of Term 3 Account Number 012000921414 Bank Name National Bank of Fujairah PJSC Branch Jebel Ali Swift Code NBFUAEAFDXB IBAN Number AE220380000012000921414 Remarks | | | | Please email proof of all payments to: payments.sms@forteseducation.com Additional Fees (charged separately from Tuition Fee): Optional Transportation Services via 3rd Party Service Provider Optional Dining Services via 3rd Party Service Provider Optional After-School Activities provided by 3rd Party Service Providers School Uniforms Educational Visits Please note, the School‚Äôs Tuition Fees are subject to change in accordance with the Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) Fee Framework. For full details of fees and any applicable discounts, please contact the Admissions Office telephone +971 (04) 423 8900 or email: admissions.sms@forteseducation.com . title: Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students | Sunmarke School
content: Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students | Sunmarke School Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Scholarships Admissions > Scholarships Sunmarke Fellows Our Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students The Fortes Scholarship Programme is a recognition of ability and application of students who have not only demonstrated a high level of academic, sporting or artistic skills, but have also displayed motivation and drive to succeed. Inspiring Purpose. Driving Passion. With exceptional teachers and subject specialists, we provide a dynamic and innovative curriculum that is designed to meet and inspire the talents and interests of our Gifted & Talented scholars. Our approach helps students stretch their abilities, build confidence, and pursue advanced pathways that match their strengths. We encourage curiosity, creativity, and independence so each scholar can excel in areas where they show remarkable potential. FAQs What are the available Scholarship Categories? Currently, our Fortes Schools are offering the following scholarship categories: Academic Scholarship Academic geniuses who strive for a place at the world‚Äôs top universities. Sports Scholarship Outstanding performers on the field who can bring laurels to their school and nation Music Scholarship Passionate performers who can touch the hearts of millions with their vocals or skills on a musical instrument. Art Scholarship Artists who can colour the canvas with their imagination and expression. Student of the Future Scholarship Visionary thinkers who we can mould for the jobs of the future. The Founder‚Äôs Scholarship We are looking for the gifted and talented who we can support in their journey to become legends. What are the Scholarship Criteria? Do keep the following documents ready before you fill in the application form: Criteria for All Scholarships 2 references 3 Essay questions Personal statement (< 500 words) Scholarship question (<500 words) Leadership essay (< 500 words) Video presentation (< 7 mins) Video must have: Introduction to yourself Why do you deserve this scholarship? Additional Criteria for Academic Scholarships CAT score = or > 133 For students applying for Year 10, 11 and 13: GL Data in Y9 and Y10 to be Stanine 8 or above in English, Maths and or Science For students applying for Year 12: 10 or more GCSEs taken with scores of 7-9‚Äôs or A to A* Additional Criteria for Sports Scholarships The student should have achieved national/international sporting representative honours in at least 1 of the following sports ‚Äì Football, Swimming, Basketball, Cricket, Netball, Golf, Rugby, Volleyball, Athletics, Tennis. Valid for the last 2 years Or any notable awards received. Additional Criteria for Music Scholarships The student should have achieved Grade 6 in at least 1 musical instrument or voice through Trinity or ABRSM Valid in the last 3 years Evidence of solo live performance outside of school Additional Criteria for Art Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of exhibition Additional Criteria for Student of the Future Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of having a future skill. The skill can be related to Coding, Crypto, Social Work, Robotics, etc. Certifications/endorsements required. What do we expect from a scholar? We would like to set expectations with the scholar on performance during the scholarship year. This is essential for the Scholarship Performance Review. For All Scholars: Consistent commitment to growth and development Active participation in internal and external activities. For example, the World Scholar‚Äôs Cup, MUN, TEDx, Duke of Edinburgh, Internships, social work among others To act as a brand ambassador of the school across all platforms. For example, social media, PR, videos, etc. For Academic Scholars: To be in the 95 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Sports Scholars: Maintain national/international representation in the sport or participate and represent the school in a notable tournament To be in the 70 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Music Scholars: Participation in school showcases such as concerts, musicals, etc. Participation in the school bands, choirs and ensembles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Arts Scholars: A* or 8-9 in GCSE Art and Design, Ceramics or Textiles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) Maintain an exceptional portfolio and evidence of external exhibition For Student of the Future Scholars: Maintain an exceptional portfolio of future skill To be in the 80 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) What will we offer? Our Fortes School will create an environment conducive for a scholar‚Äôs growth. A Fortes School will : For All Scholars Ensure that the student receives guidance to develop a strong character and become a well-rounded individual Ensure the student has adequate support to perform academically Ensure opportunities to explore leadership positions within the Student Leadership Team Ensure opportunities to participate in activities outside the curriculum For Academic Scholars Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards For Sports Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Music Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Art Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Student of the Future Scholar Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards Ensure that the student receives opportunities to meet mentors in the field of interest Students from which Year Groups are eligible for a Scholarship? Students in Year 9 (British Curriculum) or equivalent in other curriculums applying for Year 10 and upwards are eligible for scholarships. Where to apply for the Fortes Scholarship Programme? New Student to the School After filling out the Admission Application Form Complete the admission application form to Fortes School. At the end of the application form, select the button to ‚ÄòApply for Scholarship‚Äô. You will be directed to the Scholarship Form. Request for the Scholarship Form You can also request for the Scholarship Form from the admissions team, who will send you a unique link. However, the Application Form is mandatory in this case as well. Sunmarke Student You may apply for the scholarship via the VLE where you will find a link to the Scholarship Application Form. Click here to log in. What to expect after submitting the Scholarship Form? Application Review : Your application will be reviewed by our Academic Panel Audition : Should you get shortlisted, you will be invited to the school for an audition Interview : If you make it as a finalist, you will be invited for an interview with the Principal of the school Finally, your application will be assessed and successful applicants could receive a partial scholarship on the annual fees. Is the Scholarship only for the Year of admission or all subsequent years? A scholarship is renewable yearly between Year 10 and Year 13. The student‚Äôs scholarship continuation is subject to a termly Panel Review that showcases his/her participation, growth and development .

Details About The Costs Involved And Processes We understand that your child‚Äôs education is one of the greatest personal investments you will make and we guarantee an outstanding education in a world class IB and British curriculum school like Sunmarke will prepare them to thrive and grow in a complex, dynamic world. Year (British Curriculum) Age Range (Years) Sunmarke School Tuition Fees for 2025 ‚Äì 2026 (AED) Term 1 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Term 2 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Term 3 Tuition Fee for 2025-2026 (AED) Foundation Stage 1 3-4 53,040 21,216 15,912 15,912 Foundation Stage 2 4-5 58,164 23,266 17,449 17,449 Year 1 5-6 65,844 26,338 19,753 19,753 Year 2 6-7 65,939 26,376 19,782 19,782 Year 3 7-8 66,824 26,730 20,047 20,047 Year 4 8-9 66,920 26,768 20,076 20,076 Year 5 9-10 66,980 26,792 20,094 20,094 Year 6 10-11 66,982 26,793 20,095 20,095 Year 7 11-12 82,676 33,070 24,803 24,803 Year 8 12-13 82,755 33,101 24,827 24,827 Year 9 13-14 82,876 33,150 24,863 24,863 Year 10 14-15 86,860 34,744 26,058 26,058 Year 11 15-16 86,985 34,793 26,096 26,096 Year 12 16-17 88,411 35,365 26,523 26,523 Year 13 17-18 88,538 35,416 26,561 26,561 Our Annual School Fee Includes: Disclaimer: Does not include activities run by third-party service providers. GCSE, BTEC, IB and A Level examination fee charged separately. Student Individual Needs support is chargeable. Tuition Fees are subject to KHDA approval and are reviewed annually. Enrolment Age Calculator Request a call back KHDA Factsheet 2025-2026 FS 1 FS 2 Year 1 Year 2 Year 3 Year 4 Year 5 Year 6 Year 7 Year 8 Year 9 Year 10 Year 11 Year 12 Year 13 Assessment & Application Fees Application & Assessment Fee: A one-time application fee of AED 525 for new students (this includes the Assessment Fee) ‚Äì Non-refundable & due on submission of Application. Acceptance Fee (New Students): 10% of Tuition Fee ‚Äì Non-refundable & payable within 5 days from the date of Offer. This fee is deducted from the Tuition Fee due in the term of joining. Re-enrolment Fees (Existing Students): 5% of Annual Tuition Fee or AED 500 (whichever is higher) ‚Äì Non-refundable and due at the start of Term 3 of the current academic year. Sibling Discounts Sibling Discounts: If more than one child is admitted to the school for a complete academic year, the following discounts up to a maximum of 4 siblings, will be deducted from that sibling‚Äôs Tuition Fee: ‚Ä¢ Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke: No Discount ‚Ä¢ 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd TermTuition fee as per the SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy ‚Ä¢ 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy NB: Terms and conditions apply to children transferring from Regent International School. Payment Methods Payment of Fees (Tuition, Transport, Exam, Activity & Uniform Fees): For your convenience, we offer parents multiple ways to pay fees. Parents can pay by credit card via the School‚Äôs secure Desktop Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) or VLE Mobile App which can be downloaded from the Google Playstore for Android phones or Apple App Store for iPhones. Once a child is admitted, the Admissions team provides parents with their login credentials, i.e., username and password. Parents can also pay fees by (a) Bank Transfer to the bank account given below, or (b) by Cash, Credit Card or Cheque (in favour of Sunmarke School) at the School‚Äôs Account‚Äôs Office. Uniform fees are to be paid separately at the School‚Äôs Uniform Shop. Fees for field trips, events and fund-raisers must be paid online, (as and when the activity takes place), via the School‚Äôs secure Desktop Virtual Learning Environment (VLE) or VLE Mobile App. Bank Details SCHOOL ACCOUNT DETAILS Payment can be made via wire transfer to the following account: Account Name Sunmarke School LLC Tuition Fees ‚Äì Due Dates Autumn Term: 01 st August Spring Term: 15 th November Summer Term: 15 th February Re-enrolment: 01 st day of Term 3 Account Number 012000921414 Bank Name National Bank of Fujairah PJSC Branch Jebel Ali Swift Code NBFUAEAFDXB IBAN Number AE220380000012000921414 Remarks | | | | Please email proof of all payments to: payments.sms@forteseducation.com Additional Fees (charged separately from Tuition Fee): Optional Transportation Services via 3rd Party Service Provider Optional Dining Services via 3rd Party Service Provider Optional After-School Activities provided by 3rd Party Service Providers School Uniforms Educational Visits Please note, the School‚Äôs Tuition Fees are subject to change in accordance with the Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) Fee Framework. For full details of fees and any applicable discounts, please contact the Admissions Office telephone +971 (04) 423 8900 or email: admissions.sms@forteseducation.com . title: Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students | Sunmarke School
content: Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students | Sunmarke School Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Scholarship Programme for Gifted & Talented Students The Fortes Scholarship Programme is a recognition of ability and application of students who have not only demonstrated a high level of academic, sporting or artistic skills, but have also displayed motivation and drive to succeed. Inspiring Purpose. Driving Passion. With exceptional teachers and subject specialists, we provide a dynamic and innovative curriculum that is designed to meet and inspire the talents and interests of our Gifted & Talented scholars. Our approach helps students stretch their abilities, build confidence, and pursue advanced pathways that match their strengths. We encourage curiosity, creativity, and independence so each scholar can excel in areas where they show remarkable potential. FAQs What are the available Scholarship Categories? Currently, our Fortes Schools are offering the following scholarship categories: Academic Scholarship Academic geniuses who strive for a place at the world‚Äôs top universities. Sports Scholarship Outstanding performers on the field who can bring laurels to their school and nation Music Scholarship Passionate performers who can touch the hearts of millions with their vocals or skills on a musical instrument. Art Scholarship Artists who can colour the canvas with their imagination and expression. Student of the Future Scholarship Visionary thinkers who we can mould for the jobs of the future. The Founder‚Äôs Scholarship We are looking for the gifted and talented who we can support in their journey to become legends. What are the Scholarship Criteria? Do keep the following documents ready before you fill in the application form: Criteria for All Scholarships 2 references 3 Essay questions Personal statement (< 500 words) Scholarship question (<500 words) Leadership essay (< 500 words) Video presentation (< 7 mins) Video must have: Introduction to yourself Why do you deserve this scholarship? Additional Criteria for Academic Scholarships CAT score = or > 133 For students applying for Year 10, 11 and 13: GL Data in Y9 and Y10 to be Stanine 8 or above in English, Maths and or Science For students applying for Year 12: 10 or more GCSEs taken with scores of 7-9‚Äôs or A to A* Additional Criteria for Sports Scholarships The student should have achieved national/international sporting representative honours in at least 1 of the following sports ‚Äì Football, Swimming, Basketball, Cricket, Netball, Golf, Rugby, Volleyball, Athletics, Tennis. Valid for the last 2 years Or any notable awards received. Additional Criteria for Music Scholarships The student should have achieved Grade 6 in at least 1 musical instrument or voice through Trinity or ABRSM Valid in the last 3 years Evidence of solo live performance outside of school Additional Criteria for Art Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of exhibition Additional Criteria for Student of the Future Scholarships Portfolio and evidence of having a future skill. The skill can be related to Coding, Crypto, Social Work, Robotics, etc. Certifications/endorsements required. What do we expect from a scholar? We would like to set expectations with the scholar on performance during the scholarship year. This is essential for the Scholarship Performance Review. For All Scholars: Consistent commitment to growth and development Active participation in internal and external activities. For example, the World Scholar‚Äôs Cup, MUN, TEDx, Duke of Edinburgh, Internships, social work among others To act as a brand ambassador of the school across all platforms. For example, social media, PR, videos, etc. For Academic Scholars: To be in the 95 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Sports Scholars: Maintain national/international representation in the sport or participate and represent the school in a notable tournament To be in the 70 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Music Scholars: Participation in school showcases such as concerts, musicals, etc. Participation in the school bands, choirs and ensembles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 6-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) For Arts Scholars: A* or 8-9 in GCSE Art and Design, Ceramics or Textiles To be in the 75 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) Maintain an exceptional portfolio and evidence of external exhibition For Student of the Future Scholars: Maintain an exceptional portfolio of future skill To be in the 80 percentile of their Year Group (for Year 10 and 12) To achieve Level 7-9 in all their GCSE subjects (for Year 11) What will we offer? Our Fortes School will create an environment conducive for a scholar‚Äôs growth. A Fortes School will : For All Scholars Ensure that the student receives guidance to develop a strong character and become a well-rounded individual Ensure the student has adequate support to perform academically Ensure opportunities to explore leadership positions within the Student Leadership Team Ensure opportunities to participate in activities outside the curriculum For Academic Scholars Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards For Sports Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Music Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Art Scholars Provide an environment that ensures the student is able to maintain and improve performance Ensure that the student has access to facilities to practise and improve skills For Student of the Future Scholar Provide an environment that encourages the student to achieve the highest academic standards Ensure that the student receives opportunities to meet mentors in the field of interest Students from which Year Groups are eligible for a Scholarship? Students in Year 9 (British Curriculum) or equivalent in other curriculums applying for Year 10 and upwards are eligible for scholarships. Where to apply for the Fortes Scholarship Programme? New Student to the School After filling out the Admission Application Form Complete the admission application form to Fortes School. At the end of the application form, select the button to ‚ÄòApply for Scholarship‚Äô. You will be directed to the Scholarship Form. Request for the Scholarship Form You can also request for the Scholarship Form from the admissions team, who will send you a unique link. However, the Application Form is mandatory in this case as well. Sunmarke Student You may apply for the scholarship via the VLE where you will find a link to the Scholarship Application Form. Click here to log in. What to expect after submitting the Scholarship Form? Application Review : Your application will be reviewed by our Academic Panel Audition : Should you get shortlisted, you will be invited to the school for an audition Interview : If you make it as a finalist, you will be invited for an interview with the Principal of the school Finally, your application will be assessed and successful applicants could receive a partial scholarship on the annual fees. Is the Scholarship only for the Year of admission or all subsequent years? A scholarship is renewable yearly between Year 10 and Year 13. The student‚Äôs scholarship continuation is subject to a termly Panel Review that showcases his/her participation, growth and development .
