Transport Services Ensuring Your Child Reaches School Safely Sunmarke uses an independent third party bus operator ‚ÄúMy Bus Transport Services LLC‚Äù to make the school run as easy as possible. ‚ÄúMy Bus‚Äù operates an air-conditioned and efficient transport service from various parts of Dubai to the school. Parents may avail of this service at their own discretion and cost. Transport fees are paid in advance prior to the beginning of every term on the following dates: Term 1: 1st August Term 2: 15th November Term 3: 15th February The transport service, routes and fees are governed by the third party transport company‚Äôs rules and regulations, which are subject to change at any time. All payments must be made to the transport company‚Äôs name and account as under: Bus Service Booking Procedure Click here to view our bus service booking procedure "My Bus" Account Details Account Name: My Bus Transport Services LLC Account Number: 012943071037 Bank: National Bank of Fujairah Branch: Jebel Ali Swift: NBFUAEAFDXB Iban Number: AE020380000012943071037 Remarks: Student Name / Year Group / Term (1,2,3) / Transport Fees Please email proof of payment of the transport fees to: transportpayments@forteseducation.com Bus Routes Bus Routes 1 BUR DUBAI, SHEIKH ZAYED ROAD, BUSINESS BAY 2 GREENS, LAKES, SPRINGS, MEADOWS 3 MOTOR CITY, SPORTS CITY 4 JUMEIRAH GOLF ESTATES, JUMEIRAH PARK, JUMEIRAH ISLAND 5 JVT, JLT, JVC 6 DISCOVERY GARDENS, THE GARDENS, FURJAN 7 DUBAI MARINA, JBR, PALM JUMEIRAH 8 DAMAC HILLS 1, DUBAI HILLS 9 MUDON, TOWNSQUARE (ONLY DROP OFF) 10 TILAL AL GHAF 11 BARSHA (MOE), TECOM 12 ARABIAN RANCHES 1/2 'Bus Fees' For Sms AREA SERVICE ANNUAL FEE (AED) TERM 1 (AED) TERM 2 (AED) TERM 3 (AED) BUR DUBAI, SHEIKH ZAYED ROAD, BUSINESS BAY, GREENS, LAKES, SPRINGS, MEADOWS, MOTOR CITY, SPORTS CITY, JUMEIRAH GOLF ESTATES, ARABIAN RANCHES 1/2, JVT, JLT, DISCOVERY GARDENS, THE GARDENS, FURJAN, DUBAI MARINA, JBR, JUMEIRAH PARK, PALM JUMEIRAH, JUMEIRAH ISLAND, BARSHA (MOE), TECOM, DAMAC HILLS 1, JVC, DUBAI HILLS, MUDON, TOWNSQUARE (ONLY DROP OFF), TILAL AL GHAF 2 WAY 10,690 4,276 3,207 3,207 1 WAY 7,920 3,168 2,376 2,376 Note: Our third-party transport provider will add additional routes subject to demand over time.

Towards this, we have partnered with Mastercook the catering experts, to tailor-make our dining menus and meal programmes. We have a bright and spacious cafeteria where students can enjoy healthy food options, socialise, and deepen their friendships. They can opt for pre-packaged food in environment-friendly packs as well. We also provide Grab & Go snacks for them. Menu and Pricing: The Mastercook menu offers a selection of nutritious, additive-free and preservative-free school meals. With options from various cuisines, the lunch menu is priced at AED 24.25 Keeping dietary restrictions in mind, the nut-free menu has been crafted with care and quality. Parents of EYFS and Primary students can easily place their orders via the provided link, with lunch delivered directly to their child‚Äôs classroom. http://form.jotform.com/Mastercook/Sunmarke-stripe Secondary students can savor their lunch in the school canteen. Payments can be made using credit cards, Apple Pay or Google Pay Health & Safety Mastercook implements robust safety measures in their kitchens, including the use of PPE kits and a Safety Ambassador to oversee quality and hygiene. For additional information, please consult our FAQs or reach out to: Karen from Mastercook : +971526180756 +97144488103 (Mastercook Office No.) +97144238995 (school number) or email enquiries to coordinator@mastercook.ae

title: FAQs - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai
content: FAQs - Sunmarke School | British Curriculum | International School in Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login FAQs Admissions > FAQs Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ‚Äôs) All You Want To Know About The School And Its Facilities We have compiled a list of questions that parents are most likely to ask us in the early stages of the application process ‚Äì we hope you find it useful. Should you have any other questions, please get in touch with our Family Happiness Team and we will be happy to help. How do I enrol my child? Enrolment for 2024-25 ‚Äì New families 1) Can I come in for a school tour with my family? Yes, we would be delighted to welcome you and your family for a school tour. It‚Äôs a great opportunity to experience the atmosphere and gain insight into our school. 2) KHDA Parent School Contract Please note that: Students can only attend school if they are registered in the KHDA School System, and parents have signed the Parent-School Contract. The school will register the student once all the relevant documents have been uploaded by the parents. This contract needs to be digitally signed only once ‚Äì by parents of students who are new to the school. The contract is usually sent via sms on their local mobile phones registered with the school. 3) Documents for Registering at Sunmarke School If you are a new family, joining the school, please ensure that all pending documentation for your child is submitted to the Admissions department at Sunmarke School. Documents required to complete the registration process: Latest School Reports School reference letter, if a report is not available Attested Transfer Certificate 1 Passport Size Coloured Photo (Student and both Parents) Student Passport Copy Sponsoring Parents Passport Copy Student‚Äôs Emirates ID Card (back & Front) Sponsoring Parent Emirates ID card (back & Front) Vaccination & Immunisation Record Copy 4) Age Cut-Off Dates New students must be enrolled in their respective age groups as per the ministerial decree (820) of 2014. The cut-off date is 31 st August without exception. The table below shows the age/year-group information of students aged 3 to 6. Sunmarke School is required to comply with the age/year-group criteria and the cut-off date as per the ministerial decree. Year FS1 FS2 Year 1 Year 2 Age by 31 st August 3 4 5 6 This is a federal law and we are not able to consider any exemption requests. What are the KHDA guidelines for Admissions and Transfers? Click here to read Guidelines for Admissions and Transfers by KHDA. How do I book Assessments? Admissions are open year-round, with prorated fees available. We are booking assessments for FS1, FS2, Year 1 to 10, and Year 12. For students currently overseas, we can offer online assessments. Please contact the Sunmarke Admissions Office to confirm your child‚Äôs assessment date. Can my child be assessed before arriving in Dubai? Online Assessment Procedure: The assessment will take place at home under exam conditions via MS Teams. For Year 6 and below, we recommend adult supervision throughout. Ensure your child has a quiet, distraction-free workspace and the necessary equipment: a computer with internet, video, and audio capabilities. All other electronic devices should be switched off. You will receive an email with the meeting link. Please check access ahead of time and join at the scheduled time. Assistance is only allowed for setting up the meeting and login. Any interference during the assessment will invalidate the results. Assessment Checklist: Quiet, well-ventilated workspace. Computer with internet, video, and audio. All distractions (TV, phones, etc.) turned off. Microsoft Teams ready to join the meeting. What are the tuition fees for FS1- Year 13 (2025-26)? Tuition Fees Click here to view the Tuition Fees: New Students - FS1 to Year 13 - 2025-26 What are the KHDA document fees? Tariff for the following KHDA services as stipulated by KHDA: Request for student Education Continuation Certificate for visa renewal (AED 120) Request for student leaving form for the students who are leaving Dubai (AED 120) Request for student transfer between private schools (within the stipulated time frame)-Student transfer (AED 120) Can my child with special education needs attend Sunmarke school? At Sunmarke, we exercise a positive and inclusive admissions policy. Candidates will each be given due consideration on a case-by-case basis, and we will take into account the capacity of the premises, staff and curriculum pathways to effectively meet the needs of the individual. Our Achievement Centre offers a broad range of additional support for students with SEND, including targeted support in maths, literacy, and SEMH (social and emotional mental health). We currently offer an alternative curriculum pathway for Key Stages 3 and 4. 1. Is it approved by the Ministry of Education? It is a mainstream curriculum, delivered by specialist teachers and LSAs. There is no need for permission for this pathway as it falls under our current education licence. 2. What are the timings if my son is enroled in this program? The timings are that of the normal school day, unless the student has additional needs or commitments outside of school that need to be met. As a KHDA accredited Rahhal provider, we can review timings to meet the student‚Äôs needs. 3. What is the cost for LSA? Costs are an estimate range until all students are enroled. 4. What would be mentioned in the invoice for this program? Is it ‚ÄúTuition fee‚Äù? School fees are billed as normal. Parents will then have to sign a KHDA Individual Service Agreement for the LSP cost. This will then be a separate invoice. 5. How will I enrol my child? Our SENCO will assess the student before we can accept to ensure we can meet their needs in this class. It is a pathway that supports access to the mainstream and we can‚Äôt cater for severe needs. What are the facilities you offer? What are the facilities you offer? We have state-of-the-art facilities on offer with special attention paid to athletics, the arts and the latest technological advancements. Below is an indication of the amenities provided to our students. Facilities Athletics Creative and Performing Arts Academic FIFA - 18 Sized Football Pitch 200 Meter Athletics Running Track Two Swimming Pools Tennis, Basketball, Volleyball and Netball Courts Two Expansive Multipurpose Halls Three Fine Arts Labs Dedicated Drama Studio 600 Seat Auditorium Four Music Labs TV & Radio Production Studios Nine World-Class Science Labs Five Design Technology Labs Three Libraries with Media Centres What nationalities make up the school body? Sunmarke is a truly international school with a focus on fostering diversity and nurturing talent. Sunmarke continues in Regent International ‚Äòs tradition with regards to enrolment with 90+ nationalities represented with the largest percentage hailing from the U.K. What are the school timings? Year Group Timings Foundation Stage 1 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:15 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:30 am Foundation Stage 2 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:15 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:30 am Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am For detailed EYFS timings click here For detailed Primary timings click here For detailed Secondary & Sixth Form timings click here What school transport is offered? What school transport is offered? Sunmarke uses an independent third party bus operator ‚ÄúMy Bus Transport Services LLC‚Äù to make the school run as easy as possible. ‚ÄúMy Bus‚Äù operates an air-conditioned and efficient transport service from various parts of Dubai to the school. Parents may avail of this service at their own discretion and cost. My Bus Transport Services manages the school transport operations. The details of services, route and fees, are now available from the Transport office. You can also find the details online, please click here . For more information on our routes and the health & safety protocols for our buses, please click here . What is the pickup/drop off timings? School Transport Timings Bus start times remain the same. For drop-off, buses will leave from the school at the following times Year Group Timings EYFS Monday to Thursday 1:30 pm onwards Friday 12:10 pm onwards Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 3:40 pm onwards Friday 12.10 pm onwards Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 3:40 pm onwards Friday 12:10 pm onwards Further communication related to pick-up and drop-off schedules will be shared by the transportation department upon successful registration and payment. How do I order food for my child? 1. How do I book the service? Booking can only be done for EYFS and Primary students. Secondary students can go directly to the canteen to select their food and make payment. EYFS and Primary parents need to pre-book their order in advance via the link provided http://form.jotform.com/Mastercook/Sunmarke-stripe and lunch will be delivered in their class. 2. What is the price for lunch? Lunch is priced at AED24.25 this includes the main lunch and a dessert. 3. What is the menu like? Please click TERM MENU to see current available menu. Alternatively, secondary students can check out our GRAB AND GO menu. 4. Do you offer special meal plans? As a nut-free school, all meals are prepared using nut-free products. We also offer bespoke menus for students with special dietary needs, including gluten-free, dairy-free, etc. For this request, please contact coordinator@mastercook.ae for a specialised price and to discuss options. 5. Does your menu contain allergen information? As per Dubai Municipality guidelines, we follow their standard of menu labels that include the ingredients, allergens, and calorie content. The menu also has a specialised coding that identifies the contents of the meal, allowing our students to check if it contains something they are allergic to. Please communicate this to your child if they are in Secondary school. With Lactose With Egg With gluten Seafood With Soy Vegetarian 6. Can my child buy food at the Grab & Go counter? This option caters only to our Secondary school students and staff. The Grab & Go section of the dining services is exactly what it is ‚Äì you grab the food, make the payment, and go on with your daily activity. We always ensure that there is a menu suitable for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. 7. What are the canteen timings? The canteen is open from 7am to 3.30 pm Monday to Thursday and 7am to 12:00 noon on Friday. Please note that only the Grab and Go section of the canteen is open on Friday. 8. Is breakfast available in the canteen? A healthy breakfast, via the Grab and Go section, is available daily from 7am. Secondary school students can only use the canteen at break time and lunchtime. 9. What time are the dining services available and when is lunch delivered to EYFS and Primary students? The lunch period for various year groups is listed as per the below timetable. For EYFS and Primary students, lunch will be delivered to their classroom prior to their scheduled lunch break. All the delivered lunches will have the names clearly labelled on them so that teachers can easily identify and distribute them to the children during lunchtime. Phases Mondays to Thursdays Fridays EYFS Break 09:40 am ‚Äì 09:55 am Not available Lunch Not available Not available Primary Key Stage 1 (Y1 - Y2) Break 09:40 am ‚Äì 09:55 am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 10:50 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Not available Primary Key Stage 2 (Y3 - Y6) Break 09:40 am ‚Äì 09:55 am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 11:45 am ‚Äì 12:40 pm Not available Secondary (Y7 - Y9 ) Break 09:40 am ‚Äì 09:55 am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 1:10 pm ‚Äì 01:40 pm (Monday to Tuesday) 12:40 pm ‚Äì 01:40 pm (Wednesday to Thursday) Not available Secondary (Y10 - Y13 ) Break 09:40 am ‚Äì 09:55 am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 12:40 pm ‚Äì 01:40 pm (Monday to Tuesday) 01:10 pm ‚Äì 01:40 pm (Wednesday to Thursday) Not available 10. How do I pay for my child's lunch? For EYFS and Primary students, parents can pay upon confirming their order. For secondary, payments can be made using their credit card/apple pay / google pay/cash. 11. What if I forgot to place order can you still give my child her/his food? We understand that parents can get busy and at times forget to make lunch, for this one time emergency situation, we suggest you contact Mastercook ‚Äì Person in Charge- Ms Karen directly on +971566180756 and she will be happy to assist you for the day. 12. Who do I contact for any queries, suggestions, and clarifications? The Mastercook catering team is happy to assist parents with their queries and for clarification. Please reach out to Karen from Mastercook on +971 52 618 0756 (mobile number) +971 4 448 8103 (Mastercook Office #) +971 4 423 8995 (school number) or email enquiries to coordinator@mastercook.ae 13. I am travelling for 3 days and would like to book my child lunch during the time I am away, can I place order for 3 days only? We are pleased to inform you that Mastercook are now accepting orders for short period, please go to the booking form and indicate the days you will require your child's lunch delivered. 14. My child forgot to bring money, can you give him food? Mastercook believe that food is essential part of child's growth development. If your child doesn't have money for the day, we will issue them the food for you to pay later. Our canteen supervisor will contact parents to confirm this and check for any allergies. How do I enrol my child? Enrolment for 2025-26 ‚Äì New families 1) Can I come in for a school tour with my family? We are now able to conduct school tours for prospective students and their parents. 2) KHDA Parent School Contract To prepare for enrolment into the new academic year 2025-26, please note that: Students can only attend school in the new academic year if they are registered in the KHDA School System and parents have signed the Parent-School Contract. Please download the Dubai Now App which will enable you to sign the Parent/School Contract online. This only needs to be signed by parents of students who are new to the school. 3) Documents for Registering at Sunmarke School If you are a new family, joining the school for 2025-26, please ensure that all pending documentation for your child is submitted to the Admissions department at Sunmarke School. Documents that should be submitted to the school are: Letter of current enrolment at school (Year 2 Up) Transfer Certificate (Attested by UAE Embassy) School reference letter (Year 2 Up) School Reports ‚Äì 2024-25 (Year 2 Up) 1 Passport Size Coloured Photo ( Student and both Parents) Student Passport Copy Student UAE Visa Copy Sponsoring Parents Passport and UAE Visa Copy Birth Certificate (in English or Arabic) Student‚Äôs Emirates ID Card (back & Front) Sponsoring Parent Emirates ID card (back & Front) Vaccination & Immunisation Record Copy DHA Medical & Immunisation Consent form 4) Age Cut-Off Dates New students must be enroled in their respective age groups as per the ministerial decree (820) of 2014. The cut-off date is 31 st August without exception. The table below shows the age/year-group information of students aged 3 to 6. Sunmarke School is required to comply with the age/year-group criteria and the cut-off date as per the ministerial decree. Year FS1 FS2 Year 1 Year 2 Age by 31 st August 3 4 5 6 This is a federal law and we are not able to consider any exemption requests. What are the KHDA guidelines for Admissions and Transfers? Click here to read Guidelines for Admissions and Transfers by KHDA. What are the age requirements for AY 2024-25? 1. What are the changes to the age requirements for entry to Sunmarke School? Age requirements will change for new students enroled into FS1, according to the UAE Ministry of Education Resolution no (24). Children enroling into FS1, starting in September, must be three years old on or before the 31st of August. Children enroling into FS2, starting in September, must be four years old on or before the 31st of August. Similarly, children enroling into Year 1, starting school in September, must be five years old on or before the 31st of August. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. This includes students who enrol for the final term of the 2023/24 academic year. Schools that start the academic year in September, in line with MOE Resolution no (24). Year Group Age requirement Foundation Stage 1 3 years old by August 31st Foundation Stage 2 4 years old by August 31st Year 1 5 years old by August 31 Year 2 6 years old by August 31 2. When did this change come into effect? This change was applicable from the start of the 2021/22 academic year in September 2021. 3. Why was this change made? This decision was made to bring more consistency to the cut-off dates used by schools in the UAE with those used by schools abroad. For example, UK schools in the UAE will now have the same cut-off date as schools in the UK, and international British schools. 4.Who will this change impact? This change will impact children up to six years old who are enrolling in school for the first time. 5. Will the new cut-off date apply to all year groups? It will apply to new students enrolling in FS1, FS2, Year 1 and Year 2 in all schools in the UAE, as stipulated in the MOE resolution. 6. My child was born in October and is now in FS1 ‚Äì I want to enrol him in another school for FS2. Can I do this or does he have to repeat a year? Because your child is already enroled in school, the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution do not apply. He does not have to repeat the year. 7. My son was enroled in FS1 this year but I withdrew his enrolment due to COVID-19. He‚Äôll be 3 years old in September. Can I still enrol him in FS2 next year? Your child must have formally finished the previous academic year in order to enrol in the next one. Since he does not meet the age requirement for FS2 for next academic year, he must enrol in FS1. According to the MOE resolution, he can enrol in FS2 next academic year only if he completes FS1 this academic year. 8. My daughter will be 4 years old in December. If I enrol her in FS2 for the last term of this year ‚Äì before the changes come into effect ‚Äì will she be able to start Year 1 next year? Yes. The new age requirements will apply for new students from the start of the next academic year only. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. 9. I‚Äôve already registered and paid the deposit for my daughter to start school in FS2 in September. She will be four years old in November. Is she affected by this? According to the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution, your daughter will not be able to start in FS2 in September. Alternatively, we would be happy to transfer your child‚Äôs application to their age-appropriate year group (FS1) and register your child for this year group instead. Parents whose children are affected by the new cut-off dates and who have already paid deposits for their children‚Äôs enrolment are entitled to a refund if they wish. 10. My child was born one day after the cut-off date. Is there some leeway given? No exceptions to the cut-off dates will be given under any circumstances How do I book Assessments for entry 2025-26 AY? Admissions are now open for applications for 2025-26 AY* entry. The 2025-2026 Assessment Diary is Open ‚Äì We are now booking assessments for year groups FS1 & FS2, Year 1 to 10 and Year 12. Please contact the Sunmarke Admissions Office to confirm your child‚Äôs assessment date. For students currently overseas: For students in current Year 6 and above we can offer Assessment at the current school attended. Please contact us to find out more. Students transferring from UK schools in all years, please contact us directly for more details. Can my child be assessed before arriving into Dubai? For Students entering Year 7 and above, assessment can be offered at the current school attended if that school is willing to administer the test under examination conditions. The assessment will be the same as that taken by our local students with the addition of a Skype interview. You will need to provide registration, a letter of enrolment, the latest school report, and a recommendation form by the date of assessment. For students transferring from UK schools please contact admissions directly to discuss your application. What are the tuition fees for FS1- Year 13 (2025-26)? Tuition Fees Click here to view the Tuition Fees: New Students ‚Äì FS1 to Year 13 ‚Äì 2025-26 What are the KHDA document fees? Tariff for the following KHDA services as stipulated by KHDA: Request for student Education Continuation Certificate for visa renewal (AED 120) Request for student leaving form for the students who are leaving Dubai (AED 120) Request for student transfer between private schools (within the stipulated time frame)-Student transfer (AED 120) Can my child with special education needs attend Sunmarke school? At Sunmarke, we exercise a positive and inclusive admissions policy. Candidates will each be given due consideration on a case-by-case basis, and we will take into account the capacity of the premises, staff and curriculum pathways to effectively meet the needs of the individual. Our Achievement Centre offers a broad range of additional support for students with SEND, including targeted support in language, maths, literacy, and functional independence. We are currently working to develop our range of alternative curriculum pathways for Key Stages 2, 3, and 4 so that, in time, we can offer an appropriate pathway for every learner. What is Year 7 and Year 8 Life skills Pathway? 1. Is it approved by the Ministry of Education? It is a mainstream curriculum, supplemented by ASDAN modules. As it is a supplemented curriculum which focuses on reduced teachers, as per KHDA, there is no need for permission for this pathway as it falls under our current education licence. 2. What are the timings if my son is enroled in this program? The timings are that of the normal school day, unless the student has additional needs or commitments outside of school that need to be met. As a KHDA accredited Rahhal provider, we can review timings to meet the student‚Äôs needs. 3. What is the cost for LSA? Costs are an estimate range until all students are enroled. 4. What would be mentioned in the invoice for this program? Is it ‚ÄúTuition fee‚Äù? School fees are billed as normal. Parents will then have to sign a KHDA Individual Service Agreement for the LSA cost. This will then be a separate invoice. 5 How will I enrol my child? Our SENCO will assess the student before we can accept to ensure we can meet their needs in this class. It is a pathway that supports access to the mainstream and we can‚Äôt cater for severe needs. For more information on the pathway, please click here What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? Students transferring to Sunmarke School from Regent International School, will not be required to pay additional Assessment or Registration fees. Transferring students are only required to complete the RIS Re-Enrollment Form and pay the 5 % re-enrolment fee by the start of the third term each year to secure their seat. What are the tuition fees and discounts for Regent International School transfers to Sunmarke school for FS1-Year 13 (2025-26)? Fee Structure ‚Äì Transferring students from Regent International School to Sunmarke School Application Fee Dhs.525/- ‚Äì Not chargeable Re-enrollment Fee (Existing Students) 5% of Tuition Fee ‚Äì Non-refundable, adjusted against the 1st Term‚Äôs Tuition Fee, 1st day of Term3 Transferring RIS Students Phase Tuition Fees Year Group Discounted Tuition Fees for students transferring from Year 6 at Regent Foundation 1 46,700 Foundation 2 51,900 Year 1 58,548 Year 2 58,548 Year 3 59,619 Year 4 59,619 Year 5 59,619 Year 6 59,619 Year 7 67,290 Year 8 67,290 Year 9 67,290 Year 10 69,397 Year 11 69,397 Year 12 70,276 Year 13 70,276 Additional Benefits: Sibling Discounts: 1st Sibling 5%, 2nd Sibling 10%, 3rd Sibling 10%, 4th Sibling 10%. The sibling discount scheme is available to those siblings from the same family who enrol at the school for one full academic year. The sibling discount is applicable to the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th child from the same family. The amount of the discount is calculated off the actual Tuition Fee paid of the child who pays the lowest tuition fee amongst the siblings enrolled at the school. The maximum discount per family cannot exceed 35% of the lowest paying sibling‚Äôs Tuition Fee. SCHOOL ACCOUNT DETAILS TUITION FEES ‚Äì DUE DATES Payment can be made via wire transfer to the following account: Re-enrolment 15 th December Account Name : SUNMARKE SCHOOL LLC Autumn Term 01 st August Account Number : 12000921414 Spring Term 15 th November Bank Name : National Bank of Fujairah PJSC Summer Term 15 th February Branch : Jebel Ali Swift : NBFUAEAFDXB IBAN # : AE220380000012000921414 Remarks : Please email proof of all payments to: accounts.sms@sunmarkedubai.com , and cc: officemanager.sms@forteseducation.com & registrar.sms@forteseducation.com Additional Fees (charged separately from Tuition Fee): Optional Transportation Services via 3rd Party Service Provider; Optional Dining Services via 3rd Party Service Provider; Optional After-School Activities provided by 3 rd Party Service Providers; School Uniforms; Educational Visits; School Fees are subject to change in accordance with the Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) Fees Framework What are the sibling discounts if siblings are at both Sunmarke School and Regent International School for 2025-26? In cases where the eldest sibling transfers to the secondary phase at Sunmarke School, but the FS and Primary Phase siblings stay at Regent International School the following discount policy will be applied on full-year attendance: Example 1: Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke: No Discount 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy Example 2: Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke School: No Discount 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at RIS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per RIS Policy 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per RIS Policy 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per RIS Policy 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per RIS Policy *Please note, that these discounts will be applied to the 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th siblings 3rd Term of joining actual Tuition Fee. The maximum discount per family is equal to 35% of the lowest sibling‚Äôs tuition fee. What is the Sunmarke School and Regent International School returning students -Founders Fee entitlement? If a Regent International School or Sunmarke School student leaves the school but returns to the School before the end of one (1) academic term, they will keep their entitlement to the Regent International School Transfers to Sunmarke School Tuition Fee Structure. If more than one Term passes, then the student will be considered a New Student and will be required to pay the New Students Fee Structure as applicable to their group of re-entry. What are the facilities you offer? What are the facilities you offer? We have state-of-the-art facilities on offer with special attention paid to athletics, the arts and the latest technological advancements. Below is an indication of the amenities provided to our students. Facilities Athletics Creative and Performing Arts Academic FIFA - 18 Sized Football Pitch 200 Meter Athletics Running Track Two Swimming Pools Tennis, Basketball, Volleyball and Netball Courts Two Expansive Multipurpose Halls Three Fine Arts Labs Dedicated Drama Studio 600 Seat Auditorium Four Music Labs TV & Radio Production Studios Nine World-Class Science Labs Five Design Technology Labs Three Libraries with Media Centres What is the class capacity? Class Sizes for Academic Year 2025-26: To ensure each student receives the individualised care he/she deserves, we cap classes based on the year. Below is a breakdown of student-to-teacher ratios by year: Year Group FS1 FS2 ‚Äì Y1 Y2 ‚Äì Y6 Y7 ‚Äì Y9 Y10 ‚Äì Y11 Y12 ‚Äì Y13 Maximum number of students 22 24 26 26 26 26 At the end of each academic year, it is the school‚Äôs policy to mix and reallocate all classes throughout the school. This process is undertaken to ensure the even spread of age, gender, nationality, and ability across the classes. What nationalities make up the school body? Sunmarke is a truly international school with a focus on fostering diversity and nurturing talent. Sunmarke continues in Regent International ‚Äòs tradition with regards to enrolment with 90+ nationalities represented with the largest percentage hailing from the U.K. What are the school timings? Year Group Timings Foundation Stage 1 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Foundation Stage 2 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:10 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 pm Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:10 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 pm For detailed timings of all year groups,, please click here. What school transport is offered? What school transport is offered? A bus service is in operation at Sunmarke School. The details of this service, route and fees, are now available from the Transport Manager‚Äôs Office on the Ground Floor. For more information on bus fees, please click here. For more information on our routes and the health & safety protocols for our buses, please click here . What is the pickup/drop off timings? School Transport Timings Bus start times remain the same. For drop-off, buses will leave from the school at the following times Year Group Timings EYFS Monday to Thursday 1:30 pm Friday 12:15 pm onwards Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 3:30 pm onwards Friday 12.15 pm onwards Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 3:30 pm onwards Friday 12:15 pm onwards Further communication on this will be shared by our transportation department. How do I order food for my child? 1. How do I book the service? Booking can only be done for EYFS and Primary students. Secondary students can go directly to the canteen to select their food and make payment. EYFS and Primary parents need to pre-book their order in advance via the link provided http://form.jotform.com/Mastercook/Sunmarke-stripe and lunch will be delivered in their class. 2. What is the price for lunch? Lunch is priced at AED24.25 this includes the main lunch and a dessert. 3. What is the menu like? Please click TERM MENU to see current available menu. Alternatively, secondary students can check out our GRAB AND GO menu. 4. Do you offer special meal plans? As a nut-free school, all meals are prepared using nut-free products. We also offer bespoke menus for students with special dietary needs, including gluten-free, dairy-free, etc. For this request, please contact coordinator@mastercook.ae for a specialised price and to discuss options. 5. Does your menu contain allergen information? As per Dubai Municipality guidelines, we follow their standard of menu labels that include the ingredients, allergens, and calorie content. The menu also has a specialised coding that identifies the contents of the meal, allowing our students to check if it contains something they are allergic to. Please communicate this to your child if they are in Secondary school. With Lactose With Egg With gluten Seafood With Soy Vegetarian 6. Can my child buy food at the Grab & Go counter? This option caters only to our Secondary school students and staff. The Grab & Go section of the dining services is exactly what it is ‚Äì you grab the food, make the payment, and go on with your daily activity. We always ensure that there is a menu suitable for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. 7. What are the canteen timings? The canteen is open from 7am to 3.30 pm Monday to Thursday and 7am to 12:00 noon on Friday. Please note that only the Grab and Go section of the canteen is open on Friday. 8. Is breakfast available in the canteen? A healthy breakfast, via the Grab and Go section, is available daily from 7am. Secondary school students can only use the canteen at break time and lunchtime. 9. What time are the dining services available and when is lunch delivered to EYFS and Primary students? The lunch period for various year groups is listed as per the below timetable. For EYFS and Primary students, lunch will be delivered to their classroom prior to their scheduled lunch break. All the delivered lunches will have the names clearly labelled on them so that teachers can easily identify and distribute them to the children during lunchtime. Phases Mondays to Thursdays Fridays Secondary Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 12:40pm ‚Äì 01:40pm Not available Primary Key Stage 1 (Y1-2) Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55pm 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 10:50am ‚Äì 11:45am Not available Primary Key Stage 2 (Y3- 6) Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 11:45am ‚Äì 12:40pm Not available EYFS Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am Not available Lunch From 11:45am Not available 10. How do I pay for my child‚Äôs lunch? For EYFS and Primary students, parents can pay upon confirming their order. For secondary, payments can be made using their credit card/apple pay / google pay/cash. 11. What if I forgot to place order can you still give my child her/his food? We understand that parents can get busy and at times forget to make lunch, for this one time emergency situation, we suggest you contact Mastercook ‚Äì Person in Charge- Ms Karen directly on +971566180756 and she will be happy to assist you for the day. 12. Who do I contact for any queries, suggestions, and clarifications? The Mastercook catering team is happy to assist parents with their queries and for clarification. Please reach out to Karen from Mastercook on +971 52 618 0756 (mobile number) +971 4 448 8103 (Mastercook Office #) +971 4 423 8995 (school number) or email enquiries to coordinator@mastercook.ae 13. I am travelling for 3 days and would like to book my child lunch during the time I am away, can I place order for 3 days only? We are pleased to inform you that Mastercook are now accepting orders for short period, please go to the booking form and indicate the days you will require your child‚Äôs lunch delivered. 14. My child forgot to bring money, can you give him food? Mastercook believe that food is essential part of child‚Äôs growth development. If your child doesn‚Äôt have money for the day, we will issue them the food for you to pay later. Our canteen supervisor will contact parents to confirm this and check for any allergies.

Towards this, we have partnered with Mastercook the catering experts, to tailor-make our dining menus and meal programmes. We have a bright and spacious cafeteria where students can enjoy healthy food options, socialise, and deepen their friendships. They can opt for pre-packaged food in environment-friendly packs as well. We also provide Grab & Go snacks for them. Menu and Pricing: The Mastercook menu offers a selection of nutritious, additive-free and preservative-free school meals. Engagement Making Parents An Integral Part Of Their Child's Educational Journey In tune with the traditions adopted by the Fortes Education Group, Sunmarke emphasises a strong Parent Engagement Programme with parents being as involved in our community and aspects of school life as their children. Parents participate in their child‚Äôs education by attending assemblies, Parent‚Äôs Evenings, helping out with reading clubs and joining our popular monthly Wellness Wednesdays sessions for useful parenting and lifestyle advice by experts. The Parents Association ‚Äì FOSS The Friends of Sunmarke School (FOSS) plays a central role, organising various community events throughout the year. Some calendar favourites include the Movie Night, World Culture Day, Cup Cake Sales, Mother‚Äôs Day, and Dance-A-Thon to name just a few. The Association also provides vital support to parents and families joining the school or those who have just moved to Dubai. The FOSS coffee mornings and the FOSS ‚ÄòHealthy Hub‚Äô are great ways to make new friends and socialise. If you would like to know more about the activities and events organised by FOSS or would like to join this parent body, please please contact admin@forteseducation.com FOSS Core Team 2025-2026 Name Designation Email ID Bonita Peens Core Committee Member bpeens1@gmail.com Catalina Guaqueta Core Committee Member cat8282@hotmail.com Nicola Sutherland Core Committee Member nixitrix.ns@gmail.com Farah Shirani Core Committee Member farahshirani@gmail.com Katharine El Charif Core Committee Member Katharine_mcmahon@hotmail.com Wellness Wednesday Held once a month, Wellness Wednesday sessions allow parents to listen to a variety of specialist speakers and experts on important topics, be it the most recent research in child development or the best practices in Positive Education. Check out our video recordings to learn how to manage stress and anxiety, build resilience, practice cyber safety, and more! Click here to view our ‚ÄúWellness Wednesday‚Äù events.

Governance Committee ‚Äì SUNMAC The Individuals Who Enrich The School With Their Guidance The KHDA inspection team has recognised the Governing Body at Sunmarke School as being generously staffed in an outstanding building to enable students to receive high-quality education. Our Governance Committee comprises the Board of Directors (BOD) and an Advisory Council. The Board includes the owners and the Board of Directors who actively provide strategic direction to the school. The Advisory Council called ‚ÄúSUNMAC‚Äù comprises all stakeholders including parents, teachers and senior leaders This body meets three or four times a year and provides regular inputs. The Council also supports continuous improvement, and guides the development of the school, holding the leadership accountable for the quality of education delivered. Sub-committees have also been created to enable parents and leaders to evaluate key aspects of delivery in more detail with focus on Inclusion, Child Protection, Safeguarding, Health & Safety, Learning and Teaching, Attainment and Progress, Leadership and Professional Development. title: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai
content: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities Activities > Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities After School Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke offers a deep variety of paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) via best-of-class, external third party providers. ECAs are run individually and in groups in sports, music, coding, and other subjects during the school year after school hours and as camps during holidays. Features of our Extracurricular Activities (ECAs): Qualified Instructors Structured, varied programmes onsite or off-site throughout the year Secure and safe environment Chess Our chess course provides a comprehensive and engaging learning experience for both beginners and intermediate players. Following a structured curriculum, students will build a strong foundation in the fundamentals of chess, including the rules, piece movements, and essential strategies. They will progress to exploring tactical combinations, positional play, and endgame techniques designed to strengthen overall gameplay. The course places strong emphasis on developing critical thinking, pattern recognition, and decision-making skills. Students will also learn how to create a personalized opening repertoire, prepare effectively for tournaments, and understand the psychological dimensions of the game. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Fashion Designing Students will be introduced to the exciting world of fashion and will develop a strong foundation in fashion design, preparing them to potentially pursue a career in the field. They will learn essential skills such as pattern cutting, draping, sewing, and various textile techniques, along with gaining an understanding of fashion history to inspire and inform their creative process. By the end of the term, students will design and create their own wearable piece that they can proudly showcase and wear. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Multi-Activity Students will be introduced to the exciting world of multi-activity, gaining a strong foundation that could inspire them to pursue a future career. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 3000 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Stories, Animation, and Game Designing Learners will carefully design and choreograph their own creations using a visual scripting language‚Äîbringing characters to life, switching scenes, and even adding voiceovers. Join us on the adventure of a lifetime as you discover how to build epic games with the world‚Äôs leading programming language for children. This is the must-know coding language of the decade! Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Photography Students will be introduced to digital photography and the seven principles of photography. They will learn how to operate a DSLR in Manual Mode by understanding the three elements of the exposure triangle‚Äîshutter speed, ISO, and aperture‚Äîtheir functions, and how to achieve proper exposure in a photograph. Students will also explore different genres of photography, including motion, product, portrait, and stop-motion photography, while developing the skills to effectively balance the exposure triangle. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 AI and Robotics AI and Robotics are all around us, and we interact with machine learning systems every day‚Äîwhether through spam filters, recommendation engines, language translation services, chatbots and digital assistants, search engines, or fraud detection tools. Soon, it will be common for machine learning systems to drive our cars and assist doctors in diagnosing and treating illnesses. Examples such as Tesla‚Äôs self-driving technology or Apple‚Äôs Siri highlight how artificial intelligence is already part of our daily lives. In this course, students are introduced to coding in an engaging way through a hands-on Robotics kit. This allows them to visualize the output of their code and gain a deeper understanding of key concepts. Each Robotics model presents a problem-solving challenge that enhances not only your child‚Äôs coding skills but also their logical thinking and reasoning abilities. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Football Our Football Academy welcomes children of all skill levels ‚Äì from beginners taking their first steps on the pitch to advanced players striving for excellence. The programme focuses on developing technical skills, tactical understanding, teamwork and leadership, and physical conditioning. Led by UEFA-licensed coaches, our sessions provide a supportive and engaging environment where every child can grow, have fun, and reach their full potential. Provider: Eagles Sports Academy For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Basketball Morovic Bauer Basketball Academy (MBBA) is dedicated to establishing an exemplary basketball institution in Dubai, renowned for its league success and exceptional player development. With an unwavering commitment to excellence, MBBA strives to elevate the standard of youth basketball across the UAE, nurturing talent and instilling a passion for the game. Our mission is to develop players who can compete at the highest levels, both locally and internationally. Through world-class coaching, structured training programmes, and a focus on holistic growth, we are crafting an unparalleled basketball experience that builds a strong reputation and drives continuous success. Provider: Morovic Bauer Basketball Training (MBBA) For more information, please contact: Email: anthony.bauer.mbba@gmail.com Mobile: +971 58 513 2623 Tennis Playverse Tennis Academy offers expert tennis coaching for Early Years, Primary, and Secondary students in Dubai, nurturing a love for the sport from a young age while building strong foundations for lifelong success. Our youth tennis programmes focus on developing technical precision, tactical awareness, physical fitness, and mental resilience through age-appropriate training sessions. Each programme is designed to match the student‚Äôs skill level ‚Äî from beginners learning the fundamentals to advanced players refining their competitive edge. Provider: Playverse Tennis Academy For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Karate Our Martial Arts Academy is dedicated to empowering individuals through discipline, focus, and fitness, offering a range of classes including Karate, Taekwondo, Kickboxing, and Yoga for both kids and adults. At the heart of our academy lies Karate, a practice that goes beyond physical strength to build character, confidence, and mental resilience. Under the guidance of certified instructors, students learn traditional techniques, self-defense skills, and the philosophy of respect and perseverance that defines true martial artists. Our Karate program is designed for all ages and skill levels, from beginners taking their first steps to advanced learners refining their craft. Through structured training, goal setting, and continuous progression, we help students develop not only their physical abilities but also their sense of discipline, self-control, and inner balance. Provider: Train Me For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Swimming Hamilton Aquatics is fueled by a deep passion for swimming and a commitment to excellence in every aspect of aquatic education. They aim to elevate performance for swimmers of all levels ‚Äî from beginners learning to navigate the water confidently to competitive athletes striving for peak performance. Safety is at the core of everything we do. Their programmes are designed to uphold the highest standards of water safety, ensuring a secure and supportive environment for all participants. Provider: Hamilton Aquatics For more information, please contact: Email: benjamin.gibbs@hamiltonaquatics.ae Mobile: +971 4 450 8832 Dance Step In Time is dedicated to offering the highest quality dance education for children in a nurturing and inspiring environment. Their team of passionate instructors brings extensive experience, creativity, and expertise to every class, ensuring that each child receives personalized attention and guidance tailored to their unique abilities and interests. At Step In Time, they believe that dance is not just about technique ‚Äî it‚Äôs about expression, confidence, and growth. That‚Äôs why they are committed to fostering a warm, inclusive, and supportive atmosphere where every child feels valued, empowered, and encouraged to explore their potential. Provider: Step in Time For more information, please contact: Email: i nfo@stepintime.ae Mobile: +971 52 550 6706 Mobile app Development Think n Innovative is at the forefront of harnessing the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to transform everyday life. AI is no longer a futuristic concept. Our mission is to leverage AI to create smarter, more intuitive solutions that improve lives, drive innovation, and empower businesses and individuals to achieve their full potential. With Think n Innovative, the possibilities of AI are limitless ‚Äî shaping a future where technology seamlessly supports and enhances human capability. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Game designing At Think n Innovative, Game Designing Courses for Kids ignite creativity and introduce young learners to the exciting world of coding and animation. Through engaging, hands-on sessions, children learn to create interactive stories and games while developing essential problem-solving skills. They explore concepts such as event handling, movement blocks, and animation, bringing their characters to life with costumes, dialogue, and text-to-speech features. Kids gain an understanding of variables, loops, randomization, and Cartesian coordinates, enabling them to control sprite positions and craft dynamic gameplay. Their courses also teach children how to design stages with multiple sprites and backgrounds, adjust movement speeds, and incorporate add-ons to enhance their projects. Advanced activities, such as creating a Solar System animation using broadcast messages, blend storytelling with STEM learning. By the end of the course, children not only build technical skills but also cultivate creativity, logical thinking, and a passion for innovation in a fun and supportive environment. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Language Class (Russian, Chinese) Russian Early Learning Program at Headway Institute is the perfect choice for native or bilingual Russian-speaking children. Designed to provide a strong foundation for kindergarten, the program covers all essential areas of early education, including Language and Literature, Drawing, and Arts and Crafts, ensuring children develop both academically and creatively in a nurturing environment. In addition to Russian, they also offer opportunities for children to be exposed to Chinese language learning, fostering multilingual skills from an early age. This combination of cultural and linguistic learning helps young learners build confidence, communication skills, and a love for learning, preparing them for future academic success and global opportunities. Provider: Headway Institute For more information, please contact: Email: polina@headin.pro Facilities for Rent Facilities Sports/Activities Football Pitch Football, Mini Football, Training Sessions, Tournaments Multi-Purpose Hall 1 & 2 Basketball, Badminton, Volleyball, Netball, Fitness Activities Tennis Court Tennis, Mini Tennis, Coaching Sessions, Fitness Drills For bookings or more information, please contact our facilities provider, Eagles Sports Academy: Email: info@eaglessportsacademy.com Mobile: +971 55 654 6779 Sunmarke offers a deep variety of paid After School Activities (ASAs) via best-of-class, external third party providers. ASAs are run individually and in groups in sports, music, coding, and other subjects during the school year after school hours and as camps during holidays. ASAs are separate from the school‚Äôs curriculum and Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) which Sunmarke runs during school hours in the academic year. Features of our After School Activities (ASAs): Qualified Instructors Structured, varied programmes onsite or off-site throughout the year Secure and safe environment ASA Providers We offer our premises for rent to reputed independent external 3rd Party Providers who run paid ASAs. Mr. Anish Carl, Activities Manager Tel: +971 4 423 8900 Email: a.carl@fortes.co Sports Sports Basketball Football Swimming Volleyball and Multi-Sports Martial Arts Tennis by Unlimited Sports Tennis by Playverse Sport Academy Morovic Bauer Basketball Academy (MBBA) Registration https://www.mbba.ae/ The company was established with a mission to nurture aspiring athletes through top-tier training and mentorship. Committed to excellence in basketball education, empowering athletes to reach their full potential. Day Activity Age group Timing Monday Basketball Academy All age groups 3:45pm-10:00pm Wednesday Basketball Academy All age groups 3:45pm-10:00pm Thursday Basketball Academy All age groups 3:45pm-10:00pm Saturday Basketball Academy All age groups 9:00am - 12:00pm Contact Details Phone: +971 58 513 2623 Email Address: mbba.dubai@gmail.com Follow us on social media: Facebook @mbba.dubai Instagram @mbba.dubai Tiktok @mbba.dubai Eagles Sports Academy Registration https://www.eaglessportsacademy.com/ Boys and Girls age 3-18 Years Old Beginners Level (FOR BOYS AND GIRLS AGE 3-18 YEARS OLD. LEARN BASIC FOOTBALL SKILLS IN PROFESSIONAL AND FUN ENVIRONMENT). Eagles Sports Coaches are all UEFA B licenses approved with big football experience in the UAE for over 10 years! We have been working with children with passion for football as a sport. All our Coaches are friendly and great in working with groups and individuals. Your children will have the opportunity to improve their individual skills (dribbling, passing, shooting) while learning the art of teamwork and camaraderie! title: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai
content: Extracurricular Activities at Sunmarke International School, Dubai Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities Activities > Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities After School Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke offers a deep variety of paid Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) via best-of-class, external third party providers. ECAs are run individually and in groups in sports, music, coding, and other subjects during the school year after school hours and as camps during holidays. Features of our Extracurricular Activities (ECAs): Qualified Instructors Structured, varied programmes onsite or off-site throughout the year Secure and safe environment Chess Our chess course provides a comprehensive and engaging learning experience for both beginners and intermediate players. Following a structured curriculum, students will build a strong foundation in the fundamentals of chess, including the rules, piece movements, and essential strategies. They will progress to exploring tactical combinations, positional play, and endgame techniques designed to strengthen overall gameplay. The course places strong emphasis on developing critical thinking, pattern recognition, and decision-making skills. Students will also learn how to create a personalized opening repertoire, prepare effectively for tournaments, and understand the psychological dimensions of the game. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Fashion Designing Students will be introduced to the exciting world of fashion and will develop a strong foundation in fashion design, preparing them to potentially pursue a career in the field. They will learn essential skills such as pattern cutting, draping, sewing, and various textile techniques, along with gaining an understanding of fashion history to inspire and inform their creative process. By the end of the term, students will design and create their own wearable piece that they can proudly showcase and wear. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Multi-Activity Students will be introduced to the exciting world of multi-activity, gaining a strong foundation that could inspire them to pursue a future career. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 3000 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Stories, Animation, and Game Designing Learners will carefully design and choreograph their own creations using a visual scripting language‚Äîbringing characters to life, switching scenes, and even adding voiceovers. Join us on the adventure of a lifetime as you discover how to build epic games with the world‚Äôs leading programming language for children. This is the must-know coding language of the decade! Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Photography Students will be introduced to digital photography and the seven principles of photography. They will learn how to operate a DSLR in Manual Mode by understanding the three elements of the exposure triangle‚Äîshutter speed, ISO, and aperture‚Äîtheir functions, and how to achieve proper exposure in a photograph. Students will also explore different genres of photography, including motion, product, portrait, and stop-motion photography, while developing the skills to effectively balance the exposure triangle. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 AI and Robotics AI and Robotics are all around us, and we interact with machine learning systems every day‚Äîwhether through spam filters, recommendation engines, language translation services, chatbots and digital assistants, search engines, or fraud detection tools. Soon, it will be common for machine learning systems to drive our cars and assist doctors in diagnosing and treating illnesses. Examples such as Tesla‚Äôs self-driving technology or Apple‚Äôs Siri highlight how artificial intelligence is already part of our daily lives. In this course, students are introduced to coding in an engaging way through a hands-on Robotics kit. This allows them to visualize the output of their code and gain a deeper understanding of key concepts. Each Robotics model presents a problem-solving challenge that enhances not only your child‚Äôs coding skills but also their logical thinking and reasoning abilities. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate Price Per Term: AED 1320 Section Specific: Primary For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Football Our Football Academy welcomes children of all skill levels ‚Äì from beginners taking their first steps on the pitch to advanced players striving for excellence. The programme focuses on developing technical skills, tactical understanding, teamwork and leadership, and physical conditioning. Led by UEFA-licensed coaches, our sessions provide a supportive and engaging environment where every child can grow, have fun, and reach their full potential. At Step In Time, they believe that dance is not just about technique ‚Äî it‚Äôs about expression, confidence, and growth. AI is no longer a futuristic concept. Our mission is to leverage AI to create smarter, more intuitive solutions that improve lives, drive innovation, and empower businesses and individuals to achieve their full potential. With Think n Innovative, the possibilities of AI are limitless ‚Äî shaping a future where technology seamlessly supports and enhances human capability. Provider: Think N‚Äô Innovate For more information, please contact: Email: info@thinkninnovate.com Mobile: +971 55 536 2193 Game designing At Think n Innovative, Game Designing Courses for Kids ignite creativity and introduce young learners to the exciting world of coding and animation. Through engaging, hands-on sessions, children learn to create interactive stories and games while developing essential problem-solving skills. They explore concepts such as event handling, movement blocks, and animation, bringing their characters to life with costumes, dialogue, and text-to-speech features. Kids gain an understanding of variables, loops, randomization, and Cartesian coordinates, enabling them to control sprite positions and craft dynamic gameplay. Their courses also teach children how to design stages with multiple sprites and backgrounds, adjust movement speeds, and incorporate add-ons to enhance their projects. Advanced activities, such as creating a Solar System animation using broadcast messages, blend storytelling with STEM learning. By the end of the course, children not only build technical skills but also cultivate creativity, logical thinking, and a passion for innovation in a fun and supportive environment. Designed to provide a strong foundation for kindergarten, the program covers all essential areas of early education, including Language and Literature, Drawing, and Arts and Crafts, ensuring children develop both academically and creatively in a nurturing environment. In addition to Russian, they also offer opportunities for children to be exposed to Chinese language learning, fostering multilingual skills from an early age. This combination of cultural and linguistic learning helps young learners build confidence, communication skills, and a love for learning, preparing them for future academic success and global opportunities. Sports > Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression At Sunmarke, we believe that the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) is a crucial period for nurturing creativity and self-expression in young learners. During these formative years, children explore the world around them, develop their imagination, and begin to express their thoughts and emotions in unique ways. Integrating art and creative activities into the EYFS curriculum plays a pivotal role in this developmental journey. Art is more than just drawing or painting‚Äîit is a powerful tool that allows children to communicate ideas that they may not yet have the words to express. In EYFS, children are encouraged to experiment with colors, textures, and materials, giving them the freedom to explore and create. This process not only develops fine motor skills but also boosts confidence as children see their ideas come to life. Creativity in early years education is closely linked to cognitive and emotional development. When children engage in art, they learn to make decisions, solve problems, and think critically. For instance, choosing which colors to mix, how to build a structure with blocks, or deciding what story to tell through a drawing all stimulate their brain in meaningful ways. Furthermore, creative activities offer a safe space for children to express emotions, explore feelings, and develop empathy. A child who paints a stormy sky might be working through feelings of frustration or excitement‚Äîart becomes a mirror to their inner world. At Sunmarke, our EYFS classrooms are designed to inspire creativity. We provide a rich variety of resources‚Äîfrom paints, clay, and fabrics to natural materials like leaves and shells. Teachers act as facilitators rather than directors, guiding children gently while allowing them the autonomy to explore. This approach encourages independent thinking and celebrates individual expression. Music, drama, and storytelling also play a vital role in nurturing creativity. Singing songs, role-playing, and creating stories enable children to develop language skills, imagination, and social interaction. Collaborative art projects, for example, foster teamwork and communication, helping children learn to share ideas and respect different perspectives. Parents are key partners in this journey. Encouraging children to explore creativity at home, whether through doodling, crafting, or imaginative play, reinforces what they experience at school. At Sunmarke, we actively involve families in celebrating children‚Äôs artwork and creative achievements, recognizing that encouragement and appreciation fuel confidence and motivation. Ultimately, fostering art and creativity in EYFS is about more than producing beautiful artwork. It is about empowering children to explore, express, and understand themselves and the world around them. By providing the right environment, resources, and guidance, Sunmarke ensures that every child‚Äôs unique voice is heard, celebrated, and nurtured from the very beginning of their educational journey. 0 Shares Prev Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

Login Sunmarke Blog > Sports > Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes Sunmarke School has always championed a holistic approach to education, nurturing not only academic excellence but also the physical, social, and emotional development of its students. Building on this ethos, we are proud to announce the launch of the Fortes Pro Sports Academy , a groundbreaking initiative designed to elevate young athletes to new heights of performance and personal growth. The Academy is tailored for students with a passion for sports and a desire to pursue excellence across multiple disciplines. Combining Sunmarke‚Äôs proven curriculum with professional-level coaching, Fortes Pro Sports Academy provides a unique platform where talent meets opportunity. Every programme is led by highly experienced lead coaches , who bring professional expertise, guidance, and mentorship, ensuring that students receive the highest quality training. At the heart of the Academy are our signature sports programmes , which focus on both individual and team development: Netball : Guided by our lead netball coaches, students refine their tactical understanding, agility, and precision. The programme emphasises competitive performance, teamwork, and sportsmanship, preparing students for school, regional, and national competitions. Volleyball : Our lead volleyball coaches focus on strategy, communication, and physical conditioning, helping students enhance skills such as serving, spiking, and defensive play while fostering strong team cohesion. Swimming : The Fortes Pro Swimming programme caters to all levels, from beginners to advanced swimmers. With lead coaches supporting technique, endurance, and speed, students benefit from personalised training in state-of-the-art facilities. Athletics : Students receive specialised coaching in track and field events, developing speed, strength, and stamina. Our lead athletics coaches encourage goal setting, personal bests, and healthy competition, reflecting Sunmarke‚Äôs commitment to holistic growth. Football : Football enthusiasts work with lead football coaches to develop tactical awareness, ball control, fitness, and teamwork. Students engage in competitive matches and tournaments, fostering skill development, strategic thinking, and resilience. The Fortes Pro Sports Academy seamlessly integrates into the Sunmarke School curriculum, ensuring that students achieve a balance between academic responsibilities and sporting ambitions. By combining rigorous coaching with personalised development plans, students are equipped to excel in both arenas, whether aiming for professional sporting pathways or pursuing personal fitness and well-being goals. With the launch of the Fortes Pro Sports Academy, Sunmarke School reaffirms its dedication to nurturing well-rounded individuals. Our commitment is to empower students to pursue their passions, develop lifelong skills, and become confident, resilient, and accomplished individuals both on and off the field. Beyond competition, our Academy provides students with a comprehensive sporting experience ‚Äî including strength and conditioning, recovery sessions, match analysis, and workshops focused on developing a performance mindset. We also have partnerships with professionals and businesses across the sports industry, giving students valuable real-world insight and opportunities to grow both on and off the field. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke
