If your child doesn't have money for the day, we will issue them the food for you to pay later. Our canteen supervisor will contact parents to confirm this and check for any allergies. How do I enrol my child? Enrolment for 2025-26 ‚Äì New families 1) Can I come in for a school tour with my family? We are now able to conduct school tours for prospective students and their parents. 2) KHDA Parent School Contract To prepare for enrolment into the new academic year 2025-26, please note that: Students can only attend school in the new academic year if they are registered in the KHDA School System and parents have signed the Parent-School Contract. Please download the Dubai Now App which will enable you to sign the Parent/School Contract online. This only needs to be signed by parents of students who are new to the school. 3) Documents for Registering at Sunmarke School If you are a new family, joining the school for 2025-26, please ensure that all pending documentation for your child is submitted to the Admissions department at Sunmarke School. Documents that should be submitted to the school are: Letter of current enrolment at school (Year 2 Up) Transfer Certificate (Attested by UAE Embassy) School reference letter (Year 2 Up) School Reports ‚Äì 2024-25 (Year 2 Up) 1 Passport Size Coloured Photo ( Student and both Parents) Student Passport Copy Student UAE Visa Copy Sponsoring Parents Passport and UAE Visa Copy Birth Certificate (in English or Arabic) Student‚Äôs Emirates ID Card (back & Front) Sponsoring Parent Emirates ID card (back & Front) Vaccination & Immunisation Record Copy DHA Medical & Immunisation Consent form 4) Age Cut-Off Dates New students must be enroled in their respective age groups as per the ministerial decree (820) of 2014. The cut-off date is 31 st August without exception. The table below shows the age/year-group information of students aged 3 to 6. Sunmarke School is required to comply with the age/year-group criteria and the cut-off date as per the ministerial decree. Year FS1 FS2 Year 1 Year 2 Age by 31 st August 3 4 5 6 This is a federal law and we are not able to consider any exemption requests. What are the KHDA guidelines for Admissions and Transfers? Click here to read Guidelines for Admissions and Transfers by KHDA. What are the age requirements for AY 2024-25? 1. What are the changes to the age requirements for entry to Sunmarke School? Age requirements will change for new students enroled into FS1, according to the UAE Ministry of Education Resolution no (24). Children enroling into FS1, starting in September, must be three years old on or before the 31st of August. Children enroling into FS2, starting in September, must be four years old on or before the 31st of August. Similarly, children enroling into Year 1, starting school in September, must be five years old on or before the 31st of August. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. This includes students who enrol for the final term of the 2023/24 academic year. Schools that start the academic year in September, in line with MOE Resolution no (24). Year Group Age requirement Foundation Stage 1 3 years old by August 31st Foundation Stage 2 4 years old by August 31st Year 1 5 years old by August 31 Year 2 6 years old by August 31 2. When did this change come into effect? This change was applicable from the start of the 2021/22 academic year in September 2021. 3. Why was this change made? This decision was made to bring more consistency to the cut-off dates used by schools in the UAE with those used by schools abroad. For example, UK schools in the UAE will now have the same cut-off date as schools in the UK, and international British schools. 4.Who will this change impact? This change will impact children up to six years old who are enrolling in school for the first time. 5. Will the new cut-off date apply to all year groups? It will apply to new students enrolling in FS1, FS2, Year 1 and Year 2 in all schools in the UAE, as stipulated in the MOE resolution. 6. My child was born in October and is now in FS1 ‚Äì I want to enrol him in another school for FS2. Can I do this or does he have to repeat a year? Because your child is already enroled in school, the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution do not apply. He does not have to repeat the year. 7. My son was enroled in FS1 this year but I withdrew his enrolment due to COVID-19. He‚Äôll be 3 years old in September. Can I still enrol him in FS2 next year? Your child must have formally finished the previous academic year in order to enrol in the next one. Since he does not meet the age requirement for FS2 for next academic year, he must enrol in FS1. According to the MOE resolution, he can enrol in FS2 next academic year only if he completes FS1 this academic year. 8. My daughter will be 4 years old in December. If I enrol her in FS2 for the last term of this year ‚Äì before the changes come into effect ‚Äì will she be able to start Year 1 next year? Yes. The new age requirements will apply for new students from the start of the next academic year only. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. 9. I‚Äôve already registered and paid the deposit for my daughter to start school in FS2 in September. She will be four years old in November. Is she affected by this? According to the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution, your daughter will not be able to start in FS2 in September. Alternatively, we would be happy to transfer your child‚Äôs application to their age-appropriate year group (FS1) and register your child for this year group instead. Parents whose children are affected by the new cut-off dates and who have already paid deposits for their children‚Äôs enrolment are entitled to a refund if they wish. 10. My child was born one day after the cut-off date. Is there some leeway given? No exceptions to the cut-off dates will be given under any circumstances How do I book Assessments for entry 2025-26 AY? Admissions are now open for applications for 2025-26 AY* entry. The 2025-2026 Assessment Diary is Open ‚Äì We are now booking assessments for year groups FS1 & FS2, Year 1 to 10 and Year 12. Please contact the Sunmarke Admissions Office to confirm your child‚Äôs assessment date. For students currently overseas: For students in current Year 6 and above we can offer Assessment at the current school attended. Please contact us to find out more. Students transferring from UK schools in all years, please contact us directly for more details. Can my child be assessed before arriving into Dubai? For Students entering Year 7 and above, assessment can be offered at the current school attended if that school is willing to administer the test under examination conditions. The assessment will be the same as that taken by our local students with the addition of a Skype interview. You will need to provide registration, a letter of enrolment, the latest school report, and a recommendation form by the date of assessment. For students transferring from UK schools please contact admissions directly to discuss your application. What are the tuition fees for FS1- Year 13 (2025-26)? Tuition Fees Click here to view the Tuition Fees: New Students ‚Äì FS1 to Year 13 ‚Äì 2025-26 What are the KHDA document fees? Tariff for the following KHDA services as stipulated by KHDA: Request for student Education Continuation Certificate for visa renewal (AED 120) Request for student leaving form for the students who are leaving Dubai (AED 120) Request for student transfer between private schools (within the stipulated time frame)-Student transfer (AED 120) Can my child with special education needs attend Sunmarke school? At Sunmarke, we exercise a positive and inclusive admissions policy. Candidates will each be given due consideration on a case-by-case basis, and we will take into account the capacity of the premises, staff and curriculum pathways to effectively meet the needs of the individual. Our Achievement Centre offers a broad range of additional support for students with SEND, including targeted support in language, maths, literacy, and functional independence. We are currently working to develop our range of alternative curriculum pathways for Key Stages 2, 3, and 4 so that, in time, we can offer an appropriate pathway for every learner. What is Year 7 and Year 8 Life skills Pathway? 1. Is it approved by the Ministry of Education? It is a mainstream curriculum, supplemented by ASDAN modules. As it is a supplemented curriculum which focuses on reduced teachers, as per KHDA, there is no need for permission for this pathway as it falls under our current education licence. 2. What are the timings if my son is enroled in this program? The timings are that of the normal school day, unless the student has additional needs or commitments outside of school that need to be met. As a KHDA accredited Rahhal provider, we can review timings to meet the student‚Äôs needs. 3. What is the cost for LSA? Costs are an estimate range until all students are enroled. 4. What would be mentioned in the invoice for this program? Is it ‚ÄúTuition fee‚Äù? School fees are billed as normal. Parents will then have to sign a KHDA Individual Service Agreement for the LSA cost. This will then be a separate invoice. 5 How will I enrol my child? Our SENCO will assess the student before we can accept to ensure we can meet their needs in this class. It is a pathway that supports access to the mainstream and we can‚Äôt cater for severe needs. For more information on the pathway, please click here What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? What is the Assessment, Registration, and Re-enrolment fees for Regent International School students transferring to Sunmarke School? Students transferring to Sunmarke School from Regent International School, will not be required to pay additional Assessment or Registration fees. Transferring students are only required to complete the RIS Re-Enrollment Form and pay the 5 % re-enrolment fee by the start of the third term each year to secure their seat. What are the tuition fees and discounts for Regent International School transfers to Sunmarke school for FS1-Year 13 (2025-26)? Fee Structure ‚Äì Transferring students from Regent International School to Sunmarke School Application Fee Dhs.525/- ‚Äì Not chargeable Re-enrollment Fee (Existing Students) 5% of Tuition Fee ‚Äì Non-refundable, adjusted against the 1st Term‚Äôs Tuition Fee, 1st day of Term3 Transferring RIS Students Phase Tuition Fees Year Group Discounted Tuition Fees for students transferring from Year 6 at Regent Foundation 1 46,700 Foundation 2 51,900 Year 1 58,548 Year 2 58,548 Year 3 59,619 Year 4 59,619 Year 5 59,619 Year 6 59,619 Year 7 67,290 Year 8 67,290 Year 9 67,290 Year 10 69,397 Year 11 69,397 Year 12 70,276 Year 13 70,276 Additional Benefits: Sibling Discounts: 1st Sibling 5%, 2nd Sibling 10%, 3rd Sibling 10%, 4th Sibling 10%. The sibling discount scheme is available to those siblings from the same family who enrol at the school for one full academic year. The sibling discount is applicable to the 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th child from the same family. The amount of the discount is calculated off the actual Tuition Fee paid of the child who pays the lowest tuition fee amongst the siblings enrolled at the school. The maximum discount per family cannot exceed 35% of the lowest paying sibling‚Äôs Tuition Fee. SCHOOL ACCOUNT DETAILS TUITION FEES ‚Äì DUE DATES Payment can be made via wire transfer to the following account: Re-enrolment 15 th December Account Name : SUNMARKE SCHOOL LLC Autumn Term 01 st August Account Number : 12000921414 Spring Term 15 th November Bank Name : National Bank of Fujairah PJSC Summer Term 15 th February Branch : Jebel Ali Swift : NBFUAEAFDXB IBAN # : AE220380000012000921414 Remarks : Please email proof of all payments to: accounts.sms@sunmarkedubai.com , and cc: officemanager.sms@forteseducation.com & registrar.sms@forteseducation.com Additional Fees (charged separately from Tuition Fee): Optional Transportation Services via 3rd Party Service Provider; Optional Dining Services via 3rd Party Service Provider; Optional After-School Activities provided by 3 rd Party Service Providers; School Uniforms; Educational Visits; School Fees are subject to change in accordance with the Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) Fees Framework What are the sibling discounts if siblings are at both Sunmarke School and Regent International School for 2025-26? In cases where the eldest sibling transfers to the secondary phase at Sunmarke School, but the FS and Primary Phase siblings stay at Regent International School the following discount policy will be applied on full-year attendance: Example 1: Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke: No Discount 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at SMS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per SMS Policy 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at SMS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per SMS Policy Example 2: Eldest Child (1st Child in the family) ‚Äì Attending Sunmarke School: No Discount 2nd Child from the same family (Sibling 1 at RIS): 5% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per RIS Policy 3rd Child from the same family (Sibling 2 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition fee as per RIS Policy 4th Child from the same family (Sibling 3 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per RIS Policy 5th Child from the same family (Sibling 4 at RIS): 10% deducted from 3rd Term Tuition Fee as per RIS Policy *Please note, that these discounts will be applied to the 1st, 2nd, 3rd or 4th siblings 3rd Term of joining actual Tuition Fee. The maximum discount per family is equal to 35% of the lowest sibling‚Äôs tuition fee. What is the Sunmarke School and Regent International School returning students -Founders Fee entitlement? If a Regent International School or Sunmarke School student leaves the school but returns to the School before the end of one (1) academic term, they will keep their entitlement to the Regent International School Transfers to Sunmarke School Tuition Fee Structure. If more than one Term passes, then the student will be considered a New Student and will be required to pay the New Students Fee Structure as applicable to their group of re-entry. What are the facilities you offer? What are the facilities you offer? We have state-of-the-art facilities on offer with special attention paid to athletics, the arts and the latest technological advancements. Below is an indication of the amenities provided to our students. Facilities Athletics Creative and Performing Arts Academic FIFA - 18 Sized Football Pitch 200 Meter Athletics Running Track Two Swimming Pools Tennis, Basketball, Volleyball and Netball Courts Two Expansive Multipurpose Halls Three Fine Arts Labs Dedicated Drama Studio 600 Seat Auditorium Four Music Labs TV & Radio Production Studios Nine World-Class Science Labs Five Design Technology Labs Three Libraries with Media Centres What is the class capacity? Class Sizes for Academic Year 2025-26: To ensure each student receives the individualised care he/she deserves, we cap classes based on the year. Below is a breakdown of student-to-teacher ratios by year: Year Group FS1 FS2 ‚Äì Y1 Y2 ‚Äì Y6 Y7 ‚Äì Y9 Y10 ‚Äì Y11 Y12 ‚Äì Y13 Maximum number of students 22 24 26 26 26 26 At the end of each academic year, it is the school‚Äôs policy to mix and reallocate all classes throughout the school. This process is undertaken to ensure the even spread of age, gender, nationality, and ability across the classes. What nationalities make up the school body? Sunmarke is a truly international school with a focus on fostering diversity and nurturing talent. Sunmarke continues in Regent International ‚Äòs tradition with regards to enrolment with 90+ nationalities represented with the largest percentage hailing from the U.K. What are the school timings? Year Group Timings Foundation Stage 1 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Foundation Stage 2 Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 1:30 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 am Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:10 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 pm Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 7:40 am ‚Äì 3:10 pm Friday 7:40 am ‚Äì 11:45 pm For detailed timings of all year groups,, please click here. What school transport is offered? What school transport is offered? A bus service is in operation at Sunmarke School. The details of this service, route and fees, are now available from the Transport Manager‚Äôs Office on the Ground Floor. For more information on bus fees, please click here. For more information on our routes and the health & safety protocols for our buses, please click here . What is the pickup/drop off timings? School Transport Timings Bus start times remain the same. For drop-off, buses will leave from the school at the following times Year Group Timings EYFS Monday to Thursday 1:30 pm Friday 12:15 pm onwards Primary (Year 1 to 6) Monday to Thursday 3:30 pm onwards Friday 12.15 pm onwards Secondary (Year 7 to 13) Monday to Thursday 3:30 pm onwards Friday 12:15 pm onwards Further communication on this will be shared by our transportation department. How do I order food for my child? 1. How do I book the service? Booking can only be done for EYFS and Primary students. Secondary students can go directly to the canteen to select their food and make payment. EYFS and Primary parents need to pre-book their order in advance via the link provided http://form.jotform.com/Mastercook/Sunmarke-stripe and lunch will be delivered in their class. 2. What is the price for lunch? Lunch is priced at AED24.25 this includes the main lunch and a dessert. 3. What is the menu like? Please click TERM MENU to see current available menu. Alternatively, secondary students can check out our GRAB AND GO menu. 4. Do you offer special meal plans? As a nut-free school, all meals are prepared using nut-free products. We also offer bespoke menus for students with special dietary needs, including gluten-free, dairy-free, etc. For this request, please contact coordinator@mastercook.ae for a specialised price and to discuss options. 5. Does your menu contain allergen information? As per Dubai Municipality guidelines, we follow their standard of menu labels that include the ingredients, allergens, and calorie content. The menu also has a specialised coding that identifies the contents of the meal, allowing our students to check if it contains something they are allergic to. Please communicate this to your child if they are in Secondary school. With Lactose With Egg With gluten Seafood With Soy Vegetarian 6. Can my child buy food at the Grab & Go counter? This option caters only to our Secondary school students and staff. The Grab & Go section of the dining services is exactly what it is ‚Äì you grab the food, make the payment, and go on with your daily activity. We always ensure that there is a menu suitable for vegetarians and non-vegetarians. 7. What are the canteen timings? The canteen is open from 7am to 3.30 pm Monday to Thursday and 7am to 12:00 noon on Friday. Please note that only the Grab and Go section of the canteen is open on Friday. 8. Is breakfast available in the canteen? A healthy breakfast, via the Grab and Go section, is available daily from 7am. Secondary school students can only use the canteen at break time and lunchtime. 9. What time are the dining services available and when is lunch delivered to EYFS and Primary students? The lunch period for various year groups is listed as per the below timetable. For EYFS and Primary students, lunch will be delivered to their classroom prior to their scheduled lunch break. All the delivered lunches will have the names clearly labelled on them so that teachers can easily identify and distribute them to the children during lunchtime. Phases Mondays to Thursdays Fridays Secondary Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 12:40pm ‚Äì 01:40pm Not available Primary Key Stage 1 (Y1-2) Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55pm 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 10:50am ‚Äì 11:45am Not available Primary Key Stage 2 (Y3- 6) Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am 9:40am ‚Äì 9:55am Lunch 11:45am ‚Äì 12:40pm Not available EYFS Break 09:40am ‚Äì 09:55am Not available Lunch From 11:45am Not available 10. How do I pay for my child‚Äôs lunch? For EYFS and Primary students, parents can pay upon confirming their order. For secondary, payments can be made using their credit card/apple pay / google pay/cash. 11. What if I forgot to place order can you still give my child her/his food? We understand that parents can get busy and at times forget to make lunch, for this one time emergency situation, we suggest you contact Mastercook ‚Äì Person in Charge- Ms Karen directly on +971566180756 and she will be happy to assist you for the day. 12. Who do I contact for any queries, suggestions, and clarifications? The Mastercook catering team is happy to assist parents with their queries and for clarification. Please reach out to Karen from Mastercook on +971 52 618 0756 (mobile number) +971 4 448 8103 (Mastercook Office #) +971 4 423 8995 (school number) or email enquiries to coordinator@mastercook.ae 13. I am travelling for 3 days and would like to book my child lunch during the time I am away, can I place order for 3 days only? We are pleased to inform you that Mastercook are now accepting orders for short period, please go to the booking form and indicate the days you will require your child‚Äôs lunch delivered. 14. My child forgot to bring money, can you give him food? Mastercook believe that food is essential part of child‚Äôs growth development. If your child doesn‚Äôt have money for the day, we will issue them the food for you to pay later. Our canteen supervisor will contact parents to confirm this and check for any allergies.

Sports > Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression At Sunmarke, we believe that the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) is a crucial period for nurturing creativity and self-expression in young learners. During these formative years, children explore the world around them, develop their imagination, and begin to express their thoughts and emotions in unique ways. Integrating art and creative activities into the EYFS curriculum plays a pivotal role in this developmental journey. Art is more than just drawing or painting‚Äîit is a powerful tool that allows children to communicate ideas that they may not yet have the words to express. In EYFS, children are encouraged to experiment with colors, textures, and materials, giving them the freedom to explore and create. This process not only develops fine motor skills but also boosts confidence as children see their ideas come to life. Creativity in early years education is closely linked to cognitive and emotional development. When children engage in art, they learn to make decisions, solve problems, and think critically. For instance, choosing which colors to mix, how to build a structure with blocks, or deciding what story to tell through a drawing all stimulate their brain in meaningful ways. Furthermore, creative activities offer a safe space for children to express emotions, explore feelings, and develop empathy. A child who paints a stormy sky might be working through feelings of frustration or excitement‚Äîart becomes a mirror to their inner world. At Sunmarke, our EYFS classrooms are designed to inspire creativity. We provide a rich variety of resources‚Äîfrom paints, clay, and fabrics to natural materials like leaves and shells. Teachers act as facilitators rather than directors, guiding children gently while allowing them the autonomy to explore. This approach encourages independent thinking and celebrates individual expression. Music, drama, and storytelling also play a vital role in nurturing creativity. Singing songs, role-playing, and creating stories enable children to develop language skills, imagination, and social interaction. Collaborative art projects, for example, foster teamwork and communication, helping children learn to share ideas and respect different perspectives. Parents are key partners in this journey. Encouraging children to explore creativity at home, whether through doodling, crafting, or imaginative play, reinforces what they experience at school. At Sunmarke, we actively involve families in celebrating children‚Äôs artwork and creative achievements, recognizing that encouragement and appreciation fuel confidence and motivation. Ultimately, fostering art and creativity in EYFS is about more than producing beautiful artwork. It is about empowering children to explore, express, and understand themselves and the world around them. By providing the right environment, resources, and guidance, Sunmarke ensures that every child‚Äôs unique voice is heard, celebrated, and nurtured from the very beginning of their educational journey. 0 Shares Prev Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

Elite Sports Academy Camps ‚Äì A happy, healthy child Elite Sports Academy Camps ‚Äì A happy, healthy child School‚Äôs out and if you‚Äôre wondering how to keep the kids entertained over the Winter holidays, read on‚Ä¶ Let them burn off energy and find new interests at the Elite Sports Winter Camp based at Sunmarke & Regent International School! It‚Äôs more than just a camp‚Ä¶so here‚Äôs how the Elite Sports Camp will help your child: 1. Physical activities = health & wellbeing Physical activity can strengthen a child‚Äôs muscles and bones, prevent excessive weight gain, and reduce the risk of diseases and other medical conditions, however, physical activity is also beneficial to the mental health of a child. Experts say physical activity allows children to have a better outlook on life by building confidence, managing anxiety and depression, and increasing self-esteem and cognitive skills. ‚ÄúExercise also releases endorphins, which correlates to a happy child,‚Äù said Len Saunders, physical health educator, and author of ‚ÄúKeeping Kids Fit‚Äù. Elites Camps are based on the concept that children will be having so much fun, they are unaware at just how much information is being retained to improve their ability. 2. Organised sport ‚Äòimproves your School Life‚Äô Organised extracurricular sport activities for children help them develop and improve cognitive skills, such as greater concentration capacity, that can in term greatly help them in the classroom, says Universit√© de Montr√©al professor Linda Pagani. We agree, as concentration and awareness are massively improved by participating in sport. Our gymnastics games such as ‚ÄòMinefield‚Äô promotes concentration to commit to moves that require balance and determination. Within the game we use instructions from team mates to enable them to navigate their way and complete tasks. 3. Social awareness and forming friendships Communication is the foundation of any good relationship. Our ability to communicate effectively and appropriately is how we relate to others and welcome them to understand us. It can be as basic as remembering peoples‚Äô names to engaging in thoughtful conversations. We encourage our kids before they even learn how to talk, how to communicate. We actively encourage students that have been with Elite at previous camps to befriend new students and take them under their wing. Each day we select new teams to encourage the children to meet new children with team games helping to build confidence in teammates and to reinforce how important it is to ‚Äòrely on‚Äô and ‚Äòbe reliable‚Äô. Some children know how to approach a group and ask to join the fun; for other kids, this doesn‚Äôt come to them naturally. Sports is the perfect channel for kids to learn how to approach others and work with them. They learn about the parts that they play. Are they a leader or a role player? They learn about the value of being both when it comes to team sports which they can later apply in life. 4. Leadership & Confidence Discovering how to assert yourself is one of the most challenging skills kids should learn. Just as there are aggressive children; there are kids that are more vulnerable and will often be bullied for it. Sports can help build a child‚Äôs confidence and prepare them for later life. Team sports will teach kids the difference between being aggressive and assertive. The competitive atmosphere of sports is a good training ground for building one‚Äôs confidence to achieve a goal. Children aged 4 ‚Äì 14 will enjoy six different activities every day at Elite Sports Camp. The camps focus on fun, team work, communication & technical improvement in a safe and friendly environment. Above all else it‚Äôs a great opportunity for the kids to make friends and stay active. Sign them up and speak with our talented and dedicated coaches who will teach sessions in Football, Basketball, Dodgeball, Hockey, Cricket & much more. A physically active child is a healthy child! Register NOW! Parents can register kids for a week, days or even random half days. A full days lasts from 8.30am to 3.30pm and 8.30am-12pm or 12pm-3.30pm for a half day. The latter costs AED 165, or pay AED 220 a day or AED 840 a week. Register @ www.elitesports.ae or call 04 554 5218 Steven Whittaker Elite Sports Director 0 Shares Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

Building on this ethos, we are proud to announce the launch of the Fortes Pro Sports Academy , a groundbreaking initiative designed to elevate young athletes to new heights of performance and personal growth. The Academy is tailored for students with a passion for sports and a desire to pursue excellence across multiple disciplines. Combining Sunmarke‚Äôs proven curriculum with professional-level coaching, Fortes Pro Sports Academy provides a unique platform where talent meets opportunity. Every programme is led by highly experienced lead coaches , who bring professional expertise, guidance, and mentorship, ensuring that students receive the highest quality training. At the heart of the Academy are our signature sports programmes , which focus on both individual and team development: Netball : Guided by our lead netball coaches, students refine their tactical understanding, agility, and precision. The programme emphasises competitive performance, teamwork, and sportsmanship, preparing students for school, regional, and national competitions. Volleyball : Our lead volleyball coaches focus on strategy, communication, and physical conditioning, helping students enhance skills such as serving, spiking, and defensive play while fostering strong team cohesion. Swimming : The Fortes Pro Swimming programme caters to all levels, from beginners to advanced swimmers. With lead coaches supporting technique, endurance, and speed, students benefit from personalised training in state-of-the-art facilities. Athletics : Students receive specialised coaching in track and field events, developing speed, strength, and stamina. Our lead athletics coaches encourage goal setting, personal bests, and healthy competition, reflecting Sunmarke‚Äôs commitment to holistic growth. Football : Football enthusiasts work with lead football coaches to develop tactical awareness, ball control, fitness, and teamwork. Students engage in competitive matches and tournaments, fostering skill development, strategic thinking, and resilience. The Fortes Pro Sports Academy seamlessly integrates into the Sunmarke School curriculum, ensuring that students achieve a balance between academic responsibilities and sporting ambitions. By combining rigorous coaching with personalised development plans, students are equipped to excel in both arenas, whether aiming for professional sporting pathways or pursuing personal fitness and well-being goals. With the launch of the Fortes Pro Sports Academy, Sunmarke School reaffirms its dedication to nurturing well-rounded individuals. Our commitment is to empower students to pursue their passions, develop lifelong skills, and become confident, resilient, and accomplished individuals both on and off the field. Beyond competition, our Academy provides students with a comprehensive sporting experience ‚Äî including strength and conditioning, recovery sessions, match analysis, and workshops focused on developing a performance mindset. We also have partnerships with professionals and businesses across the sports industry, giving students valuable real-world insight and opportunities to grow both on and off the field. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 21/10/2025 From Passion to Profession: Student-Led Startups & Enterprise Projects at Sunmarke

title: Parenting in Digital Age Supporting Your Child‚Äôs Learning Journey
content: Parenting in Digital Age Supporting Your Child‚Äôs Learning Journey Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Parenting in the Digital Age: Supporting Your Child‚Äôs Learning at Home In today‚Äôs rapidly evolving digital world, parenting has taken on new dimensions. While technology has opened countless opportunities for learning, it has also introduced challenges in balancing screen time, maintaining focus, and encouraging independent thinking. For parents navigating this digital landscape, supporting a child‚Äôs education at home requires a thoughtful approach. Embrace Technology, but with Purpose Digital tools can be powerful allies in your child‚Äôs education. Platforms such as educational apps, online libraries, and virtual classrooms allow children to access knowledge anytime, anywhere. Rather than restricting screen use entirely, aim to make it meaningful. Look for age-appropriate, curriculum-aligned apps and websites that reinforce classroom learning Create a Distraction-Free Learning Environment Home learning doesn‚Äôt always mean hours spent in front of a screen. Setting up a quiet, tech-free zone (other than the necessary devices) helps your child focus during homework or revision time. Ensure the area is well-lit, clutter-free, and away from distractions like television or mobile phones. Having a consistent routine and workspace encourages responsibility and better learning habits. Set Healthy Digital Boundaries One of the biggest concerns for modern parents is screen time. Excessive use of devices can impact sleep, mood, and social skills. Set clear rules around when and how long devices can be used, especially for non-educational purposes. Consider using built-in parental controls or screen-time tracking apps. Most importantly, model good digital habits yourself. Children learn from observing adults, so putting your phone away during family meals or reading together in the evening can reinforce balanced behaviour. Stay Connected with Your Child‚Äôs School In the digital age, home and school partnerships are more important than ever. Use communication platforms like school apps to stay informed about your child‚Äôs progress, assignments, and upcoming events. Don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to teachers for guidance on how to support your child‚Äôs learning journey at home. Many schools, including Sunmarke , also host webinars or offer resources for digital parenting. Encourage Curiosity and Offline Exploration Technology should be a tool‚Äînot a replacement‚Äîfor curiosity. Support your child in developing a love of learning that extends beyond screens. Encourage hobbies like reading, drawing, science experiments, sports or playing a musical instrument. Engage in conversations about what they‚Äôre learning at school, and let them take the lead in exploring topics they‚Äôre passionate about. Parenting in the digital age is about finding balance. With the right strategies and support, you can help your child thrive academically and emotionally in a tech-driven world. By embracing educational technology mindfully, fostering structure and curiosity at home, and staying closely connected with their school, you‚Äôll empower your child to succeed both online and offline. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: Building Emotional Intelligence in FS1 Through Mindfulness
content: Building Emotional Intelligence in FS1 Through Mindfulness Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Mindfulness for Kids: Building Emotional Intelligence from FS1 Onwards In a fast-paced world filled with distractions, cultivating emotional intelligence has never been more important, especially for young children. Starting from FS1 (Foundation Stage 1), mindfulness offers a powerful way to help children recognise, understand, and regulate their emotions, setting the stage for stronger relationships, improved learning , and better mental health. What is Mindfulness? Mindfulness is the practice of being fully present and engaged in the moment without judgement. For young children, this can mean learning to notice their thoughts, feelings, and sensations in a calm and focused way. While the concept may seem advanced, even FS1 students can begin to develop mindfulness through age-appropriate activities such as breathing exercises, sensory play, and guided storytelling. Why Start in FS1? The early years are a critical period in a child‚Äôs emotional development. During FS1 and FS2, children begin to explore their emotions, learn how to interact with others, and develop self-awareness. Introducing mindfulness at this age helps lay a strong foundation for emotional intelligence by teaching children how to name their feelings, and respond thoughtfully rather than react impulsively. At Sunmarke School, our Positive Education and wellbeing programmes embed these principles early on, creating an emotionally supportive environment for every child. Benefits of Mindfulness for Young Learners Improved Focus and Concentration: Simple mindfulness practices help children develop their attention span, which supports academic success and better classroom behaviour. Emotional Regulation: Children learn to identify their emotions and use calming techniques such as deep breathing or counting to manage strong feelings like frustration, sadness, or excitement. Reduced Anxiety and Stress: Mindfulness creates space for calm and reflection, helping even the youngest learners cope with changes, transitions, or separation anxiety. Better Social Skills: Mindful practices encourage empathy, kindness, and listening‚Äîkey traits for making friends and building healthy relationships. Mindfulness Activities Mindful Listening: Play nature sounds or soft music and ask children to describe what they hear. This sharpens focus and brings awareness to the present moment. Feelings Check-In: Use emotion cards or visuals to help children express how they‚Äôre feeling. This builds emotional vocabulary and self-awareness. Gratitude Circles: A simple morning circle time activity where each child shares something they‚Äôre thankful for. Building a Culture of Emotional Intelligence When schools and families work together to integrate mindfulness into daily routines, it becomes second nature. Practising mindfulness doesn‚Äôt require a lot of time, just consistency, encouragement, and a safe space for children to explore their feelings. By starting in FS1, we give children the tools to build resilience, empathy, and emotional maturity that will benefit them for life. At Sunmarke , we believe emotional intelligence is just as important as academic success‚Äîand it begins with mindfulness. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: Difference Between FS1 and KG1 in Early Years Education | Sunmarke School
content: Difference Between FS1 and KG1 in Early Years Education | Sunmarke School Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > FS1 vs KG1: Understanding the Key Differences in Early Years Education Choosing the right early years programme is one of the most important decisions parents make. In Dubai‚Äôs diverse education landscape, terms like FS1 (Foundation Stage 1) and KG1 (Kindergarten 1) are widely used, but what do they actually mean, and how do they differ? At Sunmarke School , we follow the British Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) curriculum , offering FS1 and FS2. This blog explores the differences between FS and KG1 across various curricula and helps you understand which path might be best for your child. What is FS (Foundation Stage)? FS1 (ages 3‚Äì4) and FS2 (ages 4‚Äì5) are part of the British curriculum‚Äôs Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) . This framework is designed around seven key areas of learning and development, including: Communication and Language Personal, Social and Emotional Development Physical Development Literacy Mathematics Understanding the World Expressive Arts and Design At Sunmarke School, FS2 (equivalent in age to KG1) offers a play-based, inquiry-led approach , encouraging creativity, curiosity, and confidence in a nurturing environment. The focus is on developing the whole child, not just academic readiness. What is KG1? Kindergarten 1 (KG1) generally refers to the first official year of early childhood education for children aged 4 to 5 across a variety of curricula. Here‚Äôs how KG1 typically appears in different educational systems: American Curriculum: KG1 is often the first of two kindergarten years (KG1 and KG2) and leans more towards structured, academic readiness in literacy and numeracy. Indian Curriculum (CBSE/ICSE): KG1 is commonly referred to as Lower Kindergarten (LKG), where early academic skills are introduced through more structured teaching. IB PYP (International Baccalaureate Primary Years Programme): Early Years in the IB system may also be referred to as KG1 in some schools, focusing on transdisciplinary, inquiry-based learning similar to EYFS but with international themes. Other Asian or blended systems: KG1 may vary slightly but usually includes a mix of formal instruction and play. FS2 vs KG1: Key Differences Feature Foundation Stage (FS2) ‚Äì British EYFS Kindergarten 1 (KG1) ‚Äì Various Curricula Curriculum British (EYFS) American, Indian, IB, etc. Learning Approach Child-led, play-based More structured (varies by curriculum) Focus Holistic development Early academics + developmental skills Assessment Observational, developmental profiles Mix of informal/formal assessments Age Group FS2: 4‚Äì5 years KG1: 4‚Äì5 years Why Choose FS at Sunmarke School? At Sunmarke , our EYFS Foundation Stage focuses on nurturing each child‚Äôs individuality. Our FS2 programme prepares students with strong foundations in literacy, numeracy, communication, emotional wellbeing, and social skills, all through joyful, meaningful experiences. Children learn through structured play , hands-on exploration, music, movement, art, outdoor learning, and early phonics and maths. This creates a balanced learning journey where children are academically prepared yet emotionally secure and socially confident. Building Strong Foundations for Life Whether you are comparing FS2 with KG1 in Dubai or exploring top-rated British curriculum schools, Sunmarke School offers an early years experience where every child is nurtured, inspired, and empowered to thrive. Visit us today to see how our FS classrooms are filled with laughter, learning, and limitless possibilities. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: How to Choose the Right School and Curriculum: A Complete Guide
content: How to Choose the Right School and Curriculum: A Complete Guide Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Why the Early Years Matter Most: Setting Strong Foundations in EYFS In a world where educational milestones are often measured by test scores and university placements, it can be easy to overlook the immense value of the early years. Yet research continues to affirm what many educators have always known: a child‚Äôs earliest learning experiences form the foundation for everything that follows . That‚Äôs why the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) isn‚Äôt just a starting point‚Äîit‚Äôs the launchpad for lifelong learning, wellbeing and personal growth. At forward-thinking schools like Sunmarke, the EYFS isn‚Äôt simply about preparing children for Year 1‚Äîit‚Äôs about nurturing curiosity, developing essential life skills, and building confident, independent young learners through a blend of play, discovery, and guided learning. A Curriculum That Respects How Young Children Learn The EYFS framework in the UK, followed by leading international schools in Dubai and beyond, is grounded in the understanding that children learn best when they feel safe, engaged, and valued . The curriculum focuses on seven key areas of development, from communication and language to physical development and understanding the world. In practice, this means an environment rich in storytelling, role play, sensory exploration, and problem-solving activities . At Sunmarke, for instance, you‚Äôll find children immersed in everything from phonics and number songs to planting seeds, experimenting with textures, or acting out imaginative stories‚Äîall under the guidance of caring educators who observe, extend and scaffold learning in real time. Learning Through Play ‚Äì With Purpose In the EYFS, play isn‚Äôt a break from learning, it i s the learning. Children develop critical thinking, collaboration, and emotional regulation through imaginative and structured play. Whether building with blocks, negotiating roles in a game, or investigating bugs in the outdoor classroom, every moment of play is carefully designed to support a child‚Äôs progress and interests. At Sunmarke, the integration of play with purpose is elevated through access to modern facilities, highly trained staff, and an innovative curriculum that promotes inquiry and creativity. Children are encouraged to ask questions, explore solutions, and follow their own learning pathways. A Holistic Approach to Growth The early years are about far more than academic readiness. It‚Äôs during this time that children begin to develop the social, emotional and physical skills that will shape how they approach school and life. With a strong focus on emotional wellbeing and character building, Sunmarke‚Äôs EYFS framework ensures that children feel secure, supported and capable . Through positive relationships and well-planned routines, children learn to manage emotions, build friendships, and grow in independence. The school‚Äôs commitment to character education and positive education (PosEd) is embedded from the very start, helping even the youngest learners to build resilience, empathy, and a love for learning. A Strong Start Leads to a Strong Future Numerous studies have shown that high-quality early years education leads to better academic performance, stronger social skills, and higher levels of self-esteem later in life. When children feel confident, capable and curious from a young age, they are far more likely to flourish as they move through school and beyond. Schools like Sunmarke understand this. Their EYFS provision is not only aligned with the highest standards but also enriched by specialist programmes, outdoor learning experiences, and an inclusive, nurturing ethos that celebrates every child‚Äôs unique journey. The early years matter, not just for school readiness, but for setting the emotional, social and cognitive foundation for life. In an ever-changing world, children need more than academic skills. They need creativity, confidence, resilience and curiosity and the best EYFS settings are where those qualities take root. If you‚Äôre a parent exploring early years education, look for a setting where your child is seen, heard, and inspired every day. Because those early footsteps are the ones that shape a lifelong path. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

it Prepare Students for University Offered to students aged 16‚Äì19, the IBDP is a rigorous, holistic and globally recognised qualification that equips learners with the academic excellence, intellectual curiosity, and personal growth essential for university success and beyond. A Pathway to Global Universities The IB Diploma is accepted by leading universities across the world. At Sunmarke, our IBDP graduates consistently gain admission to top-tier universities, thanks to the programme‚Äôs strong academic foundation and international credibility. University admissions officers value the IBDP because it develops well-rounded students who can think critically, write effectively, and manage their own learning. Our Sunmarke students exceed the expectations of competitive university environments. Academic Breadth and Depth Unlike other post-16 programmes, the IBDP requires students to study six subjects across a range of disciplines‚Äîensuring a balanced education while allowing for specialisation in three higher-level subjects. This balance enables students to keep their university options open while demonstrating advanced knowledge in areas of interest. At Sunmarke, students benefit from expert faculty, small class sizes, and personalised academic mentoring that helps them excel in all subject groups‚Äîfrom the sciences and mathematics to the humanities and the arts. Core Components that Build University Ready Skills What truly distinguishes the IBDP is its core: Theory of Knowledge (TOK) , the Extended Essay (EE) , and Creativity, Activity, Service (CAS) . These components cultivate vital university-level skills: TOK encourages students to explore how knowledge is constructed, enhancing their critical thinking abilities. The EE is a 4,000-word research project, fostering independent research, academic writing, and analytical skills essential for university coursework. CAS pushes students beyond academics, encouraging real-world engagement and social responsibility through community service, creative pursuits, and physical challenges. Global Perspective, Personal Growth The IB‚Äôs learner profile aligns seamlessly with Sunmarke‚Äôs vision of developing innovative thinkers and compassionate leaders. Through the IBDP, students grow into inquisitive, reflective, and principled individuals ready to thrive in multicultural university settings. Our diverse student body and international outlook ensure that Sunmarke students graduate with a global mindset, an increasingly sought-after trait in higher education and the workforce. Success Beyond the Diploma At Sunmarke, our alumni go on to excel in their academic and professional journeys, often returning to share how the IBDP gave them a head start in life. If you‚Äôre considering university pathways for your child, the IB Diploma Programme at Sunmarke School Dubai offers unmatched preparation for academic excellence and lifelong success. We invite you to visit us and learn more about how we help shape the leaders of tomorrow. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

content: How to Choose the Right School and Curriculum: A Complete Guide Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > Preparing Future-Ready Students Through 21st Century Education In an ever-evolving world, the purpose of education extends beyond traditional academics. At Sunmarke School, we embrace a 21st century education philosophy that equips students with the skills, mindset, and adaptability required to thrive in a complex global landscape. Our approach is rooted in holistic learning , combining academic rigour with emotional intelligence, digital literacy, and character development. What Is 21st Century Education? 21st century education goes beyond textbooks and exams. It focuses on developing critical thinking , collaboration , creativity , and communication often referred to as the 4 Cs. In a world driven by technology and innovation, we also prioritise digital fluency , entrepreneurial thinking , and global citizenship . At Sunmarke, our curriculum is carefully designed to nurture not only knowledge but also transferable life skills. This ensures our students become future-ready , confident, and capable of navigating both academic and real-world challenges. A Holistic Approach to Learning We believe that true learning happens when students are engaged on every level, intellectually, emotionally, socially, and physically. Through our Positive Education Ethos , students benefit from: Wellbeing programmes that enhance resilience and mental health Leadership and entrepreneurship initiatives that foster innovation STEAM and project-based learning that build real-world problem-solving skills Performing arts and sports that develop confidence, teamwork, and discipline This whole-child development ensures students are not only prepared for exams but for life itself. Developing Skills for Tomorrow‚Äôs World Employers and universities increasingly seek individuals who are adaptable, emotionally intelligent, and lifelong learners. By integrating character strengths , such as perseverance, empathy, and integrity, into daily teaching, we help our students become compassionate leaders of tomorrow. Our focus on inquiry-based learning , digital tools like AI and coding, and environmental sustainability projects also helps students engage with real-world issues in meaningful ways. Why Parents Choose Sunmarke School Sunmarke is known for its high academic standards , innovative teaching methods, and nurturing environment. We partner closely with parents to ensure every child‚Äôs unique talent and passion are recognised and developed. As part of the Fortes Education family , we bring decades of experience in delivering world-class British and IB curricula that balance academic excellence with personal growth. Join Us in Shaping the Future At Sunmarke School, education is a journey of discovery and empowerment. We invite you to explore how our future-focused, 21st century education model is transforming young minds into global citizens and changemakers. Enquire today to learn more about our admissions and how your child can benefit from a truly holistic education. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes

title: How to Choose the Right School and Curriculum: A Complete Guide
content: How to Choose the Right School and Curriculum: A Complete Guide Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login About Principal‚Äôs Message Mission, Vision, Values A Positive Education School Leadership Academic Results Inspection Reports Our Achievements Sunmarke Alumni Wellbeing The Achievement Centre ‚Äì Inclusion Department Our Campus Learning Nursery Our Approach Enriched Learning EYFS Our Approach Early Years Curriculum Enriched Learning Primary Our Approach Primary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Student Council and Ambassadors Secondary Our Approach Secondary Curriculum Sports & PE Creative & Performing Arts Enriched Learning Coding Sunmarke Mini MBA Student Council and Ambassadors Sixth Form Our Approach A-Levels BTECs IB Diploma Programme (IBDP) Student Enrichment Coding CIVITAS Careers Counsellor Student Leadership Signature Programmes STEAM & Design Thinking Environment & Sustainability University & Career Readiness Programme Fortes Pro Sports Academy Positive Education Global Language Academy Financial Literacy Programme Enterprise & Mini-MBA Programme Communications, Media & the Performing Arts Programme Admissions Apply Online Schedule a Visit Tuition Fees Scholarships Re-enrol Online School Forms FAQs For Parents School Uniform School Timings Academic Calendar School Events Calendar Policies Transport Services Dining & Catering Sports Hub Parent Engagement Governance Committee Activities Sunmarke Free Extracurricular Activities (ECAs) Sunmarke Paid Extracurricular Activities Third-Party Paid Extracurricular Activities News & Events Weekly Buzz Blog Press Podcasts Contact Us Work With Us Apply Visit Enquire VLE Login Sunmarke Blog > Education > How Modern Education Programmes Are Shaping Well-Rounded Learners In today‚Äôs rapidly evolving world, education must extend beyond textbooks and test scores. To prepare young people for life beyond the classroom, schools are increasingly turning to a variety of enrichment programmes. For example, Sunmarke School offers its Signature and Fortes 360 programmes‚Äîtailored experiences designed to nurture the whole child. These initiatives not only deepen academic understanding but also build character, creativity, resilience, and real-world readiness. Why These Programmes Matter Traditional schooling models have long focused on academic rigour. While this remains important, it is only one piece of a much larger puzzle. Holistic education‚Äîwhich includes emotional intelligence, life skills, career readiness, and global awareness‚Äîis now considered essential for success in the 21st century. This is where Sunmarke School‚Äôs Signature and Fortes 360 programmes come in. Whether it‚Äôs career development, sports, STEAM and innovation, or leadership engagement, these structured, school-wide initiatives provide meaningful learning opportunities that equip students to thrive‚Äînot just in exams, but in life. 1. Early Career Exposure Children today are entering a world filled with both opportunities and uncertainties. Offering them a glimpse into various industries through structured internships, job shadowing, or even student-led podcasts helps them explore their strengths, build communication skills, and make informed decisions about their futures. Schools that offer early career development initiatives foster confidence, self-awareness, and ambition‚Äîqualities that can‚Äôt be taught through theory alone. 2. Leadership and Industry Exposure Developing leadership skills in students goes far beyond assigning roles in school councils or group projects. True leadership flourishes when young people are exposed to real-world perspectives and are given the chance to engage meaningfully with professionals from diverse sectors. Programmes like Think & Thrive at Sunmarke School allow students to participate in panel discussions, Q&A sessions, and fireside chats with leaders from various industries. These experiences foster critical thinking, boost public speaking skills, and offer invaluable insights into global issues and career landscapes. When students are encouraged to step into the role of interviewer or discussion facilitator, they gain not just confidence, but also the curiosity and communication skills essential for future leadership‚Äîwhether in boardrooms, classrooms, or community spaces. 3. Multilingual and Global Mindset In an increasingly connected world, exposure to global languages and cultures is no longer optional‚Äîit‚Äôs essential. Language academies that blend cultural immersion with STEAM and project-based learning help young learners become open-minded global citizens. These initiatives prepare students to collaborate across borders‚Äîboth literally and intellectually. 4. Innovation Through STEAM & Design Thinking Encouraging curiosity and creative problem-solving through STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Mathematics) has become a cornerstone of modern education. Sunmarke School‚Äôs STEAM programme includes robotics, sustainability projects, design sprints, and even AI and VR integration. These immersive experiences allow children to tackle real-world problems, preparing them for careers that may not yet exist. 5. Flexible Academic Pathways Every child learns differently. Schools that offer flexible curriculum pathways‚Äîsuch as A-Levels, the IB Diploma, or BTEC options‚Äîempower students to follow personalised academic journeys. When paired with strong mentoring and coaching initiatives, this approach fosters clarity, purpose, and motivation‚Äîall key ingredients for lifelong success. 6. Environmental Responsibility and Outdoor Learning Education also involves nurturing responsible stewards of the planet. At Sunmarke School our Forest School sessions, sustainability challenges, and hydroponics labs bring environmental learning to life. These experiences ignite an early appreciation for nature and encourage students to think critically about their role in building a more sustainable future. The Real Value: Preparing for Life, Not Just School What truly sets these programmes apart is the real-life relevance they bring to education. From digital fluency in AI to collaboration in design challenges, students develop transferable skills that will serve them in university, the workplace, and beyond. Schools offering such comprehensive programmes are better positioned to develop students who are not only academically capable but also emotionally resilient, socially aware, and future-ready. When considering a school for your child, it‚Äôs important to look beyond rankings and exam results. Ask yourself: Does this school develop the whole child? Does it offer enriching experiences beyond the classroom? Some of the most forward-thinking schools, particularly those recognised for innovation and student wellbeing, embed diverse programmes as a core part of their educational model. In a world that‚Äôs constantly changing, these initiatives ensure that our children aren‚Äôt just keeping up, they‚Äôre leading the way. 0 Shares Prev Next Recent Blogs 28/11/2025 Career Readiness: Why It Matters for Students Today 21/11/2025 Expressive Art and Creativity in EYFS: Encouraging Self-Expression 14/11/2025 How Schools Can Lead the Way in Sustainable Practices 07/11/2025 The Rise of AI in Media: Opportunities for Young Creators 28/10/2025 Fortes Pro Sports Academy at Sunmarke: Nurturing the Next Generation of Student Athletes
